text: [Media Comment:] Hello, welcome to "Feng Ping". The incident of a Rottweiler dog biting a two-year-old girl in Chengdu has sparked controversy and heated discussion that continues to rage. Nowadays, many communities have begun to search for puppies running around and arrest them when they see them. There are also many media carrying machines to do live broadcasts, which is very lively. In this way, dog lovers say, "Dogs are mankind's loyal friends, and you cannot beat all dogs to death just because of one dog." Friends who are opposed to dog raising also say, "Freedom has boundaries, and your hobbies cannot "Become a burden to others", "From now on, all aggressive dogs walking without leashes will be punished", "If you don't lock up the dogs, lock up the people". That sounds very relieving. Which side of these two (teams) do you stand on? LMammoth News’ Weibo videoCollapse d

Why should a wild dog bite a human and kill all the wild dogs? Because only humans can be responsible for their own actions. It is legal to use dogs to kill people if they can be held accountable for their actions. Is it okay to have a Tibetan mastiff waiting outside your house to bite you to death and then the dog comes to pay for it? No one is responsible for wild dogs, it is the government’s responsibility to eradicate them. Of course, who wants to say that if a wild dog bites someone in the future, I will pay for it, that’s fine.

Why do I particularly hate uncivilized dog walking? Because it’s really annoying. Stray dogs don’t keep their leashes because they don’t have owners. So why don’t dogs with owners keep their leashes? They’re not stray dogs, but they’re just bastards. But whether it is a teddy or a dog larger than a teddy, it should be kept on a loose leash. It is not without an owner, right? It is not a stray dog, right? You can't always use "it won't bite" to morally kidnap anyone. After all, there are still many people who are afraid of dogs, and dogs are uncertain, and they may start biting people at some point. Not every owner can educate his dog well, because people are different. If that person hears grandma's "reminder" and takes the seat, and comes to find trouble with me, I'm not afraid, because I'm not talking about him, I'm talking about all the people who walk their dogs without a leash. If they insist on taking the seat, there's nothing I can do. After all, It is true that he walks the dog without a leash, and it is normal for him to take it in automatically, but he cannot say that there is something wrong with what I said, and it cannot lead to a vicious quarrel or the like. Anyway, people who walk their dogs in an uncivilized manner are just annoying. And I don’t want any dog to cause trouble or even injury or death to other people because the owner does not hold the leash, and then all kinds of messy things. So I hope that if you own a dog, you must be responsible for the dog, walk the dog with a tight leash, and be responsible for yourself. The dog is responsible, and he is also responsible for other passers-by. What do you think?

There are only a few stray dogs in the school, and it is not as troublesome as dealing with stray dogs at the national level. And as far as our school is concerned, I have never heard of a dog biting anyone. On the contrary, there have been a few cats biting and scratching people. But the cat didn't care. Handling it this way only makes people feel that the person responsible for handling this matter is really out of his mind. . . First of all, it will arouse students' resentment. Later student work will be more difficult to carry out because some students will be resistant. Second, it is impersonal. Do you think it will die immediately if you throw it like this? ? ? And still in the cafeteria? ? It's me. I yawned on the spot. I sat so close that I couldn't help but realize that the bowl was filled with germs from dogs. . . . Third, since you choose to do this in such a public place, are you still worried about students taking videos? Wouldn't it be okay to do it secretly from the beginning? ? ? I think it’s okay for schools to catch dogs out of concern for students’ personal safety, but if you dare to do it, if you choose to do it in public, you have to bear the possible controversy that will follow.
The law stipulates that whoever feeds a stray dog will be compensated if the stray dog bites someone.
Hahaha
Tsk tsk tsk

Let's just say that someone just said that if these stray dogs bite people, the boss will be responsible because someone broke the defense. In fact, those who break the defense will not feed them after they know this law, but they are encouraging some stupid people to continue feeding them. The hypocritical bs are pretending, and if something goes wrong they can eat steamed buns with human blood.

A good boss makes a fortune. But if these stray dogs bite someone, the boss may be held responsible. It is better to give it to dog lovers for adoption. Yang Di, Li Xiaoran, Xue Zhiqian, etc. will all like to adopt it.

I think the illegal cost of keeping a dog should be increased. There are many cases where dogs run away after causing trouble, and the owners do not take responsibility at all. At this time, if the victim's injury is relatively minor, our country's grassroots police force may not be enough to find the dog owner and then bring the victim to the door to ask for compensation. Even if the dog owner can be found, what can the victim do if the dog owner refuses to pay compensation? "There must be a mistake, my dog does not bite people." They all say that dog owners should be severely punished. If a dog bites you, you only need to get a rabies vaccine. For this kind of injury, there are not enough laws to even detain the dog owner, and the grassroots law enforcement forces do not have the energy to enforce it for such a small amount of money. Dog owner compensation. Grassroots governance is too complicated. All requirements to deal with people increase the cost of law enforcement. Faced with the difficulty of claiming compensation after an accident, I think the simplest way to prevent it is to treat unleashed dogs as stray dogs and hunt them, which will increase the illegal costs of dog owners. So now I face any content that only calls for punishment of dog owners and does not mention how the dogs should be treated. They are regarded as attempts to increase the cost of grassroots law enforcement and prevent the management of dogs. Hide d

Is there anyone who can help this dog? I saw him when I was passing by Lingshi Road in Baoshan District today. His whole body was red and he had a serious skin disease, and he was bleeding in some places. I went to several pet shops and asked, but they didn't accept her. The hospital was only responsible for medical treatment but not hospitalization. I didn't have the conditions to adopt one myself. So when I looked for rescue centers online, either my phone number was empty or it was full and they wouldn't accept her. Finally, I found the owner, who manages a nearby garbage station. There is a 10-year-old daughter who takes care of the dog. However, since the dog got a skin disease, the owner took medicine for a month and it didn’t feel better. I didn’t want it anymore (I took a look) The only medicine available is an antibacterial spray) The owner lost his dog once, but the dog found it on his own. I cried to death. I temporarily bought an Elizabethan ring for him to wear, and offered to pay for anti-inflammatory drugs and sprays for the dog, but The owner still plans to get rid of the dog, but it may not happen one day. I asked the little girl for a photo from before. It was really cute. The dog is now super well-behaved and does not bite. It was really uncomfortable. The little girl promised me to take care of his father first. Is there any kind person who can rescue and adopt? I am willing to pay the fee together. 2 Shanghai·Lingshi Road close d

Another child who was bitten by a dog and sent to the ICU for rescue had an owner, but no leash. I saw many comment sections saying, "Alaska is so docile, how could it bite people?" with expressions of disbelief on their faces. Everything that is owned by someone is animalistic, let alone an unsupervised stray dog? So many big V stars are calling for donations to set up a stray pet fund to save dogs and scared people. Otherwise, if stray dogs often appear in a certain area, don’t morally kidnap parents who are worried about their children’s safety and clean them up. If you say you won't bite, who will be the guarantor? At least if something goes wrong, you can find someone to take responsibility instead of just beating him to death. L Saitama ONE1's Weibo video is closed d

[A mad dog in Guangxi bit many people in the village. Police: The dog has been killed and the owner is being found] On October 22, a woman in Pingnan Town, Lingshan County, Qinzhou, Guangxi was bitten by a mad dog when she entered a store. Staff at the Pingnan Police Station in Lingshan County said that the mad dog involved had been killed. Currently, it is estimated that 5 or 6 people have been bitten. The police are looking for the owner of the dog in the village. The family members of the bitten woman said that the woman's leg was injured and she had been injected with rabies vaccine and rabies immune globulin. She said that an old man in the village was bitten on the stomach and feet by a dog and was seriously injured. The relevant person in charge of the village committee said that several people bitten by dogs in the village have now sought medical treatment. LObserver.com’s Weibo videoCollapse d

Celebrities don't care about a boy bitten by a dog. They only call for the protection of stray dogs. Why should we rationalize the disposal of stray dogs? Because no one is responsible for them biting people. The stars won't pay a penny. If an owned dog bites someone, you can seek compensation from the owner. But what about a dog without an owner? Who to look for?

I really hate that irresponsible Rottweiler owner. You really killed all the stray dogs around me who were neither noisy nor biting. It was miserable enough for them to be abandoned by their owners, and now they have to be beaten with steel rods. Beat him to death with a stick, and you won't even be able to resist before you die. Let me see how many lives you will bear on your back.

Record: Yesterday I posted an analysis on the psychology of dog biting in the owner group and was scolded. I personally like well-behaved puppies, but I am a little scared when I see a dog without a leash. One day I was riding in the elevator and saw a closed There was an owner with his puppy in the elevator. He didn't dare to sit on it without a leash, so he decided to take the next elevator. But I didn't estimate the time. When the elevator opened, the dog owner was still inside. The dog owner was very unhappy and started to blame me. This caused a shadow in my mind. After I was scolded that day, I spoke for the first time in the owner group, told my story, and suggested that everyone keep their dogs on leashes. I said it several times, but no one paid any attention to me. That day, in order to vent my emotions, I changed the group nickname to "Walking a dog without a leash is equivalent to walking a dog" (an online jingle). Until the recent incidents of dogs hurting people, everyone was paying attention to stray dogs, and some people said that it was true. I also support keeping dogs on leashes. Yesterday I saw a video on Station B. It was an up owner who patiently analyzed the dog's psychology starting from a puppy biting video and taught us how to respect and love dogs. I think it is particularly useful. I have never hated dogs. What I hate the most is scoundrels who walk their dogs without leashes. So I shared this video to the owner group, hoping it would help others. After that I went about my own business. As a result, I was watching the group this morning and found that an owner was scolding me in the group, saying that I was "endless, 💩eating too much", and her nickname was also changed to a sentence that scolded me. I took a look at her signature and it read, "A dog is always a dog, and a human is not necessarily a human being." (Apart from the aspect directed at me, this is what she said.) I would also be angry, but I think she might not be a human at all. I didn’t look carefully at what I was sharing, and started scolding me just by looking at the title. Then he replied: "I'm sorry, have you watched the video I shared in full? The whole video is about analyzing how to treat puppies better through case studies. My nickname is just for some uncivilized dogs who walk without leash. The scoundrels on the rope have never had any opinions on puppies, and they only target irresponsible dog owners. The puppies are punished because of the owner's irresponsibility. I see that your signature is also a dog lover, and I don't want to quarrel with you. . Or are you right? Are you the one who walks the dog without a leash? I don’t think so.” After that, I felt that the nickname was not very good. The dog was not guilty after all, so I changed the name to “dog walking the dog”. ” was changed to “dog-luo-ren”. I think everyone should watch that video, it’s really detailed. When we communicate with dogs, we must use dogs’ civilized and polite ways to avoid harming dogs and ourselves. Hide d

【】October 27, Hunan. The uncle was walking three dogs, none of them on leashes. The two small dogs were wearing dog muzzles, but the big dog was not. He met a woman walking her dog. The large dog, which was not wearing a muzzle, bit the woman's dog and then bit the woman's leg. The woman collapsed on the spot, screaming and crying. Some netizens claimed that the uncle refused to compensate the woman for all her medical expenses. What do you think for this? LGreat Bay Area Video’s Weibo videoCollapse d

Reply to @豆丝豆片豆丝片: To be honest, I am really speechless for people like you. Why should you define all stray dogs just because a stray dog bites people? Why should all stray dogs be allowed to suffer? to bear

The blame lies with irresponsible dog owners and the dogs that bite. But there are dogs that bite people aggressively, and there are also docile and kind dogs. Just like there are good people and bad people, will we cull everyone because of the risk of bad people... What we should do is not cull stray dogs. This cannot be done. To solve all problems, as long as there are people who keep and discard them, there will always be stray dogs, and the dogs that hurt people are not necessarily stray dogs, the probability is not high. What we need to do is to regulate the behavior of dog owners, and then ban the breeding of aggressive dogs that pose a greater risk of harming human rights. Once the dog-raising regulations are violated, fines and other punitive measures will be imposed... As for abandoned stray dogs, The issue of rescue is a difficult one. If an abandoned stray dog commits an injurious act, the punishment should also be clearly defined... Hide d

What is the relationship between pets and people? It's very simple. Pets are essentially commodities that people buy, just like cars and appliances, or to put it more bluntly, just like toys. When people buy pets, pets provide emotional value, a channel for emotional sustenance, and emotional comfort; and pets get three meals a day, a place to shelter from wind and rain, and are protected by their owners from natural enemies. danger. Fair dealing, everyone gets what he needs. In fact, the relationship is that simple. Cars, electrical appliances, and toys are produced on factory assembly lines and are sold as commodities; pets are also bred in specialized pet breeding bases and are bred for the purpose of being sold as commodities. When people find that cars, electrical appliances, and toys have been used for a long time and have various problems and they no longer want to use them, they can be sold as second-hand goods or sent to scrap recycling stations as scrap. The same goes for pets. Similarly, discarding cars, electrical appliances, and toys at will will have an impact on the surrounding environment and cannot be discarded at will. Since pets are alive, they can walk, run, bite, and poop everywhere, so discarding pets at will has a greater impact; what should we do? Woolen cloth? It's very simple, just like commodities, establish a second-hand pet market to trade second-hand pets, and establish a pet recycling station to slaughter pets. This is the optimal solution for society. Pets are bred from breeding bases and sold as commodities. It is estimated that millions of pet dogs are bred across the country every year. There are actually calls for the establishment of shelters for stray dogs. If such an institution is really established, it will really generate income for the pet dog breeding and breeding base. Those who shout to protect pets, those who stop dog-selling trucks to rescue pet dogs, if they can spend their own money to build a zoo for the rescued pet dogs, provide three meals a day, and show their love, then there is no need any problem. But if you are just responsible for the rescue, regardless of the follow-up, it is actually a selfish behavior. You gain moral satisfaction and desire for expression, while leaving the responsibility and cost to others in society. Hide d

The wait is finally here! CCTV speaks out for stray cats and dogs, and the views of legal experts are even more surprising: one dog is wrong, and thousands of dogs and cats pay the bill. After the Rottweiler incident in Chongzhou, Chengdu, too many innocent stray animals have died on the streets. Some of them were injured by residents in the community, and some were killed by security guards for the safety of residents. In short, their deaths should not have been such an accident. As time passed, we finally waited for CCTV’s announcement! This time, CCTV also spoke for stray cats and dogs! Is it the human's fault or the dog's? Looking back at the original Rottweiler biting incident, you will find that if you want to prevent the incident from happening, you only need one key person, which is the dog's owner. If the offending dog is led by a leash when going out, it is supervised by its owner. , presumably it cannot hurt the child no matter what. Unfortunately, the dog was not leashed and the owner did not surrender until early in the morning, so it was too late. The first responsible party in this matter is the dog, but the specific responsible person behind this responsible party is the owner of the dog. It is precisely for this reason that after the incident happened, the girl’s family will hold the other party responsible, and the dog owner will also Forced to surrender. Why shouldn’t people pay for their faults? CCTV’s views have also been supported by many experts and scholars. A law professor at a university even bluntly said that protecting animals is actually protecting people. A law professor is obviously an expert in his professional field. Why does he have such surprising views? I think maybe it's because this professor understands the essence of the matter. Many times, people deal with cats and dogs vigorously and resolutely, not because they are speaking out for justice, but to satisfy their own inner desires. People use this behavior to vent their emotions, thinking that stray animals will not speak for themselves, and we do not need to pay a price or bear any responsibility for any of our actions. But if such atrocities continue unchecked, then when one day those who harm animals are no longer satisfied with harming animals, where will they turn their attention? I think it is precisely with this in mind that law professors come up with the idea that protecting animals means protecting people. A professor at Tsinghua University also pointed out that human behavior is the main cause of stray dogs. This point of view summarizes many facts, which are actually deliberately ignored by some people. Some people treat cats and dogs as pets. They buy them with money and throw them away when they don't like them. There are more and more stray animals in the city, but why don't we think about why there are so many stray animals in the city? What did these stray animals go through before they became stray animals? Some netizens mentioned the disposal of animals abroad. Every pet owner has a responsibility for his or her pet. If a pet is abandoned, the pet owner must bear the responsibility. This responsibility is specific and will make them Don’t dare abandon your pets easily. With punishment, there will be fewer and fewer abandoned animals, and the number of stray animals will not be able to grow so fast. In the final analysis, solving the root cause of stray animals is not about dealing with the animals, but to prevent such behavior from happening again. This is reasonable and controllable. This time, CCTV has spoken out, as have university professors, experts and scholars. I wonder if these wise and rational remarks can make people who are trapped in emotions completely wake up and seriously think about the nature of this issue? Hide d
When a stray dog bites someone, who claims to love dogs dares to stand up and say: I will be responsible for L Nuanxi Jiang’s Weibo video

The incident of a Chengdu girl being bitten by a vicious dog is very distressing. In the final analysis, it is still a human problem. Behind countless dog troubles, they are the result of man-made disasters. Dog problems are essentially human problems. Vicious dogs hurt people, and the root cause of the problem is that the dog takes the blame. Dogs don’t understand human affairs, but people understand human affairs. If something goes wrong, the person must be responsible, right? The reason why there are so many stray dogs now is that dog owners just abandon them on a whim based on temporary interest. Over time, the dogs cause a lot of inconvenience and they are abandoned at will. As a result, there are more and more stray dogs, wild dogs form groups, and their wildness gradually becomes apparent. Emerge. In fact, this is nothing. Some dog owners are really not as good as dogs. They don’t clean up their dog’s feces, walk their dogs without leashing them, and let their dogs bark and run around. Not everyone is not afraid of dogs. If he reprimands his dog, he will immediately get angry and speak dirty words. The key point is that some people's dogs bite others, and they ask others, why did you mess with my dog, and insist that it was the fault of the person who bitten, and their hearts have become bad, and it is difficult to recover. I think it’s not the dog’s problem, it’s the people’s problem. It’s the people who harm the dogs. If you really love dogs, don't cause trouble to others. This is the best protection for dogs. People's lives have improved, and there is no objection to keeping dogs and pets, but they must not hinder others, must abide by social ethics, and must bear legal responsibility! Hide d

I feel sorry for stray dogs and stray cats. I don’t feel sorry for stray dogs and cats on the Internet. Who can’t use words or control stray dogs and stray cats? Who is responsible for biting someone? Did the person who was bitten deserve it? All owned dogs are at risk of biting, let alone ownerless ones.

I clicked it, and I was confused in the comment section. Dogs with owners are private property, and stray dogs that are left unattended should not be hunted and kept to bite people (the school has an association responsible for free-range pets).
Can you take responsibility for your words? If a stray dog bites someone innocently, are you willing to be responsible for compensation? ? ?

It turns out that the root cause of the emergence of stray dogs is that humans are irresponsible and abandon them. Pet dogs bite people because their owners are irresponsible and do not keep leashes. This has always been the worst result for human beings. The solution these people can think of is to give normal dogs food. poison

Dog lover? hehe. Are you responsible if a dog is off leash and bites someone? There are so many stray dogs on the street, why don’t dog lovers take them home and keep them? Is the dog your father or your mother? You can't control a dog without a leash. The dog deserved to die.

Personally, I think there is absolutely no need to solicit donations unless it is absolutely necessary, and returning them is necessary. However, we support the girl’s family to claim compensation from the dog owner. The dog owner must fully compensate for the medical expenses and all subsequent treatment and recovery costs, and promise to compensate the girl at any time if she develops related health problems in the future. At the same time, vicious dogs that bite must be beaten to death. If euthanasia is not convenient, the same can be done by beating them to death with sticks and stones, or strangulating them with a rope. Even if time could be turned back, no matter what the girl or her parents did, there is no reason to punish her with a dog. The dog bit someone viciously, causing serious consequences. The dog and its owner must bear responsibility. Nowadays, it is not the problem of a dog biting a person that leads to the wholesale eradication of stray dogs. It is the result of ordinary people being bitten and killed by dogs for a long time. There are a large number of victims every year, and everyone is intolerable. This is not a dog, but a group of dogs. If you really want to have a frank discussion, there is no need to secretly change the concept. This is not a matter of one-size-fits-all lazy politics. On the premise that there is no better way to deal with stray dogs and manage dog breeding normally, the necessary one-size-fits-all approach is to be responsible for the safety of the people and the next victim. If you do nothing because you are afraid of being told that one size fits all, that is truly lazy politics. The key is that there has never been a one-size-fits-all approach, not now, nor in the past. Dogs raised normally are fine, and dogs running around without a leash are fine. There are many stray dogs encountered these days. In the final analysis, it is not one-size-fits-all, but one-size-fits-all. It's not cut, that's the big problem. If you want to know what true one-size-fits-all means, just look at the Bamboo Rat. Hide d

Anyway, it was really cool this morning. The teacher explained that the information cocoon room listed incidents of girls being bitten. As many celebrities posted on Weibo, her fans might just pay attention to their comments and then go to the information cocoon room. Then the teacher said that if he didn’t like animals very much, he might see more perspectives. I'm different, I like animals but some people go too far, maybe like this. I laughed so hard just now in the artificial intelligence class. The teacher used a stray dog to bite someone. Who was responsible for explaining the accident involving an automatic car?

How to control stray dogs has become the most urgent social security issue in the safest country in the world. So, how to control the problem of stray dogs? This has to be said about Germany. The Germans' regulations on raising dogs are really strict and are engraved in the hearts of Germans. Let China copy it, there is indeed something worth learning from capitalism. Here’s a summary of some of the rules for raising dogs in Germany: 1. Keeping a dog requires the consent of your neighbors. When raising a dog in Germany, you must first obtain the consent of your neighbors and ensure that it will not affect their lives. You can't let your dog urinate randomly, and you can't let your dog bark at home and disturb your neighbors' rest. If you violate these regulations, you may be subject to fines or other penalties. 2. Dog owners and dogs must go to dog school. It costs 50 euros per hour to raise a dog in Germany. After your neighbor agrees, you have to take your puppy to dog school, from kindergarten to junior high school, and then the high school graduation exam. You and you Only when dogs get their diplomas can they enter society. 3. You have to pay tax for raising a dog. You have to pay it every year. Taking Berlin as an example, you need to pay 120 euros in tax every year to raise the first dog, and you have to pay another 180 euros to raise the second dog. If you keep a dog secretly without paying taxes, If found, a fine of 10,000 euros will be imposed. 4. Dog owners should buy insurance for their dogs. Dog owners should buy insurance for their dogs with a compensation of no less than 1 million euros. Under normal circumstances, German dog owners need to pay an annual insurance premium of 75 to 270 euros for their dogs, and dangerous dogs have to pay more than 30% more premiums. 5. Dog owners must spend enough time with their dogs. When raising a dog in Germany, dog owners need to spend a certain amount of time with their dogs. For example, owners should take their dogs with them when they go out, and they cannot leave their dogs at home alone for more than 3 hours. If you do not walk your dog for a long time, someone will complain to an animal protection organization. The charge is that you torture small animals. 6. Dog owners are fined 90,000 euros for abandoning dogs. German law stipulates that anyone who abandons a dog (including those who move and leaves the dog in the same place) must be fined 90,000 euros and may be imprisoned for 3 years. 7. A chip must be implanted and you must pay for it at your own expense. According to the European Union, all pets (cats, dogs, and minks) must have an ID number. There are two options: one is to tattoo the number on a conspicuous part of the pet's skin; the other is to implant it under the skin. Enter the microchip. 8. Adoption costs money. In Germany, adoption is not free. For example, in Berlin, the cost of adopting a dog is generally 205 euros. 9. Documents are required. The pet’s identity certificate and health certificate are essential! 10. Dogs are not allowed to enter some public places. Dogs are strictly prohibited from entering children's playgrounds, leisure lawns, swimming pools and other places marked "Dogs are not allowed". Anyone who fails to supervise dogs in public places will be fined 10,000 euros. 11. Feeding stray dogs is deemed as having custody. If a stray dog bites someone, the person who feeds it will be responsible for compensation. 12. Stray dogs that are not adopted are killed. In Germany, stray dogs captured by the government are killed if no one pays to adopt them within ten days. Therefore, there are no stray dogs on the streets in Germany now...

The problem is, if stray dogs are harmless, that’s fine. But they often bite and frighten people, but no one is responsible and no one is allowed to clean them up. What’s the law? Just to show that you are caring, do others deserve to be bitten?

I think the most effective way to deal with stray dogs and dog walkers letting aggressive dogs loose without leashes is not to achieve the goal by banning aggressive dogs. First of all, how do stray dogs come into being? Most of them are abandoned by irresponsible people. If effective management regulations are not introduced to prohibit random abandonment, there will never be a way to prevent the occurrence of stray dogs. If you are like some countries where you have to pay a large fine for abandoning a pet dog, you will see how many people dare to abandon it at will. Not getting a dog license for large dogs is not the best way to prevent dogs from biting people. Will puppies stop biting people? Some large dogs are more docile than small dogs and are banned from breeding if they are messed with. What usually happens when a dog bites someone is when the owner is irresponsible and does not keep the dog on a leash. Instead of going to the door to catch the dog that cannot get a dog license, it is better not to introduce rigid regulations to stipulate that dogs must be leashed when walking. Dog leashes must also be muzzled. Find some uncles and aunties who patrol every day and fine anyone who doesn't have a rope tied up. Look at who dares not to tie up a rope. (In the future, no one likes to have children, and more and more people will keep pets. This part of the fine can also become an income-generating project.) Instead of not applying for dog licenses for aggressive dogs and letting these high-risk dog breeds become black households, it is better to take the initiative to give aggressive dogs Dogs must apply for dog certificates, have mandatory chip implantation, and return visits every year, allowing families of aggressive dogs to take responsibility for caring for aggressive dogs. In this way, whenever a dog bites a person or an owner abandons a aggressive dog, each aggressive dog can be traced back to its source with a chip identification, allowing the owner to To shoulder the responsibility of caring for dogs, only some unreliable owners will really take care of them and dare not let them roam free and abandon them. There are often better solutions to many things, but one-size-fits-all is counterproductive. People have been raising many banned dog breeds for many years. Now that you are saying that they are no longer allowed to be raised, how will they be disposed of and thrown out? Then the dogs thrown out continued to expand the stray dog population. Can you catch all the stray dogs? Well, even if we vigorously arrest and deal with all the stray dogs in the city, then after this period of time, no one will abandon them for adoption? As long as the cost of abandonment is low, some people will abandon them irresponsibly and a new group of stray dogs will be formed, which will only end without end.

Yesterday, a bunch of so-called celebrities came out to support stray dogs, which suddenly seemed quite funny. The little girls in Chengdu were bitten like that, but they were not seen in a hurry and came out to condemn the unscrupulous dog owner. It is really a great irony that a group that even requires national legislation to restrict the use of leashes for walking dogs shamelessly talks about civilization and love on the Internet. You should hold on to the dog leash in your hands, that is true civilization, and that is true love for the dogs you raise. Don’t the so-called dog lovers want to learn from Western legislation to protect small animals? Let’s take a look at the dog-raising regulations in Germany first! 1. When raising a dog in Germany, you must first obtain the consent of your neighbors and ensure that it will not affect their lives. Can you do that for those dog fans who don’t even tie up a leash or even shovel dog poop? . 2. In addition to implanting a microchip into the dog, you also need to ensure that your yard meets the breeding requirements. The microchip fee is 1,600 yuan, which is paid by the dog owner. Human beings who stand at the top of the food chain are wise enough to use all animals on this planet according to their attributes. Only with a certificate can you begin to undertake special tasks in serving humanity. Even if you retire in the future, there will be strict procedures. Some people deliberately confuse them with stray dogs or vicious dogs. What are their intentions? It's like saying, you = human, tramp = human, you = tramp, the same logic... A few days ago, several celebrities were banned from Weibo for posting inappropriate remarks about stray dogs. The reason for their ban was "violation of relevant laws and regulations." Regarding how society should manage stray cats and dogs, we must first understand how they came into being. Obviously, humans actively or passively "create" a large number of stray animals. Sooner or later, they will be included in the social governance system ’s... So, humans should naturally take responsibility to solve this problem. what to do? First of all, we need to cut off the root cause and start from the source. Don't throw it away at will. If you don't love it for three minutes, you must love it for a lifetime and be responsible to the end. The second is to solve the inventory. Rather than seeing them wandering around or being hit by cars or beaten to death or poisoned or tortured to death, it is better to euthanasia. Of course, the best way is to adopt. Ordinarily, if we can't do just this little thing well, how can we still have the nerve to blame others for scolding us? The day when dog lovers can truly feel proud is when they gain the favor and recognition of most non-dog lovers. Striving to gain their recognition and approval and to reflect the qualities we should have should become our broad internal consensus and goal. Because only if everyone raises dogs in a civilized manner is the only way to break through the long-standing estrangement between groups and respect each other. There is no other way. We are just one of many groups, and there is no reason for others to accommodate us unconditionally. If groups want to live harmoniously, they must compromise with each other rather than confront each other... One final point. We are all responsible for the governance of society. Reposting this article by Lian Yue, I appreciate the clear logic. Human rights are greater than dog rights Original Lian Yue Lianyue 2023-10-2208:08 Hello Teacher Lian Yue: I have been following you for more than a year. I read your content every day or two. I already have the habit of checking in and reading. I really admire you. Your words contain wise analysis and suggestions, as well as full of positive energy and warm kindness. I'm having a tough time myself right now and would love to hear your advice. I am 45 years old and currently a stay-at-home mother. I usually like small animals and have been feeding stray kittens outdoors for two or three years. I have a one-and-a-half-year-old Teddy dog at home. In terms of family members, I have two children. The eldest is in high school, and the second is in sixth grade in elementary school. The eldest is very proactive in his studies and does not need me to worry about it, but the second child loves to have fun and is afraid of difficulties... He is unconscious in many aspects and needs my constant reminder and supervision. The two children are as caring as me and support me in raising cats and dogs. But my husband doesn’t like animals, and he doesn’t even like the smell of dogs that occasionally emanates from a corner of the house. I tried to raise corgis and pastoral dogs before... but I was always pressured by my husband's negative emotions. The Teddy I am currently raising is one that I fought hard to keep. He has been raised for two months and is now one and a half years old. My husband had no choice but to accept it, but he never helped with all the work of taking care of the dog, such as walking the dog in the morning and evening. I didn't care before and took good care of the dog. Anyway, I was at home. I took it out for a walk when I was buying groceries in the morning. I took it to exercise while buying groceries and exercising. In the evening, I went out for a walk after dinner. Circle, digest food and relax body and mind, killing two birds with one stone. But last month, my husband felt that the pressure to support the family was a bit high. In order to increase his income, he took the initiative to ask his employer to go to Guangdong to take charge of a project. All the housework and childcare tasks at home are piled on me. It’s not a big problem for the eldest son to live on campus, but I have to keep an eye on the second son when he comes back every night to eat and do homework. He is very unself-disciplined. Whenever I come back from walking the dog, I see him turning on the TV without knowing why. In addition, my husband has repeatedly expressed the hope that I would stop sitting at home and find a job to supplement the family income. I have thought about it again and again. I am still five or six years away from retirement. In the long run, I also want to have an ordinary career. So I started to pay attention to job recruitment online every day. Sadly, at the age of 45, most of the resumes I submit online come to nothing, and I don’t even have the chance to be invited for an interview. A few jobs require me to work morning and evening shifts, which affects my ability to take care of my children. In recent days, a company finally extended an olive branch to me. Working from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. six days a week is acceptable to me. But even if I leave early and come home late, and do housework, there is no time to take care of the dog... I started to think about whether to find a dog lover to adopt it, but I was worried about two things: 1. Will the other person adopt it? Be kind to the dog. 2. Will the dog be hurt inside? It always looks at me... The dog will live for more than ten years in the future. If it is unfortunate because of my wrong arrangements, I don't want to see it. Arrived. I am eager for the wise teacher Lian Yue to give me advice! 45-year-old innocent woman 45-year-old innocent woman: Dogs may be the cause of the most conflicts among the people. From time to time, tragedies involving people being bitten by dogs arouse everyone's fear and anger. These things would be tolerable if irresponsible dog owners could be held accountable and finally completely avoid biting people and disturbing people. Unfortunately, these things are often distorted by some people (basically stakeholders) and led into conflicts between dog owners and dog-free people, tearing the entire society apart, and reminding people of the previous XX Gong. It would be ridiculous for a family and a country to be divided, antagonized, and fight to the death because of dogs. In order not to be ridiculous. I feel that whether it is social governance at the macro level or raising a dog at the micro level, one principle must be followed: human rights are greater than dog rights. Not to mention the very small number of extremists who advocate that dog rights are greater than human rights, even the fact that many dog owners accept that "dog rights are equal to human rights" is not logically valid. Admit it, it’s hard to own a dog because buying and selling dogs is human trafficking. You can’t just give your newborn puppy to a friend, you must follow the adoption procedures in accordance with the law. You are less likely to spay or neuter a dog than you are to spay or neuter your child. The state also has to provide dogs with medical insurance and pensions. Human rights outweigh dog rights. From this point on, when you want to get a dog, you must get the consent of everyone in the family. You can't attack someone who disagrees as "unloving", his human rights are more important. When your dog leaves the house and enters the public domain, you must also know that the human rights of all the people you meet are greater than the rights of your dog. Let alone bite people, it has no right to disturb others or do anything. Dirty public places. And you must know that many people are naturally afraid of dogs, just like many people are afraid when they see cockroaches. Even if they know that cockroaches can't hurt her, she will scream, freeze, and be afraid. If a dog owner takes his dog to a public place and thinks from the perspective of a person who is afraid of dogs, I think there will be far fewer conflicts. If you think "everyone should love my dog as much as I do," then conflicts will break out at any time, you will be unhappy, and your dog will be worried and unsafe. Human rights outweigh dog rights. When you raise a dog, it damages family unity and increases family conflicts. Either it is financially unsustainable, or it makes it impossible for you to work. Then, dog rights infringe on human rights and adjustments should be made. Stray dogs (including stray cats) pose a hidden danger to everyone (especially children) - the mortality rate of rabies is 100%, and some children who are scratched or bitten by dogs may not tell their parents - for managers, if If no one takes them home and raises them, they have the responsibility to capture them to protect the safety of citizens. Otherwise, it is dereliction of duty. You should not feed stray cats in the future. They reproduce too much. Even if they do not harm people, they will kill a large number of insects and birds and unbalance the entire ecosystem. We should love the entire ecosystem. This is a greater love. . Have fun. Lian YueCollapsed

Accounts that spread rumors and curse girls should all be blocked. 4. To refute the dog owner’s statement that if you don’t mess with dogs, dogs won’t bite you. The news reports that a large number of dog owners are still bitten by domestic dogs after raising them for ten years. What’s more, wild dogs are more wild and can only be left on the street. There is a risk of biting if you get on them. 5. The so-called love is not love when the upper and lower lips touch each other. It only means talking and talking without paying any money. Those who want the public to share the place where stray dogs are taken are shameful. 6. Some people only mention that developed countries tolerate strays, but do not mention that developed countries screen out high-quality dog owners. The threshold for raising dogs is very high, and abandoning dogs also costs a lot. 7. The cause of the incident was obviously that the girl was bitten by an untied dog. In many foreign countries, once a dog bites a person, it will be euthanized. There is no exception. When a dog bites a person here, there are a group of dog lovers who feel particularly uncomfortable. If you are not allowed to do this or that, it is because the person biting is not you. Not your relatives. As for stray dogs, stray dogs are not caused by the so-called dog lovers raising and abandoning them again. Who will manage a large number of stray dogs and then throw them to government agencies. The government will beat the stray dogs to death, and a group of people will lament. Don't beat them to death. Stray dogs also want people. What dog lovers want the government to do now is: you are not allowed to beat dogs, you have to distinguish between good dogs and bad dogs, and you want dogs not to bite people. This is a problem that dog lovers have created themselves, and they need others to deal with it, and they need to deal with it in a way that they themselves cannot achieve. The best way is for all dog lovers who call for the prohibition of beating dogs to form a stray dog alliance: 1. Donate. Since so many celebrities have called for it, just donate. Everything requires money, establish a stray dog base, and be responsible for feeding and caring for them. Stray dogs will die of old age, supervise stray dogs not to breed with each other, and vaccinate all stray dogs. 2. Become a volunteer yourself and implement a shift system, with three shifts in the morning, noon and evening, patrolling areas where stray dogs gather in urban and rural areas where people live, to prevent stray dogs from hurting people. 3. Like other countries, dogs that bite humans are euthanized. Hide d

Last night, a caring old lady in our community posted a video of a stray dog biting a child in the group chat. I was thinking about this person who is the most diligent in feeding stray cats and dogs - the stray dog that almost bit me last year was the one that was brought into the community. She said she planned to adopt her, but she let her dog loose in the community because the family dog did not agree. Raised one - why did he suddenly change his temper? I found out this morning that she posted another video, to the effect that stray dogs bite people and the property management of the community is responsible. Haha, that’s it. Although the property management of the community is indeed responsible, isn't the biggest problem the caring people who admit stray dogs into the community? ! Want to feed stray dogs but are afraid of taking responsibility and dumping the blame in advance? This person's mind is really flexible! Now that this is the case, I, a legal illiterate, have to help the caring old lady to spread the law. So I spoke in the group: People who often feed stray dogs are regarded as dog owners. Stray dogs hurt people, and the people who feed them must be responsible. After I finished posting, I felt much better. There are many elderly people and children in our community, so we need to educate people on the law and build a safe and harmonious community together. Hide d
Who is responsible when a stray dog bites someone? Who will compensate the person who was bitten? Animal health? Community/school/zf? A dog lover who speaks out for stray dogs?

What a fool. You are not a dog lover. Have you never thought about where stray dogs came from? It’s not the owner’s fault for raising them and then discarding them. He is not responsible for them. Since he wants to raise them, he must educate them. , this is just like raising a child, there are good dogs and bad dogs, I’m really convinced, what’s the point of guiding public opinion! ? I admit that some dogs do bite, but I can’t generalize them all. Not all dogs in the world bite. Damn, you don’t have to love them, but please don’t hurt them.

Seeing those celebrities who feel sorry for stray dogs, I really want to ask those so-called celebrities: Stray dogs are pitiful, but aren't the children bitten by dogs pitiful? In your eyes, the captured stray dogs are pitiful, but what about the children bitten by dogs? Did he deserve to be bitten? In this people-oriented society, between dogs and people, shouldn’t the first thing we should pay attention to is people? Especially people bitten by dogs! Anyway, for me personally, I support catching stray dogs everywhere. Because I am afraid of dogs, especially those that are not tethered or muzzled. To be honest, when I went back to my hometown during the National Day, I was almost bitten by a dog. It was my grandfather’s dog, not a stray dog. What happened was that I went to my grandpa’s house for dinner with my brother, parents, grandparents and relatives, but because I was afraid of dogs, I subconsciously stayed away from them. However, the dog may be really sensitive to people who are afraid of it. It doesn't care about others and just keeps baring its teeth and barking at me. In fact, among the people present, my relatives, my brother and I were all strangers to the dog, but they didn't care about the dog's existence, and the dog didn't care about them. But when I showed a little fear, the dog wanted to attack me. When I was in my hometown, I rarely went to my grandparents' house, because to go to their house, I had to pass through many doorsteps, especially the house closest to them. There was a family that kept dogs, and they were still big wolf dogs. A very fierce one. The key is, if you want to raise a dog, you should raise a dog. After all, this is a person’s freedom. However, that family often leaves the dog on a leash and often leaves the door open. Every time I pass by that family’s door, I am always on tenterhooks. So when I saw the girl in Sichuan being attacked by a vicious dog, I felt very sad. Then I felt relieved that stray dogs were being captured in various places. Maybe it was a bit overkill, but at least this capture could reduce a lot of possible harm. Stop saying that stray dogs are pitiful. The reason why stray dogs are pitiful is not because they are captured, but because they are strays. Ultimately, the responsibility of the humans who turn them into stray dogs is still theirs! As for "my dog doesn't bite", that's your family's own business. You can let it go as you like in your own home. When you go out of your house and into public areas, you should do a good job of tying the dog, wearing a muzzle, and scooping out poop bags! People who are not afraid of dogs will never understand the fear that people who are afraid of dogs have for the existence of dogs! In public places, you should not only take care of yourself, but also take care of your pets. This is the best attitude when raising pets, especially dogs. Being less abandoned and more responsible is the best way to treat dogs! Hide d

I am actually afraid of dogs. When I was a kid, I was chased by dogs several times on the way to school. Even now, when I see a dog staring at me, I feel a little weak. The most serious time for me was when I was carrying my younger brother to play with friends. I saw a few dogs from a distance on the road. As soon as the dogs saw us, they swarmed towards us, barking while chasing me. I was carrying my brother on my back. My brother ran away desperately. After returning home, I had nightmares for two consecutive nights. In the dream, I was chased by a dog. I ran while crying. I was frightened and woke up in the middle of the night, covered in sweat. My brother is okay, maybe he's too young and doesn't have the concept of fear yet. The most serious incident for my brother was one year in Jiaxing, when we went to visit our parents during the summer vacation. I took my brother to find a friend. When we passed by the neighbor's door (that road is a public area), a little white dog suddenly jumped out of the room and bit my brother's leg. I didn't expect it at all. There was a dog, and I was already afraid of dogs. I was petrified and didn't dare to move, so I kept crying. The crying attracted several adults and drove the dog back to their home. Later, my neighbor paid for my brother's vaccination, but other than that, there was no other compensation. As for my brother, he had several injections, and my parents took several leaves of absence to take my brother to the hospital. No one was responsible for the injuries my brother suffered and the losses my parents suffered. Therefore, I agree with dealing with some vicious dogs that endanger personal safety. Because I've been hurt and I don't want to be hurt again. However, I don’t think we should kill them all. Just like people, dogs also have good and bad qualities. “One size fits all” for stray dogs is a bit cruel. However, we can’t blame the staff who carried out the work. It’s not easy for everyone. After all, if a stray dog bites someone, who will be held accountable? For example, if a biting incident occurs in the community, the innocent property management and security guards will be held responsible. They definitely don’t want this to happen, so they will not allow the dog to appear in the community. The same goes for other places. If you bite someone, someone will have to take responsibility when someone is held accountable. We are all ordinary people, and no one is willing to take responsibility for no reason, which results in the living space of stray dogs becoming smaller and smaller. If some people are willing to adopt stray dogs or take responsibility for stray dogs biting people, the current situation of stray dogs should be better. Therefore, some people should not just rely on their mouths to protect dogs, but also attack ordinary executives. Because you don't handle the dog, if something goes wrong in the future, they may be the ones to bear the responsibility. Why should they bear this responsibility because of your love? Let's understand each other. Of course, those who are capable and caring should encourage everyone to take action, such as donating money to build loving shelters for stray dogs, providing vaccination services, providing dog food, etc. In the final analysis, it is still a human problem. Dog owners should keep their dogs on leashes and muzzle their dogs; they should not abandon them at will; they are not allowed to keep dogs if they do not keep them; and when a dog bites someone, they must bear corresponding responsibilities according to the severity. Relevant community staff should do a good job in resettling stray dogs; vaccinations; sterilization; and control in place. I have seen how scary dogs can be, and I have also seen how cute dogs can be. I just hope that everything will get better, people's safety can be guaranteed, and dogs' lives can become peaceful. I hope that all aspects will become more perfect, everything will become better, and people and animals can get along more harmoniously. Hide d

I don't like dogs, but I don't think this matter has anything to do with stray dogs. It's even more excessive to have stray dogs everywhere! ————————When I was in junior high school or high school, I went to find my little sister who played well with me... On the way home, I met a vicious dog that barked very loudly. Its owner and two or three of his friends were standing on the road without a rope, let alone a muzzle. As soon as I got closer, 🐶 jumped on me. It stood taller than me... It scared me to tears on the spot... Its owner saw it, calmly pulled up the rope, and said to me with a smile, you Don't move, he will pounce on you if you move... That smiling expression made me think he was joking. So he took another step forward. 🐶 once again pounced, his owner grabbed it but couldn't control it. There I was screaming: Why don't you hold it? ! He and his friends said, "We can't hold it back! Stop moving." I stood there crying for a long time, and then they surrounded the dog and told me to leave quickly! I cried all the way home...I hate it🐶! Scared🐶! But I hate those people who raise 🐶 without leashes and are irresponsible even more! I have never dared to get close to the pug that my grandma has had for 6 years. Your understatement is that my dog doesn’t bite, so why can it be off the leash? The owner raised it but didn’t take the time to train it! Even if I can't control it, it still feels more ferocious! Why exactly? In the final analysis, this time it’s about people! ! ! There is no need to hurt innocent people. d

Dogs are friends of dog owners, not our friends. Rather than saying that I hate dogs, I hate some dog owners. I was bitten by dogs three times when I was a child. Once I accidentally stepped on the landlord's dog, and it jumped up and bit me on the forehead. Okay. I'm unlucky this time. The second time was when I was watching people at the intersection, a big wolf dog rushed over and bit me on the knee. The third time I went home and passed by someone else's house, the landlord opened the door and the puppy took the opportunity to run out and bit my heel. All three dogs were without leashes. From then on, for several years, whenever I saw a dog, my legs would go weak and my hands would sweat. I don’t dare to buy anything in a store less than 100 meters away. Even if I go shopping, I have to ride a bicycle. On the way to school, I saw a few dogs walking around and I didn't dare to walk past them. I had to pick up sticks or stones before walking. Don't say that my dog doesn't bite, don't be afraid, don't run away. When I was a kid, I didn’t know any golden retrievers at all. When I went home and passed by someone else’s house, the dog was half as tall as me. It didn’t have a leash. It would sniff around you as you passed by, and the owner wouldn’t pay attention. In order not to bump into this dog, I would do it every day. I took a long way home and Teddy, the most annoying dog, went out on a bicycle because he didn't dare to walk. As a result, he was chased and yelled at. People who only say they love dogs and dogs are human friends usually don't watch. I have not spoken out for victims, and I have never seen anyone advocating for dogs to be leashed and muzzled. Whenever they encounter a regulated stray dog, they come out to support it. However, please remember that dogs are the friends of their owners, not our friends. The world is indeed There are good dogs and bad dogs, but no one can guarantee that the dog you think is a good dog will go crazy and bite someone one day, not to mention that it is a stray dog and no one can be responsible for this. Don’t compare working dogs with stray dogs. Instead of asking others to protect animals, you should set an example and promote civilized dog-raising and never abandon it. After all, the appearance of stray dogs is definitely not caused by people like us who don’t own dogs, and we shouldn’t be left to worry about them. Hide d

🔺Answer to the private message: I don’t want to get involved in this quarrel over the issue of stray cats and dogs, because both sides have certain truths and flaws in their opinions, and there is currently no final and perfect solution. 🔺I also don’t agree with what some people call “lazy government”. Just like the management of mobile stalls in urban management, this is a constantly changing balance in a chaotic model, and it may not necessarily be the “perfect” optimal one. The solution may not be generalizable to all places. It can only be maintained in the local area for a long time and must be adapted to the local current situation and reality. 🔺Essentially, strengthening the management of stray animals is the people’s higher demand for the reorganization of social rules. In this process, we must be active participants in grassroots governance to benefit the people, and do not be passive service users. This is economical. It is social governance capital that can finally solve the problem of stray animals in one's own community from the direction of neighborhood and organization. 🔺Why can’t the rat plague in New York be solved? Because social resource allocation capabilities have become profit-driven and distributed, social governance in the United States is completely market-oriented, resource-based, and project-oriented. When there are benefits, institutions and enterprises will be benefited first, and if there is excess, the American people will be benefited. There is no market. When interests and market mechanisms fail, they become paralyzed. 🔺Universal rodent eradication in the United States is a matter of lack of market interest. This is certainly not a problem that can be solved by the U.S. grassroots governance system that only pursues profit growth and does not maintain socially inclusive growth. 🔺It’s just a bit funny to see some typical profit-seeking groups instinctively refuse to redistribute resources and take advantage of many people’s kindness and love for pets. Why does the protection of stray dogs now involve foreign forces? Obviously a biting dog has an owner, right? The current killing of innocent stray dogs is really the wrong direction! [[, How to control stray dogs has become the most urgent social security issue in the safest country in the world. So, how to control the problem of stray dogs? This has to be said about Germany. The Germans' regulations on raising dogs are really strict and are engraved in the hearts of Germans. Let China copy it, there is indeed something worth learning from capitalism. Here’s a summary of some of the rules for raising dogs in Germany: 1. Keeping a dog requires the consent of your neighbors. When raising a dog in Germany, you must first obtain the consent of your neighbors and ensure that it will not affect their lives. You can't let your dog urinate randomly, and you can't let your dog bark at home and disturb your neighbors' rest. If you violate these regulations, you may be subject to fines or other penalties. 2. Dog owners and dogs must go to dog school. It costs 50 euros per hour to raise a dog in Germany. After your neighbor agrees, you have to take your puppy to dog school, from kindergarten to junior high school, and then the high school graduation exam. You and you Only when dogs get their diplomas can they enter society. 3. You have to pay tax for raising a dog. You have to pay it every year. Taking Berlin as an example, you need to pay 120 euros in tax every year to raise the first dog, and you have to pay another 180 euros to raise the second dog. If you keep a dog secretly without paying taxes, If found, a fine of 10,000 euros will be imposed. 4. Dog owners should buy insurance for their dogs. Dog owners should buy insurance for their dogs with a compensation of no less than 1 million euros. Under normal circumstances, German dog owners need to pay an annual insurance premium of 75 to 270 euros for their dogs, and dangerous dogs have to pay more than 30% more premiums. 5. Dog owners must spend enough time with their dogs. When raising a dog in Germany, dog owners need to spend a certain amount of time with their dogs. For example, owners should take their dogs with them when they go out, and they cannot let their dogs stay alone for more than 3 hours. If you do not walk your dog for a long time, someone will complain to an animal protection organization. The charge is that you torture small animals. 6. Dog owners are fined 90,000 euros for abandoning dogs. German law stipulates that anyone who abandons a dog (including those who move and leaves the dog in the same place) must be fined 90,000 euros and may be imprisoned for 3 years. 7. The chip must be implanted at your own expense. The European Union stipulates that all pets (cats, dogs, and minks) must have ID numbers. There are two forms available: one is to tattoo the number on a conspicuous part of the pet's skin; the other is to implant it under the skin. Enter the microchip. 8. Adoption costs money. In Germany, adoption is not free. For example, in Berlin, the cost of adopting a dog is generally 205 euros. 9. Documents are required. The pet’s identity certificate and health certificate are essential! 10. Dogs are not allowed to enter some public places. Dogs are strictly prohibited from entering children's playgrounds, leisure lawns, swimming pools and other places marked "Dogs are not allowed". Those who fail to supervise dogs in public places will be fined 10,000 euros. 11. Feeding stray dogs is deemed as having custody. If a stray dog bites someone, the person feeding it will be responsible for compensation. 12. Stray dogs that are not adopted are killed. In Germany, stray dogs captured by the government are killed if no one pays to adopt them within ten days. Therefore, there are no stray dogs on the streets in Germany now...

After seeing so many discussions about stray dogs, I just want to ask: Who is responsible for stray dogs biting people😱Who is responsible for stray dogs biting people😱Who is responsible for stray dogs biting people😱

A lot of quarrels stemmed from different definitions, such as the initial liberalization and lockdown, and they were so quarrelsome. In the end, I showed the Shijiazhuang liberalization policy posted online to a friend in a city in the south who supported the continued lockdown. She said that’s right. We should continue to lock down the city like this! So sometimes simply saying that we support a certain definition can lead to misunderstanding. So I think it’s best to explain everything clearly one by one. Relevant legislation on pet protection 1: Pet market management 1, define the scope of pets and the list of prohibited pets, and update them in a timely manner. 2. Standardize pet breeding. Certificates must be obtained, the venue must meet the standards, disinfection and vaccination should be carried out on time, sterilization should be carried out when the age is reached, and the management department should conduct random inspections at any time to avoid the quality of garbage in the backyard. A chip is implanted at the factory, and you can scan the code to know the age, breed, vaccination status and other information of the pet. 3. Standardize the breeding of meat dogs. Like pigs, cattle and sheep, they are inspected and quarantined before leaving the factory. The sources of dog meat are subject to the same supervision. Restaurants selling dog meat do not dare to buy meat from unknown sources. Food safety is guaranteed, and the property rights of pet owners are also guaranteed. 4. The state will establish municipal animal management centers with funds from animal protection organizations, and subsequent operating costs will be paid from pet insurance premiums and fines for violators. 5. Referring to car sales, all stores selling pets must register information with the industrial and commercial and animal management centers and be connected to the Internet in real time. The sources of pets sold in the store must provide valid certificates. 6. The buyer will register and pay the fee at the store where he purchased the pet. The store will issue an invoice, register the pet’s sales and owner information, enter the information into the system and upload it to the management center. The management center will return the confirmation information before taking the pet out of the store. The pet's internal chip is updated simultaneously to add information about pet owners. 7. If an individual no longer keeps the animal, regardless of whether it is sold or transferred, all the animals must go to the Municipal Animal Management Center to go through the transfer procedures. 8. Municipal animal management centers and stray animal shelters are state departments and cannot be contracted by individuals. The staff must be established and people must take public examinations to enter the centers and shelters. Veterinarians and other related industries are given priority. 2: Breeding Qualification Certification 1. Regardless of adoption or purchase, a unified knowledge test will be conducted, referring to the driver's license. If you are not qualified, you will not be issued a qualification certificate. You are not allowed to raise pets without a license, and you are not allowed to "raise for others". 2. Because pets are different from cars, there may be situations where there is only one person holding a license and multiple people raising them at home. Here you can refer to the penalties for lending a vehicle to an unlicensed person: No matter what you do at home, you must have a certificate when you go out. If you walk a dog without a license, you will be found out. As for the penalty, if a dog hurts someone and causes a traffic accident while driving without a license, the penalty will be doubled. 3. I personally don’t want special pets such as snakes to be counted as pets. If they are included in the scope of pets, they should refer to the ABC driver’s license model, obtain a special qualification certificate, and upgrade the penalties for abandonment and loss. Don't be tempted to buy one and keep it for a few days before letting it go. Regardless of whether you buy a snake, fox or any other messy "pet", anyone who releases it will be criminally charged and financially punished. 4. The certificates obtained by large dogs and small and medium-sized dogs are different. Large dogs must participate in the physical test. The certificate holder must undergo physical tests regularly. Those who cannot control the large dog will not be issued a certificate. Large dogs are required to have one license per household, and one person is not allowed to walk two large dogs. Three: Breeding Code of Conduct 1. Do not abuse or kill animals. People who abuse and kill animals can easily escalate into crimes and should be arrested. Anyone who intentionally spreads a video of torture and murder, whether for profit or not, is considered a crime endangering public safety and must be punished. 2. The license holder will be deducted 2 points and fined 200 if he walks his dog without a leash or picking up feces; if the dog urinates on other people's wheels, he will be deducted 3 points and fined 200; if he abandons the dog, he will be deducted 12 points for three years. No more qualification certificates are allowed; if a dog bites someone, 12 points will be deducted directly, and the dog owner will be punished according to the severity of the injury, including financial and civil criminal penalties. 3. If a dog bites a dog, the injured party will compensate the injured party for buying the dog, and will be deducted points and fined. 4. Pets that exceed 12 points will be confiscated. 5. Dogs that bite people cannot be kept and will be killed. 6. Dog barking is prohibited in residential areas, and horn honking will be handled as if it is a prohibited area in the city. 7. Pet theft is punished as theft. The chip information contains the purchase price. If the amount is larger, the thief will naturally go to jail. Restaurants that purchase and sell meat from unknown sources are subject to penalties by the Food and Drug Administration, Market Administration and other departments. There are already relevant laws on this, so just add dog meat. 8. In the case of a car hitting a dog and killing it, refer to the division of liability for traffic accidents. If the dog is not tied up, the dog is fully responsible. If the dog is tied up and the dog is not going crazy and trying to break free at the time of the accident, the driver will pay full compensation and give compensation. A certain amount of mental damages. Four: Treatment of Stray Animals 1. The state establishes stray animal shelters at the expense of animal protection organizations. Until the pet market is completely regulated, the shelters are merged into the municipal pet management center and are responsible for temporarily housing confiscated pets. 2. At the expense of animal protection organizations, the state organizes dog catching teams to catch stray dogs. If animal protection is concerned about accidental injuries when catching dogs, the animal protection organization can catch them, or they can hire a professional dog hunting team. However, no matter where they are caught, they will be sent to a shelter for unified management. Private transfers are not allowed to cause management chaos. 3. If a staff member is bitten by a dog when catching a dog, the animal protection organization will bear the rabies vaccine, lost wages, medical expenses, etc. 4. The staff of the shelter are responsible for registering, managing the animals in the station, and implanting microchips. 5. Animal vaccines, storage costs, purchase of food and water and other related expenses will all be borne by the animal protection organization. The cost of the chip is borne by the adopter. 6. The National Stray Animal Shelter accepts donations from caring people in the society. The donation accounts are made public in real time. A scrolling screen in the lobby is updated in real time, and the website is updated simultaneously. Donors can freely choose to remain anonymous or make their names public. 7. If an individual has a stray animal that he feeds, and after getting familiar with it, successfully catches it and wants to adopt it, he can directly take the animal to the management center to have the chip implanted, pay the chip fee, and go through the relevant procedures. Adoption is allowed first, and the qualification certificate will be obtained within three months. That’s it. 8. If an individual feeds stray animals and wants to adopt them but cannot catch them, he can report to the shelter and request for arrest. After being caught, the feeder will have priority to adopt them, but he must first obtain a qualification certificate before he can adopt them. 9. If you are trying to catch a dog and are blocked by the person who has been feeding it, and the person who feeds the dog is not qualified to adopt it and is not allowed to catch it, it will be regarded as obstructing city management and will be criticized and educated by the police. 10. If you think the rations at the shelter are not good enough, the breeder can pay to buy the rations during the shelter period, and the rations are guaranteed to be used exclusively by pets. 11. Publish adoption information through social media such as official accounts, in order of capture time. 12. The adopter can choose the intended animal by himself through the public account mini-program. Each household is allowed to have three intentions. After checking, the appointment time is determined. 13. The appointment time is the time when the adopter arrives at the shelter. If the appointment is overdue, the account will be expired and re-appointed. If it is overdue three times, the account will be locked. Re-election is allowed after 180 days. 14. If multiple people like the same animal, they will be sorted by the reservation time. For example, A likes the civet cat and pear, and chooses the reservation time as 9:00 am on October 22, 2023. Then the earliest reservation time that B can choose is At 10:00 am on the 15th, the adopter comes to adopt with the qualification certificate, the shelter registers personal information, and the information is synchronized to the management center through the Internet. 16. If the intended animal has been selected, after the adoption information is registered, the intended adopters in the queue will be notified through the mini program. 17. The animals caught are kept for three months. If no one adopts them after the time limit, they will be euthanized. That's all I can think of for now, I'll add more later
