After the recent biting incident in Lonawe, many places began to arrest and even torture and kill stray dogs. Seeing the two groups of people on the Internet holding different opinions and arguing endlessly, I am really afraid to discuss this matter on a public platform. I am timid and cowardly, and I am afraid of being misunderstood and being criticized, but as someone who has had two extreme attitudes towards dogs, I still want to share my opinion. Before graduating at the age of 23, I had a very negative attitude towards dogs. When I was a child, I was bitten two or three times for no apparent reason, and I had to take a detour when I saw a puppy. What I remember very clearly is that my dad’s classmate from his hometown had a very big dog, and if he wanted to go to the toilet, he had to go through it. In the woodshed where the dog lived, I would rather let my mother take me to the toilet next door than to pass by the "demon" in my eyes. After graduating at the age of 23, I often spend my free time after get off work watching cute dog pictures and videos to heal my tired soul. In November of my first year on the job, my passion for raising a dog reached its peak. After dinner every night, I would search around the rental house, trying to "pick up dogs"; for a while, I would often buy ham sausages at a convenience store and feed them to the stray dogs around Zhabei Park. I really wanted to have my own dog, so after doing a lot of homework, I took a car with my friend for more than an hour after work on a Friday to adopt a stray dog from a pet shop near Gucun Park. From that time on, my love for dogs evolved from simply thinking they were cute, to treating them as my own relatives from the bottom of my heart. Raising a dog is not a casual job. You have to walk it every morning and evening, and you have to be ready to pick up poop with your hands when walking. Dogs are not always obedient. Sometimes they will not listen to your orders and run rampant, stealing food, and taking advantage of others. Make trouble when you're not home. These are all the preparations you need to make before raising a dog. You cannot just want it to be cute without wanting to be responsible for it. The lifespan of a dog is about 15 years. If you raise a dog, you must keep it as long as possible and accompany them until life. The end. But what is hateful is that many people keep dogs on a whim, causing countless tragedies involving stray dogs. So are stray dogs wrong? It’s the irresponsible dog owners who are at fault. After seeing the news, I repeatedly emphasized to my parents in the group that when I go out for a walk, I must keep a leash and even wear a muzzle. This is to protect the dogs and is also responsible for them. Because the family in your eyes may also be the devil in the eyes of others. Only by comparing each other's hearts can we reach a consensus. In addition, I have to reflect on myself. I am the kind of person who has no sense of boundaries when it comes to dogs. Sometimes when I see a cute dog on the road, I want to go up and ask the owner if I can pet it. This must be changed. It's normal to love dogs, but you have to be clear in your heart that every dog has different habits. If the owner says it doesn't bite, it's just for the owner and acquaintances. For you, a stranger, you may irritate it if you are not careful. Isn’t the news about a woman with her child being bitten by a dog on the street with her face covered in blood enough to scare you? Regulate your own behavior. If you have a dog, raise it seriously and responsibly. Treat it like a family member. Keep it on a leash and wear a muzzle when going out. Give way to people who are afraid of dogs when you encounter them in public places. Be more understanding towards others. Only by being yourself can you shut others up. I really feel that killing stray dogs is not something a civilized society should do. Beating all the stray dogs to death with a hammer is chilling. Some netizens will definitely say, why do you favor dogs when you still eat chicken and pork? What kind of saint are you? I really have nothing to say to this kind of people. I wish each other well. Finally, I hope that all these stray cats and dogs can survive this cold winter, and society can have a more reasonable solution for this group of lives.

When I first learned that the little girl was so deeply injured by the city’s banned dogs, I couldn’t understand why she targeted stray dogs. There were two main factors in the little girl’s incident: First, the supervision of the city’s banned dogs was not strong enough. Well, some people don't even know there are cities that ban dogs. Second, some dog owners lack rules. They can do whatever they want at home, but when you go out, you have to be responsible for your dog and you have to be responsible for passers-by. A leash and a muzzle for large dogs are the most basic. I have a little Corgi who is less than one year old. He is super well-behaved and never barks at anyone, not even once. However, I always keep the dog on a leash every time I go out for a walk! Why? Puppies are ignorant, and so are people? Later, I learned that the problem of stray dogs in our country is very serious. I saw many pictures of children being bitten, which made me feel distressed. I understand that the current killing of stray dogs is paving the way for subsequent supervision, so I also hope that there will be other cute puppies like Xiao Huang. , don’t be beaten to death because you don’t have a clear owner. If there are really important dogs around you, people with the ability and conditions still hope to adopt them. After all, it is a life. If you adopt it, please be responsible for it. If I don’t plan to keep it, just pretend I didn’t say so. Secondly! ! Strengthen the supervision of abandoned animals! Otherwise stray dogs will always exist! Popularize dog certificates and make real-name registration mandatory when adopting! Once a year! If discarded or died unnaturally, your credit report will be affected! (Those garbage dog owners who have not considered taking responsibility for their lives and are not mentally prepared should be able to think about it carefully, even if they are forced to do so.) I see that many people always take the companion animals that others invest money, energy and emotions into. Compared with chickens, ducks, geese, and pigs, I would say that such people must have never raised pets. Why are companion pets called companion pets? Because of the affection that the pet owner has invested in it, it is a small animal that has been raised for three to five years, especially when it is alone in the field, with only one small animal to accompany it, and it is afraid to tell the family about bad things, and it is hard to work alone late at night. When you have a breakdown, you can still have it nuzzling you to express comfort. It is not an exaggeration to say that you are a family member. On the one hand, I want to tell you why companion animals are different from those chickens, ducks, geese, and pigs, especially for pet owners. I also hope that pet owners can understand that not everyone likes our babies, so protect your babies well, keep your dog on a leash when going out, and wear a muzzle for large dogs! (I don’t mean that pets are nobler than people. I just want to say that pets are different from domestic animals. Pay attention to the key points and don’t be harsh.) Finally, I hope that the country can introduce complete policies and measures to raise the threshold for raising pets and raising the threshold for abandoning pets (suggestion) Sentences for abandoning pets), universal dog licenses, fines for not leash-holding and not wearing muzzles, pet biting has been raised as a criminal case, and retirement benefits for working dogs such as police dogs, search and rescue dogs, and guide dogs have been improved. (At least don’t put the lives of these dogs who contribute to society in danger) I hope the relevant departments can see it, and I also hope that there will be fewer and fewer dog bites. d

Stray dogs are being hunted, you don’t have to love them, but don’t hurt them. At around 22:30 on October 17, 2023, a student at Chongqing University of International Business and Economics was chased by a stray dog on his way home. After the school security discovered it, considering campus safety, the security guard The stray dog was driven away and died during the driving process. After investigation, the security personnel did engage in improper behavior in the process of driving away and dealing with stray dogs. The school has currently suspended the security guards involved. (China News Network) A two-year-old girl in Chongzhou, Chengdu, was bitten by a vicious dog. The tragic incident touched people's hearts and triggered the anger of the whole society against uncivilized dog breeding. Actions were launched to combat uncivilized dog breeding and stray dogs in various places. Among them, short video platforms On the Internet, the frequent killings of stray dogs, represented by Chongqing University of International Business and Economics, triggered heated discussions among netizens, and the public opinion field began to divide. Some netizens supported this behavior and believed that it was indeed conducive to protecting public safety, but most netizens were We express our opposition and condemnation, and are deeply saddened by this. Dogs are the most common animals in the world. They are not born with a standard owner. Nature and wind, snow, rain and moon are their habitat. The word wandering itself should not be given to them. The place where they live is Their territory, whether it is streets, trash cans or flower beds, we all live in the same earth home. Why not solve the problem fundamentally, introduce relevant laws and regulations, raise pets in a civilized manner, raise pets in accordance with the law, and use systems to manage and restrict them. And we have to choose this extreme method to kill all the dogs with one rod. There are bad people and good people. In the same way, there are bad dogs and good dogs. They are also living lives like us, with red color. Blood has breathing and temperature. Do you think the search and rescue dogs of the Wenchuan earthquake, the drug detection dogs at the border, and the guide dogs for the blind are less great than humans? We cannot exclude others based on generalizations in order to protect ourselves. As human beings, we should distinguish between good and bad, protect the weak, and find better solutions. This is what we should do. The root cause of the stray dog disaster lies in people's indiscriminate behavior, and the corresponding social rescue capabilities and management levels are insufficient. For the many stray dogs that cannot find a home, it is far better to introduce relevant policies to encourage social welfare than to use manpower and material resources to hunt and kill them on the streets. The organization participates in the rescue and encourages caring families to adopt them. For example, on October 18, the Linfen Small Animal Protection Association issued a document saying that the Linfen Urban Management Bureau sent all stray dogs to the base, where they can be treated kindly by caring people and their lives are respected, and encouraged the public to adopt them. In order to fundamentally curb the social problems caused by stray dogs, we should improve the registration and daily management of residents’ dog ownership from the source, improve relevant laws and regulations, increase penalties for those who abandon pets for no reason, and punish those who cause personal injury. Vicious incidents will be severely punished in accordance with the law. In short, it is a vicious dog that bites people. The root cause of the tragedy lies in the negligence of irresponsible dog owners. Innocent stray dogs should not be affected. All things in the world are equal. Humans should not kill innocent people indiscriminately. All living beings have the right to be treated. Respect, you don’t have to love but please don’t hurt. What stray dogs need is love and care, and they should receive reasonable protection. News commentsStray dogs put away d

Now this issue is very complicated, let me summarize it. First of all, not all stray cats and dogs bite people, but there are indeed many stray cats and dogs that bite people, mainly stray dogs, but stray cats can also harm birds (about this, we cannot say that this is an ecological chain, which will be explained later) ). Therefore, many people attribute dog bites to this one incident and think it is wrong to punish only this dog and this owner. If an owner's dog bites a person, he or she can get compensation, but who will pay for the stray dog that bites a person? Do you consider yourself unlucky? Some people will say that not all dogs bite, and those that do need to be dealt with. But how to judge whether a dog bites or not? After all, dogs are beasts and will not follow human laws. Humans have legal constraints after all. The dog may not, it may be hungry, irritated out of nowhere, or out of belligerence, etc. It may bite people. Many domestic dogs may look docile but bite people suddenly at a certain moment, not to mention... Unsupervised stray dogs. So should we wait until it bites a person before punishing the dog? This is obviously not possible. As I said before, no one will compensate the bitten person. Even if there is compensation, the bitten person will still suffer great harm. Some people use the analogy of humans. Although it is too lofty to say so, the interests of humans are higher than those of stray dogs, so the analogy cannot be made, and humans have various constraints. Human beings are equal, but humans and dogs are not equal. So how to solve this problem? Just kill all stray cats and dogs across the board? It doesn't seem to work. On the one hand, it's too cruel. Cats and dogs are different from chickens and ducks and are more humane. On the other hand, this will be resisted by many dog lovers. In addition, some stray cats and dogs have established friendly relationships with nearby humans, will not harm humans easily, and also provide humans with a lot of fun. then what should we do? I think we can set up an organization for stray cats and dogs. The members of this organization cannot be extreme dog lovers or dog haters. The management of stray cats and dogs can be like this. First, we must identify stray cats and dogs that can be tamed and adopted. Register and find an adopter. In order to prevent behavior that harms the animal after adoption, you can return for irregular visits. For stray cats and dogs that have not been adopted yet, if they have established friendly relationships with the people around them and are determined not to harm anyone, they can be vaccinated and sterilized to prevent the creation of more stray cats and dogs, and then managed by unified numbers. Secondly, for stray cats and dogs that are not sure whether they hurt people or have no fixed place to live, they can be placed away from cities and people, or placed in shelters (maybe this is more feasible), but new problems arise. Where does the food for cats and dogs come from? It is not a bad idea to eat leftovers if the conditions are poor. After all, this is what strays eat. If you care more about stray cats and dogs, you can also feed dogs that are more suitable for cats and dogs. Feed cat food, but this requires funds, so donations can be made regularly. I believe real dog lovers will donate some. Of course, if it is determined that the dog has a ferocious temperament or has bitten someone for no reason, it cannot be kept anymore. If the dog has a ferocious temperament, it can be released in an uninhabited place in the wild, or it can be euthanized if it bites a person. A similar approach can be applied to the matter of stray cats killing birds. Another purpose of setting up the organization is that if someone is bitten by a stray cat or dog, the organization can compensate it. The funds are also raised through donations. After all, those who agree to keep these stray cats and dogs should also be responsible for this. They can't just talk and not take care of themselves. Be responsible for your words and deeds. The smallest unit of an institution can be a community, or a street. Some people say that stray cats and dogs are members of the ecosystem and humans should not interfere. But the problem is that on the one hand, the emergence of most stray cats and dogs is directly or indirectly caused by human abandonment, and they are invasive species. In other words, they are not wild animals, so they are not part of the ecological chain, and even in cities and even There are no natural predators in the countryside, which will cause great harm to other wild animals. Secondly, humans will feed stray cats and dogs or place them in shelters to reduce their worries about survival. They will breed in large numbers, and even if an excellent ecological chain has been or can be formed, human excessive intervention at the top of this food chain and Protection will also further cause harm to other animals and plants in the food chain. After all, humans do not care about other animals in the food chain, but only care about stray cats and dogs. This is not selfish and self-motivated. Birds being harmed by cats and dogs are part of the natural food chain. Only cats and dogs who are harmed due to climate and food reasons deserve sympathy, right? Some people say that cats and dogs will not kill birds when they are full, but for some cats, it is natural to kill birds, and being full will only make them more powerful. But people don’t see the birds in the sky, they only care about invasive species. Of course, we cannot generalize. Not all cats are like this, so please refer to the above for classification and treatment methods. Hide d

The incident of dog biting children in Sichuan has developed more and more away from the incident itself. Various new chain reactions caused by this incident have been seen on the Internet: there are mothers who carry hammers when walking their babies for self-defense, and mothers who walk with leashes. Some carry sticks to intimidate dogs to clear the way, some poison puppies under bushes, some use syringes to poison dog and cat food, some campus security guards beat stray dogs to death, and some capture and lock up dogs in cages to guard factory areas. , some imprison large dogs that are not on the list of prohibited dogs, etc. People's focus on solving problems has gradually become extreme and antagonistic. Overcorrecting will inevitably create new conflicts and incidents. But shouldn’t the essence of the problem be the uncivilized dog-raising behavior and the corresponding groups of people? Why not solve the problem instead of creating it to ferment conflicts and deviate from the essence of the problem? As a dog owner, I support strict education or crackdowns on those who keep dogs in an uncivilized manner. Sometimes we hate those who keep dogs in an uncivilized manner even more than those who hate dogs or are afraid of dogs. But will killing stray dogs on a large scale solve the problem? Does the large-scale imprisonment of large dogs that are not on the prohibited dog list solve the problem? I can still see that in this moment of turmoil, there are still people who rely on the small size of their dogs and the fact that their dogs are not prohibited dogs and they walk without leashes. The reason is that the current handling methods are not based on the nature of this incident. The essence of the problem is people! Those who don't obey the law! Uncivilized dog owners! But the dog somehow took on everything. The problem of stray dogs itself is a persistent social problem. This incident caused a sensation and a lot of efforts were made to deal with it, but next spring there will be a new batch of stray dogs. The reason is not a human problem! Some people regard raising a dog as a responsibility, educating them from an early age, raising a dog in a civilized manner, and being responsible for the dog; some people regard raising a dog as a kind of fun, and want to throw it away as soon as the novelty wears off or makes people angry. The most important and core way to solve the problem of stray dogs is to put those irresponsible dog owners on the list for rectification. I was walking the dogs this morning, and a child in the distance said to his mother, "There are two dogs." His expression and tone were pure and happy. Dogs and children are not antagonistic. As parents of children and dog owners, we should educate children and dogs reasonably and provide each other with a safe, harmonious and friendly environment. Dog owners should walk their dogs on leashes, actively intervene and stop certain behaviors of their puppies, and actively avoid children or younger children without guardians present. Parents of children should also guide their children. Although puppies are cute, unfamiliar dogs can be looked at from a distance but should not be too close and do not touch them directly. Parents are not supported in simply instilling in their children the idea that "all dogs bite." At the same time, we should also stop children from barking, screaming, stamping, and hitting dogs. In short, such a safe, harmonious and friendly environment requires everyone to work together to create, maintain and educate with heart and patience. I hope that children will smile happily when they see cute puppies, and that the puppies can grow up happily under the care of responsible owners. Hide d

The lesson from this incident is: Don’t pet a dog that is not your own, even if it looks docile and cute. Parents, especially, need to educate their children about this. What should you do if you encounter a vicious dog? Let me talk about my experience. Yesterday, a netizen communicated with me and said: "I am naturally afraid of dogs." When I see a dog, I get scared and want to hide. In fact, any animal will be naturally timid when it sees other animals that are larger than itself. Ordinary small and medium-sized dogs are more afraid of people. When a dog barks at people, it is a sign of vigilance and self-defense. Moreover, dogs have been domesticated by humans for a long time and are close to humans. At least they basically coexist peacefully. In most cases, dogs do not dare to actively provoke and bite humans... Dogs are highly intelligent animals. They can understand and understand. Human expression. When people get along with dogs, don't be afraid. There is no need to be afraid. When you see a dog, you should be calm and domineering. If you show timidity, some dogs are "bad" and will bully you. From my experience, when you see a dog, you can look him in the eyes and don’t be timid. When getting along with an unfamiliar dog at close range, do not make any moves that would make the dog mistakenly think that you are going to attack him. This can easily cause the dog to misjudge and attack you "by striking first". If the dog is not your own, don’t pet it easily, even if it looks very docile and cute. Parents especially need to educate their children about this. If you see a dog barking at you, it may attack you. Stomp your feet, shout, or bend down to pick up something and beat it. If you have other objects in your hand, resolutely defend yourself and wave the object in your hand to calm it down. If you do the above, 99%+ dogs will not dare to bully you. It is particularly worth mentioning that when a person and a dog are in confrontation, do not turn around and run easily. If the person runs first, the dog will naturally catch up and bite. Of course, as a dog owner, you must raise dogs in a civilized manner. If you raise a dog in the city, you cannot raise a violent dog. You must walk the dog on a leash. If you have a dog, you must be responsible for the dog and cannot abandon it casually. Hide d

[Afternoon Investigation: From Rottweiler bites to stray dogs being hunted] The incident of a pet Rottweiler biting a two-year-old child in Chengdu, Sichuan, has made dogs in the city the focus of law enforcement agencies in many places, and has also made dogs in the city the focus of many law enforcement agencies. The issue of how humans and animals can coexist has once again become the focus of controversy among Chinese netizens. According to reports from China News Service, Upstream News and other Chinese media, a two-year-old girl was bitten by an unsupervised Rottweiler in a community in Chongzhou City, Chengdu on Monday (October 16). It caused a rupture of the right kidney, abdominal effusion, and multiple skin lacerations on the chest and back. As of now, he is still in a coma. He is being treated in the Children's ICU of West China Hospital of Sichuan University and his vital signs are stable. A two-year-old girl was seriously injured by an unsupervised Rottweiler in a community in Chongzhou City, Chengdu on Monday (October 16). She is still receiving treatment in the children's ICU. The picture shows the surveillance footage at the time of the incident. (Internet) The Chongzhou City Joint Investigation Team reported on Tuesday (October 17) that the injurious black Rottweiler ran into the community and bit the girl on the morning of the incident. It was captured at about 10 o'clock that night, and its owner Tang Mou also He arrived at the case early the next morning and was subject to criminal coercive measures in accordance with the law. Xinhua News Agency reported on Wednesday (October 18), citing the Sichuan Provincial Public Security Department, that Tang had been criminally detained. While praying for the injured girl's speedy recovery, many Chinese netizens started a heated debate on how to prevent such an incident from happening again. Moderates believe that civilized dog breeding should be promoted, dog management and owners' responsibilities should be standardized, and punishments for owners of injurious pets should be increased, while radicals advocate that pet dog ownership should be restricted on a large scale and stray dogs should be hunted down comprehensively. To avoid future troubles. Due to the tragic cost of the girl's serious injury and the pressure of public opinion, many places in China have announced to strengthen the management of dog breeding, including grassroots law enforcement agencies carrying out inspections of pet dogs in the region, and punishing those who walk their dogs without leashes and those who keep prohibited dog breeds. , and capture and deal with stray dogs, etc. On Chinese social media platforms such as Weibo, Douyin, and Xiaohongshu, under almost every post about law enforcement agencies punishing illegal dog owners or catching stray dogs, you can see netizens arguing with each other. The core of the debate can be roughly summarized as who is responsible for injuries caused by animals, how to deal with stray animals, and whether the rights of pets are protected. Who is responsible for injuries caused by animals? For pets with owners, this question is easy to answer: According to China's Civil Code, if a raised animal causes damage to others, the animal owner or manager shall bear tort liability. In the Chengdu Rottweiler injury incident, Zhou Zhaocheng, the victim's attorney, also issued a statement saying that the case has been filed as a criminal case by the public security organs. The dog owner may be suspected of negligent causing serious injury, or suspected of negligently endangering public safety in dangerous ways. In addition, they will also pursue the tort liability of the property in the community where the incident occurred. However, in many minor incidents where pets hurt people or disturb residents, grassroots law enforcement agencies do not resort to legal action, but instead try to reconcile the two parties with the mentality of "making it a trivial matter." Although this kind of handling method is more humane, it also leaves many people with the impression that dog owners are confident and will not take responsibility. The human touch has also become a dilemma for many local grassroots departments when implementing local dog management regulations. Rottweilers are large dogs that can weigh more than 50 kilograms. They are often used as guard dogs and police dogs because of their high vigilance and aggressiveness. Rottweilers are banned in Mianyang, Sichuan, but are not banned in Chengdu (Internet) Since there are no unified national regulations, most dog breeding management regulations in China are formulated by cities, or even provinces. Differences arise: For example, Rottweiler is a banned dog breed in Mianyang, Sichuan, but not banned in Chengdu. Therefore, despite the regulations, it is not easy for grassroots law enforcement officers to persuade owners to give up their dogs that they have kept for many years and can be kept in the next city. Due to the difficult situation, coupled with the large number of dog owners, the difficulty and cost of law enforcement to investigate one by one are too high. In many cases, the relevant departments turn a blind eye to dog breeds that are outside the regulations. As for punishments for uncivilized behaviors such as not picking up feces and walking dogs without leashes, they are often in vain due to factors such as difficulty in supervision and light punishment. The loose management in the past also led to more obstacles when officials wanted to strictly enforce it. For example, this week a community in Xi'an proposed a house-to-house cleanup of banned dogs, and Henan law enforcement officers arrested banned pet French bulldogs on the streets, which aroused the dissatisfaction of many netizens. Henan law enforcement officers arrested banned pet French bulldogs on the streets, causing dissatisfaction among many netizens. (Internet) How to deal with stray animals? Although there is some evidence to support the accountability of owned pets for injuring people, it is difficult to hold accountable stray animals for injuring people in cities: Although the law stipulates that the original owners of abandoned pets who injure people are responsible, and those who feed stray animals for a long time must also bear certain responsibilities, but in actual practice It's almost impossible to get up. Therefore, once relevant disputes arise and attract attention, the grassroots approach in many places in China is to kill stray animals on a large scale in the area. However, such a one-size-fits-all approach to law enforcement is not only unacceptable to animal rights activists, but also makes netizens question why "one dog makes a mistake and all dogs sit down together." According to a 2021 report from China's state-run media CCTV News, approximately 40 million people in China are bitten by cats and dogs every year, many of which are caused by stray animals. However, it is difficult for public opinion to reach a consensus on the issue of which is more important, the survival rights of stray animals and the safety of the people. For example, after the security guards of Chongqing University of International Business and Economics captured and killed a stray dog on campus on Tuesday, a large number of students were dissatisfied. The school also suspended the dog on Friday (October 20) on the grounds of "improper behavior during the disposal process." Security guard suspended. Students of Chongqing University of International Business and Economics laid flowers in memory of the dead stray dog "Xiao Huang" on campus. (Internet) There are no winners in this incident: the stray dog lost its life, the dissatisfied students no longer trust the school, and the suspended security guard is also very unjust in the eyes of netizens who support vigorous control of stray animals. In addition to students and ordinary netizens, there are also Chinese celebrities who end up fighting for stray dogs. Among them, Hong Kong Academy Award-winning actress Liu Yase posted on Weibo on Friday that "not all stray dogs are bad dogs" and called for "stop killing animals." Comedian Yang Di also posted a video on Douyin on the same day, condemning the owner's behavior of not keeping a leash in the Chengdu Rottweiler incident, and calling on everyone to "don't like dogs, but please don't hurt them." One thing the two artists have in common is that they are both dog owners. Are pets’ rights protected? Having compassion for stray animals is not only out of respect for life. For many pet owners, it may also be because they are worried that one-size-fits-all treatment methods such as killing will one day be adopted for their pets. This is not without precedent. During the COVID-19 epidemic, from 2021 to 2022, from the third-tier cities of Jiangxi Shangrao and Hebei Langfang to the metropolitan Shanghai, pet cats and dogs were "sterilized" and "harmlessly disposed" on the grounds of epidemic prevention. Although Each time it aroused public outrage, but in the end it was ignored. In addition, although it was not implemented in the end, Shijiazhuang issued a document requiring that negative dogs be sent away, all positive dogs and stray dogs be killed, and a complete ban on dog breeding in the area for three years, on the grounds of preventing "Kala-azar". The mainstream view is that the lack of animal protection laws is the core reason for these chaos and the fear of more than 67 million pet owners in China. Since the beginning of the 21st century, Chinese non-governmental organizations, legal experts and National People's Congress representatives have repeatedly proposed that an animal protection law covering pets and urban animals should be established, but so far there has been no progress in relevant legislation. When experts proposed a draft proposal for an animal protection law in 2009, China Youth Daily wrote an article saying that due to China’s complex national conditions and uneven development, “code-based animal protection laws should be slowed down in China”; more than ten years later, in 2023 When "China Environment News" quoted legal experts commenting on why animal protection laws are difficult to establish, they still emphasized the need to "appropriately take into account local customs while conforming to national conditions." Although legislative protection cannot eliminate conflicts between animals and people, and countries with relevant laws often cause dissatisfaction due to the legal handling of individual cases, for animal protectionists and pet owners, as well as grassroots law enforcement officers, if there are upper-level laws Providing protection and guidance will surely reduce a lot of trouble. On the other hand, if relevant laws and regulations are not perfected, it will also have a big impact on the currently booming pet “it economy”. China's pet consumption market has been booming in recent years, and some consulting organizations predict that it may exceed one trillion yuan in five years. The picture shows pet cats on display at the 2023 Tianjin International Pet Industry Expo. (China News Service) According to the "2023 China Pet Content Value Research White Paper" released by iResearch in April, the scale of China's pet consumption market in 2022 will be approximately 311.7 billion yuan (RMB, the same below, approximately S$59 billion). The agency predicts that as pet household penetration and industry maturity continue to increase, the pet consumer market will continue to grow in the future. The market size is expected to be approximately 392.4 billion yuan in 2023 and may reach 811.4 billion yuan in 2025. In the next five years, It is expected to exceed one trillion within this year. As China solves the problem of food and clothing and moves into a moderately prosperous society, the number of people keeping pets continues to increase, and people's emotional sustenance for pets is also increasing day by day. But if this group’s needs for a sense of security and transparency of rules cannot be taken seriously and met, I am afraid that more conflicts will be intensified in the future. (Source: Lianhe Zaobao author Chake) Close d

Tell me something serious. For all social issues, before discussing whether it should be done or not, we must first discuss who will pay for it. Discussions about whether something should be done or not often turn into empty moral debates. But if we discuss who should pay the bill, we can often find the answer quickly based on reality. This principle is particularly applicable to politically correct issues such as women's rights, animal welfare, and environmental protection. For example, the topic of these two days. A lot of people are debating whether to protect the rights of stray dogs, but the real practical discussion should be, if the rights of stray dogs are to be protected, who will pay the bill? For example, in many people's minds, Germany is the model for animal protection, right? How does their animal protection law protect the rights of pets, and who pays the bill? Their idea is that the best way to get rid of stray dogs is to prevent their owners from abandoning them as a rule. "Germany's Animal Protection Law emphasizes that it is illegal to abandon pet dogs at will. Once discovered, the fine can be up to 90,000 euros (approximately RMB 680,000)." What should you do if you say you can't pay the fine? It doesn't matter, I have been on guard against this trick for a long time. All dog owners must pay pet insurance similar to compulsory traffic insurance. The amount is USD 250/year (2020 data). You see, now it becomes clear who will pay for pet rights? It's not a slogan or a quarrel on the Internet - it's all pet owners footing the bill through compulsory payment of taxes and fees. So when you talk about how good a foreign country is, don’t just look at what they do well, but also look at what they pay for behind the scenes. Wool comes from sheep, and foreign pet dog-related rights and interests are based on pet-related taxes and insurance. If you ask all domestic pet owners to pay 1,500 yuan per year for compulsory traffic insurance, and use this money to pay compensation and protect their rights and interests, many problems can be solved. The number of car accidents in China every year is not a small number, so why is there not much debate online? Everyone has insurance and the compensation is covered, so naturally they are too lazy to argue. Therefore, I suggest that everyone should not engage in empty moral debates on the issue of animal protection. Since they keep saying that Germany does a good job in animal protection, and there is protection here and protection there, then we should study it systematically and holistically. We need to learn not only about the protection of people’s rights, but also about the payment of fees. It’s not like, “I want pet rights protection abroad. If you don’t provide it, you will become a backward and decadent uncivilized country without learning.” “But you want to ask for payment regulations for pets abroad. This is obviously what society should provide. How can you be so embarrassed? You want money!" Just rights, no obligations, right? Hide d

Morgan Stanley: The 60/40 stock and bond investment strategy may regain its strength. Compared with the historical levels of various asset classes, fixed income products are currently particularly cheap compared to stocks. On the basis of foreign exchange hedging, European and Japanese Stocks are cheaper than most other assets, and euro-denominated assets are cheaper than dollar-denominated assets. Morgan Stanley pointed out that in this context, the traditional 60/40 investment portfolio (that is, a moderately risky combination of 60% stocks and 40% bonds) may once again become a viable strategy. In fact, fixed income is currently particularly cheap compared to equities relative to historical levels across asset classes. On a FX-hedged basis, European and Japanese stocks are cheaper than most other assets, while euro-denominated assets are cheaper than dollar-denominated assets. Additionally, our estimates of optimal allocations to agency mortgage-backed securities have increased over the past year, while allocations to investment-grade credit have declined correspondingly, reflecting the fact that mortgages are more valuable to other markets Advantage. Against this backdrop, the traditional 60/40 portfolio (a moderately risky mix of 60% stocks and 40% bonds) may once again become a viable strategy after both stocks and bonds were hit by record inflation and aggressive economic growth in 2022. The drag of rising interest rates has led to poor performance of the 60/40 portfolio. It now appears that with long-term expected returns for most assets soaring, the $60/40 portfolio's expected average annual return over the next 10 years is expected to increase to 8%, having last hit this high in 2013 . At the same time, the average annual return on the 60/40 euro portfolio is likely to reach 7.7% over the next 10 years, a new high since 2011. Although long-term expected returns have picked up, the stock-bond correlation is already high for the 60/40 strategy. We continue to believe that a 60/40 portfolio is helpful in diversifying risk and smoothing volatility, primarily due to the low-risk nature of bonds rather than their low correlation with equities, which is exacerbated by increased bond volatility. kind of worry. The question that has attracted much attention is whether the high correlation between stocks and bonds will return to normal. There is a school of thought that says not, and perhaps surprisingly, a school of thought that says it’s all about artificial intelligence. Over the past 30 years, the positive correlation between economic growth and inflation has been an important factor in the negative correlation between stocks and bonds. Rising inflation erodes bond returns, while rising stock returns from economic growth offset falling bond returns, and vice versa. But in the context of the increasing popularity of artificial intelligence technology, we could see an economic boost and lower inflation in the short term, which poses a threat to the assumption that stock and bond returns will show low or negative correlation in the future. In other words, as has been the case this year, bonds will no longer be the great diversifier they have been for the past 30 years. Hide d

China Radio and Television: From Chaser to Innovator At present, my country is at the forefront of the world in the systematic development of "5G + Industrial Internet", with more than 8,000 "5G + Industrial Internet" projects, more than 240 influential industrial Internet platforms, and more than 89 million connected devices. Taiwan/set, the scale of the industrial Internet industry has exceeded 1.2 trillion yuan, and its applications have expanded to 49 major categories of the national economy. Recently, Song Qizhu, Chairman of China Radio and Television, delivered a keynote speech at the "2023 China 5G + Industrial Internet Conference" and mentioned that China Radio and Television has actively promoted the industrial Internet with key technologies such as 5G positioning, 5GLAN, RedCap, synaesthesia integration and passive IoT. With innovative development, it has created more than 100 benchmark demonstration cases in ten major vertical industries such as industrial manufacturing and smart mining, as well as new scenarios and new formats of the industrial Internet, targeting 5G+smart power, 5G+smart mines, 5G+smart ports, and 5G+smart logistics. A variety of radio and television special services have been carried out in various scenarios. In particular, the industrial situation awareness platform created by China Radio and Television can detect environmental and equipment risks in advance. It has the ability to comprehensively analyze and warn industrial network security threats. It can realize an AI intelligent mineral processing control platform with a mineral processing error of less than 5%, ensuring special The "Welding Intelligence Protection" special operation supervision platform for operational compliance and safety provides decision-making support for enterprises, optimizes production processes, and reduces production costs. Obviously, China Radio and Television has changed its role from a "catcher" to an "innovator". The new radio and television network has improved its industrialization enabling capabilities. This achievement is because China Radio and Television has accelerated the construction of new radio and television networks and comprehensively improved its new industrialization enabling capabilities. The first is to consolidate the computing power cloud network infrastructure, upgrade the cable TV network, build a high-quality radio and television 5G network, and accelerate the construction of a new radio and television network with "cable + 5G + satellite" fixed-mobile collaboration and "connection + computing + perception" ubiquitous intelligence. Provide underlying support capabilities for intelligent manufacturing fields such as the Internet of Things, industrial automation control, industrial AR, and logistics tracking. The second is to create a distinctive and differentiated business system and accelerate the construction of a "1+4" operation and management pattern, that is, to build a national radio and television network integrated management network, build a national radio and television 5G business network, a national Internet backbone network, a national fixed voice business network, and a national content Integrate the broadcast control platform to build a solid foundation for homogeneity and create differentiated business. The third is to adhere to innovation-driven development, accelerate the application of new technologies such as Redcap, digital twins, artificial intelligence, and edge computing, and inject new vitality into the industrial Internet and innovative applications of industrial digital intelligence. Song Qizhu will give full play to the advantages of integrated resources in the future. In the future, China Radio and Television will take advantage of the multi-channel transmission network resources and 700MHz frequency characteristics of the new radio and television network to help the digital, intelligent and green transformation and upgrading of new industries. The first is to support the digital transformation of thousands of industries. Focusing on vertical industries such as power, maritime, ports, factories, logistics, and emergency response, we innovate and develop industrial Internet platforms and solutions to help partners "get to the cloud, use data, and empower intelligence." The second is to facilitate the circulation and application of industrial data elements. Give full play to the advantages of large-scale connection of radio and television networks, build a big data platform that comprehensively supports data circulation, build a one-stop data service solution, and provide integrated services such as data, consulting, governance, and application. The third is to help digitize industrial culture. As the main body in the construction and operation of the national cultural private network, we deeply implement the national cultural digitalization strategy and rely on the cultural private network and media communication capabilities to promote the prosperity and development of industrial culture. About Baidu Ventures (BV)-BV Baidu Ventures is an independent venture capital institution initiated and established by Baidu Group in 2017, focusing on artificial intelligence. The layout and exploration of the field of intelligence is one of the earliest early-stage venture capital institutions in China to go deep into this field, covering the artificial intelligence industry chain, autonomous driving, medical care, life sciences, robotics, advanced computing and other subdivisions. Congratulations to my classmate Li Luming for being elected as an academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences today. Professor Li Luming has made outstanding contributions in the field of neuromodulation technology. The neuromodulation technology developed by his research team is of great significance for treating neurological diseases and improving human health. Being elected as an academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences is an affirmation and recognition of his outstanding achievements in this field. Congratulations again to Professor Li Luming! Professor Li Luming’s research field is “basic and applied research on active implantable neuromodulation”. Here is a brief introduction to this field. 1. Review and prospects of active implantable neuromodulation technology Active implantable neuromodulation is a technology that uses implanted electronic devices to perform nerve stimulation, aiming to improve or restore damaged nerve function. This article reviews recent research on active implantable neuromodulation, mainly discusses its application fields, methods and effects, and looks forward to future development directions. Active implantable neuromodulation is widely used in the treatment of various neurological diseases. Research mainly focuses on the treatment of Parkinson's disease, epilepsy, chronic pain and other conditions. Through deep brain stimulation and other means, active implantable neuromodulation technology has become one of the effective methods to treat these diseases. In addition, active implantable neuromodulation technology is also used to improve the motor functions of patients with physical disabilities, as well as to treat mental illness and cognitive impairment. These studies indicate that active implantable neuromodulation technology has broad clinical application prospects. Methods and devices for active implantable neuromodulation technology are constantly being improved and optimized. Research mainly focuses on exploring the relationship between stimulation parameters and neural responses to optimize the effect of neuromodulation. At the same time, new stimulation algorithms and devices are constantly being developed to improve the accuracy and effectiveness of neuromodulation and reduce the risk of side effects and complications. Improvements in these technologies and equipment have provided important support for the further development of active implantable neuromodulation technology. Although active implantable neuromodulation technology has achieved certain success in clinical applications, there are still some challenges and problems that need to be solved. For example, how to improve the accuracy and effect of stimulation, reduce the risk of side effects and complications, and how to achieve multi-channel stimulation and remote monitoring. In addition, the long-term efficacy and safety of this technology also require further evaluation and research. With the advancement of science and technology and the development of medicine, active implantable neuromodulation technology will continue to be in-depth research and improvement. Future research directions include optimizing stimulation algorithms, improving device reliability and safety, and achieving multi-modal regulation. At the same time, with the development of artificial intelligence and machine learning technology, more intelligent and personalized neuromodulation solutions are expected to be realized. In short, active implantable neuromodulation technology is a technology with important clinical application value, and its development will bring revolutionary changes to the treatment of neurological diseases. Although there are still some problems and challenges at present, with the continuous deepening of scientific research and the development of technology, we have reason to believe that this technology will play a greater role in the future and make greater contributions to human health. 2. Classification of basic and applied research on active implantable neuromodulation. According to available references, basic and applied research on active implantable neuromodulation is divided into the following categories: 1. Basic research category: *Study on the electrophysiology of neurons Characteristics and neural network responses, exploring the mechanisms and optimization methods of neural regulation. *Study animal models to provide experimental basis for the clinical application of active implantable neuromodulation technology. 2. Applied research category: *Research on the application of active implantable neuromodulation technology in the treatment of neurological diseases, such as Parkinson's disease, epilepsy, chronic pain, etc. *Research on the application of active implantable neuromodulation technology to improve the motor function of patients with physical disabilities. *Research on the application of active implantable neuromodulation technology in the treatment of mental illness and cognitive impairment. 3. Technology development category: * Research new stimulation algorithms and equipment to improve the accuracy and effect of neural regulation and reduce the risk of side effects and complications. *Research on multi-modal regulation and remote monitoring technologies to achieve more intelligent and personalized neural regulation solutions. By classifying and integrating these reference documents, a clearer understanding of various aspects and development trends of active implantable neuromodulation technology can be obtained. 3. Searched several papers and research results of several overseas scholars in the same field * The role of neural oscillators: Buzsáki and Wang’s paper (2012) discussed the role of neural oscillators in neural regulation and proposed a new type of Neural oscillator circuits designed to simulate the electrophysiological properties of neurons. * Combination and application of brain-computer interface technology: Hampson et al.'s paper (2008) combines brain-computer interface technology with neuromodulation technology and proposes a new brain-computer interface system aimed at helping patients with neurological diseases to exercise Function restored. Wang et al.'s paper (2016) reviewed the application of brain-computer interface technology in neurorehabilitation and discussed future research directions. *Review of neurorehabilitation: The paper by Fiedler et al. (2017) provides a review of neurorehabilitation in patients with spinal cord injury and explores the application of electroencephalography in neuromodulation. *Application of electroencephalogram in neuromodulation: Daly and Wolpaw's paper (2018) reviews the application of electroencephalogram in neuromodulation and discusses its development potential in the field of future neuromodulation. *Other related literature: The remaining papers mainly cover all aspects of active implantable neuromodulation technology, including technology improvement, equipment development, application effect evaluation, etc. These papers provide important reference and support for the further development of active implantable neuromodulation technology. 4. Active Implantable Neuromodulation: Basics, Applications and Future Prospects In the past few decades, active implantable neuromodulation technology has made significant progress, providing new ways for the treatment of neurological diseases. This article reviews recent basic and applied research on active implantable neuromodulation and explores the future development potential of this technology. Active implantable neuromodulation is a technology that uses implanted electronic devices for neurostimulation, aiming to improve or restore damaged neurological function. The main principle of this technology is to achieve the purpose of treating diseases by accurately stimulating neurons and stimulating the natural response of the neural network. In terms of basic research, the progress of active implantable neuromodulation technology benefits from cross-collaboration in neurobiology, biomedical engineering, computer science and other fields. Researchers are committed to studying the electrophysiological properties of neurons and exploring the relationship between stimulation parameters and neural responses to optimize the effect of neural regulation. In addition, research on animal models also provides important experimental basis for the development of this technology. In terms of applied research, active implantable neuromodulation technology has been widely used in the treatment of various neurological diseases. For example, deep brain stimulation (DBS) is used to treat Parkinson's disease, epilepsy, chronic pain, etc. In addition, this technology is also used to improve the motor functions of patients with physical disabilities, as well as to treat mental illness and cognitive impairment. These studies indicate that active implantable neuromodulation technology has broad clinical application prospects. Although active implantable neuromodulation technology has achieved certain success in clinical applications, there are still some challenges and problems that need to be solved. For example, how to improve the accuracy and effect of stimulation, reduce the risk of side effects and complications, and how to achieve multi-channel stimulation and remote monitoring. In addition, the long-term efficacy and safety of this technology also require further evaluation and study. Future Outlook: I hope that Professor Li Luming and his team can continue to lead technological progress in this field and further win top honors for China. With the advancement of science and technology and the development of medicine, active implantable neuromodulation technology will continue to be in-depth research and improvement. Future research directions include optimizing stimulation algorithms, improving device reliability and safety, and achieving multi-modal regulation. At the same time, with the development of artificial intelligence and machine learning technology, more intelligent and personalized neuromodulation solutions are expected to be realized. In short, active implantable neuromodulation technology is a technology with important clinical application value, and its development will bring revolutionary changes to the treatment of neurological diseases. Although there are still some problems and challenges at present, with the continuous deepening of scientific research and the development of technology, we have reason to believe that this technology will play a greater role in the future and make greater contributions to human health. 2Nanning Nakao River Wetland ParkCollapsed

Follow-up comments from Guangdian Express (002152): The construction of "Digital Bay Area" is about to lay the foundation for the computing power platform. On November 21, 2023, Guangdong Province issued the "Three-Year Action Plan for the Construction of "Digital Bay Area"", proposing to build a unified market for data elements , promote the establishment of unified data asset registration rules in the Greater Bay Area, explore authorized operations of public data, and support the Guangzhou and Shenzhen Data Exchanges in establishing national-level data exchanges. With the gradual implementation of early concept applications such as data assets and data transactions, the market surrounding digital infrastructure is expected to stimulate a new round of investment opportunities. As one of the core participants in Guangzhou's digital infrastructure, SVA Express has a layout in data, computing power, algorithms, scenarios, etc. It is expected to gain market opportunities by virtue of its first-mover advantage in this field and ecological construction. It is recommended to pay attention to the progress of data transactions and the company's continued development in this field. Guangdong Province issued the "Three-Year Action Plan for the Construction of the "Digital Bay Area"" to support the Guangzhou and Shenzhen Data Exchanges in establishing national data exchanges. The "Plan" proposes to build a unified market for data elements, promote the establishment of unified data asset registration rules in the Greater Bay Area, explore authorized operations of public data, and realize the integrated application of public data and social data. The "Plan" proposes to support commercial banks that meet relevant qualifications to carry out internal data cross-border flow pilots, and rely on platforms such as the National Supercomputing Guangzhou Center to help enterprises and scientific research institutions in the Greater Bay Area improve the use of computing power and the iteration efficiency of original algorithms. The "Plan" supports the Guangzhou and Shenzhen Data Exchanges to establish national data exchanges and build a Greater Bay Area data element trading market with unified market systems, trading rules and platform carriers. We believe that the "Plan" has set clear goals and development rhythms, and the relevant layout is expected to drive the flow of regional data elements first and gradually move towards the national level. According to the announcement of Guangdian Express, the company holds 10.5% equity in Guangzhou Data Exchange and is expected to benefit from the development of the data trading market in the future. China Radio and Television Express actively deploys the data element market and empowers it in many aspects such as "data, computing power, algorithms, and scenarios". On November 21, 2023, according to the company's announcement, Guangdian Express became the first transaction candidate for the "Guangzhou Data Group Artificial Intelligence Public Computing Center Construction Project Equipment and Supporting Services Procurement Project", with a maximum price limit of 485 million yuan for the procurement project. The Guangzhou Artificial Intelligence Public Computing Power Center is one of the important digital infrastructures in the field of artificial intelligence in Guangzhou. It focuses on the "Guangzhou Artificial Intelligence Public Computing Power Center", "Public Computing Power Service Platform, Application Innovation Incubation Platform, and Industrial Integration Empowerment". Platform, technology collaborative innovation platform and talent training platform" one center and five platforms support the construction of Guangzhou's artificial intelligence ecosystem and accelerate the development of the digital economy. SVA Express actively deploys the data element market and provides solutions in terms of data, computing power, algorithms, scenarios, etc. The company successfully obtained the first transaction candidate for Guangzhou Data Group's procurement project, helping the development of the digital economy. Risk factors: The risk of reduced demand due to macroeconomic pressure; the risk of financial innovation demand and progress falling short of expectations; the risk of overseas revenue falling short of expectations due to geopolitical factors; the risk of digital RMB promotion falling short of expectations; the risk of data transaction development falling short of expectations Risks etc. Profit forecast, valuation and rating: At the industry level, the goals of the "Plan" are clear and clear. We believe that the relevant layout is expected to drive the circulation of regional data elements first and gradually move towards the nationwide; at the company level, China Radio and Television Express is actively deploying the data element market, relying on its Technical strength, first-mover advantages, and ecological construction are expected to fully benefit from the development of the digital economy. We are optimistic about the company's long-term layout in areas such as computing power and data trading, and recommend paying attention to the pace of data trading application implementation and the company's business orders. We maintain the company's 2023-2025 EPS forecast of 0.40/0.45/0.49 yuan, and the current price corresponds to 31/28/26 times PE. With reference to the current prices of comparable companies Changliang Technology and Yuxin Technology, which correspond to an average PE of 47 times in 2023 (both forecasted by CITIC Securities Research Department), and taking into account the dilution of profits by the company's minority shareholders' profits and losses, we give Guangdian Express a PE of 40 times in 2023, maintaining The target price is 16 yuan and the "buy" rating is maintained. [Large Cap or Small Cap] ➤ Small and medium-cap investments have been very popular recently. First, the micro-cap index became popular. According to statistics, it has increased by more than 40% this year. Immediately afterwards, the North Securities Index also became popular. Observing the market in the past two days, the increase of the North Securities 50 can be described as "far ahead". This also puts the market into a game of whether to "buy big" or "buy small." Looking back from 2019 to 2021, large-cap value investment has always occupied the high ground, and the leader is king. Now, the tide seems to have changed. Since the beginning of this year, observing different market capitalization style indexes, the market index has adjusted more, with a decrease of -9.12%. The declines in the mid-cap and small-cap indexes gradually converged to -8.81% and -1.27%, and the micro-cap index even achieved an increase of +44.4%. ➤Looking back at history, the rotation between small caps and large caps has also gone through several cycles. Combined with the historical background behind each cycle, it is not difficult to find that industrial rotation is the main driving factor behind it. For example, the consumer electronics industry from 2007 to 2010, the Internet+ industry from 2013 to 2015, new energy and artificial intelligence in the past two years, etc. The small and mid-cap style often corresponds to the rise of emerging industries, while the large-cap style is often supported by the recovery of traditional industries. ➤What is the logic behind the outperformance of small caps this year? For small caps to outperform the broader caps, three supporting factors are often needed: first, loose liquidity, second, the upward cycle of the industry, and third, support from national policies. In the context of economic pressure and loose liquidity, funds tend to gather in high-prosperity tracks and high-growth companies. At this time, if these emerging industries are in an upward cycle and are supported by many policy conditions, the strength of small and mid-cap stocks may last longer. ➤Does the market have such conditions this year? First, the liquidity level: The economy continues to be weakly recovering this year, and market liquidity is relatively abundant. For example, the recent announcement by the index company that the North Exchange stock will be included in the CSI All Index sample space will also greatly increase the liquidity of the North Exchange stock, thereby promoting the recent market trend of the North Exchange. Secondly, at the industrial level, many fields such as AI, smart cars, and semiconductors have made great progress in recent years. However, the market value of these companies is relatively small, and the market is expected to have relatively large potential. Finally, at the policy level, the state has always actively supported the cultivation of specialized, new, small and micro enterprises, and has introduced policies such as "High-Quality Construction of the Beijing Stock Exchange" to fully support small and micro enterprises in financing and becoming bigger and stronger. Therefore, the continued strength of small and medium-sized caps in this round is not accidental, and is supported by strong logic. But when we pay attention to the market situation, the risks cannot be ignored. ➤Can I still buy the small and medium-sized caps currently? From a valuation perspective, after the early market conditions, the price-to-earnings ratio quantiles of small and medium-cap stocks represented by indices such as CSI 1000 and CSI 2000 have indeed risen to historically high levels. The price-to-earnings ratio of the CSI 1000 Index has exceeded the 47% mark in the past decade, while the price-to-earnings ratio of the China Securities 2000 Index has also exceeded the 60% mark in the past decade. However, compared to these two types of indexes, what the director would like to remind you is the most popular micro-cap index in recent times. The extreme market conditions do not mean that it is suitable for everyone to invest. Judging from the compilation rules of this index, it selects the 400 stocks with the smallest market capitalization, and dynamically adjusts and balances positions every day, maintaining equal weight holdings. This means that it is constantly buying low and selling high, but No rebalancing costs are considered. However, from a practical perspective, the cost of position adjustment for such micro-cap stocks is still very high, and the investment risk will be greater. Towards the end of the year, the market is gradually beginning to anticipate a style switch. After the small and mid-cap market has fermented for a certain period of time, it is worth paying attention to whether it will usher in a rotation. Especially for ordinary investors, small and mid-cap investments are indeed highly elastic, but they are also subject to high volatility. Whether you are suitable for this type of investment depends on your own risk tolerance and your ability. If you are optimistic about this type of style, it is also recommended that you use common broad-based indexes instead of tracking unpopular indexes to layout. Portal: O large market or small market close d

U.S. senators introduced the Artificial Intelligence Research, Innovation, and Accountability Act of 2023. According to MeriTalk.com on November 17, U.S. senators introduced the Artificial Intelligence Research, Innovation, and Accountability Act of 2023 (AIRIA) on the 15th. in protecting consumers and entrepreneurs, and tasking the Department of Commerce with undertaking new regulatory work. The bill proposes a clear distinction between “high impact” and “critical impact” artificial intelligence systems and requires them to self-certify. The bill is roughly divided into two themes: Theme One focuses on legislative initiatives to encourage innovation, including revisions to open data policies, artificial intelligence emergency behavior detection standards, and research on online content verification methods; Theme Two establishes an accountability framework, including definitions Much related terminology, reporting obligations, risk management assessment protocols, certification procedures, enforcement measures and a push for broader consumer education on AI. Following the release of a new episode of the Aston Originals podcast, hosted by experts Dr Duane Mellor and Dr Srikanth Bellary, the university’s diabetes research and how the disease affects communities around Birmingham are discussed. The theme of World Diabetes Day 2023 is getting diabetes care and understanding the risks. Complications of diabetes include circulatory problems, kidney problems and eye damage, and getting the right information and care can significantly reduce your risk. Globally alone, one in 10 people has diabetes, more than 90% of which are type 2 diabetes, half of which are undiagnosed. With treatment and healthy lifestyle habits, people with type 2 diabetes can delay or prevent complications. Experts from Aston University, including Dr Duane Mellor from the School of Medicine and Dr Srikanth Bellary from the School of Biological Sciences, explored risk factors for type 2 diabetes, particularly the prevalence of obesity in deprived areas. People in poor areas often lack opportunities for physical activity and have limited access to healthy foods, which increases the risk of diabetes. Aston University strives to address these social inequalities through research. Although type 2 diabetes is usually associated with older people, an increasing number of younger people, especially those who are obese or from black and South Asian communities, are also being diagnosed with the disease. Dr Bellary is committed to raising awareness of diabetes among young people, particularly among Aston University’s diverse student body. Advances in blood glucose monitoring technology in recent years have made it easier for patients to manage their diabetes, but digital poverty and access remain issues of concern. Dr. Mellor and Dr. Bellary also believe that artificial intelligence (AI) may play a key role in improving diabetes care in the future. Hide d

[Hard technology requires patient capital | Exclusive interview with Mi Lei, founding partner of Zhongke Chuangxing] In the era of mobile Internet, the Chinese market has achieved great success. The world’s attention is focused on this entrepreneurial land with unlimited potential. Venture capital has begun to become a One of the leading forces in the business world. However, far away from the eye of the mobile Internet storm, the Xi'an Institute of Optics and Mechanics of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, an investment institution that proposes hard technology investment concepts was established in Xi'an, focusing on investing and incubating innovative technologies that may change the direction of human civilization. In an investment era where model innovation is the mainstream, the concept of ""investment" was put forward. Today, ten years later, China Science and Technology Star has invested in more than 420 hard technology companies. In this issue, Dr., the founding partner of Zhongke Chuangxing, was invited to talk about his observations and thoughts on hard technology investment in the past ten years. Zhang Lan: You are the proposer and advocate of the concept of hard technology. China Science and Technology Star has also gone through ten years on this road. From the initial proposal of hard technology to now, the waves of technology have risen one after another. Now regarding the eight fields of hard technology, do you think there will be more? Mi Lei: At present, this conclusion has not been particularly challenged, and it is still in the fields proposed at that time. But we use the ideas of physics to condense these eight fields into five major directions, namely matter, energy, information, space, and life. These five major directions constitute an underlying logic, and all other hard technology directions are actually differentiated from these five major directions. Zhang Lan: At the event at the beginning of this year, we mentioned three directions: artificial intelligence, unlimited energy and unlimited life. The five directions you mentioned should be more specific than this summary. So among these five directions, which ones do you focus on and are most optimistic about? Mi Lei: In the information field, we believe that information is from electricity to light, and from electrons to photons. Photon technology will become mainstream in the information field in the future. My point of view is: Just based on the infrastructure of artificial intelligence, the information industry will be an intelligent industry in the future. In the current era of artificial intelligence, photonic technology has become the core of artificial intelligence infrastructure. Recently, TSMC and NVIDIA have begun to use it on GPUs, which has also verified this view. As an important infrastructure for the next industrial revolution, computing power will develop into photon computing and quantum computing in the future, which are key technical fields in the future of the information industry. The energy field, especially the topic of carbon neutrality, has also received a lot of attention. In this regard, superconducting and controllable nuclear fusion technology are considered to be a complete subversion of the energy revolution. If realized, it will promote mankind to enter a Type I civilization and achieve free energy. , free Internet access, and the prospect of free electricity; in the space field, commercial aviation, commercial aerospace, as well as human exploration of Mars and the moon and the establishment of mobile stations are very exciting. Technologies such as electric aircraft and supersonic aircraft can also significantly change us humans. travel and life; in the field of materials, the emergence of new materials, such as carbon nanotubes, carbon fibers, new alloys and polymer materials, will replace traditional materials and promote the vigorous development of hard technology entrepreneurship.
