From an investment perspective, the company believes that the computing power side will usher in important investment opportunities: on the one hand, demand for optical modules, servers, etc. will continue to grow driven by AI; on the other hand, semiconductor equipment, AI chips, etc. are developing urgently under overseas controls. Sexual enhancement. In addition, the company also recommends paying attention to the intelligent driving and robotics sectors under the accelerated iteration of large models to develop rich scenarios; the data elements, consumer electronics, operator sectors under the implementation of technological innovation, and the Internet sector under valuation restoration and other subdivisions. 12. A survey shows that 77% of developers use ChatGPT to assist in the development of intelligent development tools. JetBrains, a software company, today released the 2023 "Developer Ecosystem Status Report" and interviewed 26,348 developers around the world. The report shows that 77% of developers are using ChatGPT to help with development, and 46% of developers are using GitHubCopilot to help with research. The most common ways developers use AI assistants are to use natural language to ask general questions about software development, generate code, or code comments. 13. Amazon: Provide free AI training to 2 million people by 2025. On November 20, local time, Amazon launched the AIReady program, aiming to provide free AI skills training to 2 million people around the world by 2025. The plan proposes three new initiatives: opening 8 new free AI and generative AI courses; establishing an AWS generative AI scholarship to provide more than 50,000 high school students and college students around the world with new generative AI courses on the online learning website Udacity Access opportunities; partnership with education innovation nonprofit Code.org. 14. Meta transferred most of its RAI team employees to generative AI. According to The Information on November 19, an internal Meta post stated that as the company shifts more resources to generative AI work, Meta has split up ResponsibleAI ( RAI) team and transfer most of the team's employees to the generative AI team. The move is part of a broader shakeup of Meta's AI team that was announced internally last week. 15. LG Group increased its investment in AI and other fields by 400 billion won. According to the Korea Times, on November 19, LG Group increased the size of its corporate venture capital fund from 600 billion won (approximately RMB 3.34 billion) to 1 trillion. South Korean won (approximately RMB 5.57 billion) to strengthen investment in technology companies leading industries such as AI, biotechnology, batteries and mobile. 16. Germany, Italy and France have reached an agreement on future AI regulation. According to a joint document reported by Reuters, France, Germany and Italy have reached an agreement on how to regulate AI. The agreement is expected to accelerate negotiations at the European level. The three governments support "mandatory self-regulation through codes of conduct" on the basis of AI models and oppose "untested norms." The joint document stated: “We jointly emphasize that the AI Act regulates the application of AI, not the technology itself.” The document requires developers of basic models to define model system cards to provide information about machine learning models. To understand the capabilities, capabilities, and limitations of the model, and best practices based on the developer community. 17. WPS: All user documents will not be used for AI training. On the evening of November 18, WPS apologized on its official Weibo website and guaranteed that all user documents will not be used for any AI training purposes. WPS stated that in response to the recent concerns raised by users about some statements in the "WPS Privacy Policy", after careful review, it was deeply felt that the previous version of the statements caused trouble to users. For this reason, it has been updated to remove misleading statements. Expression. 18. Xinhua News Agency’s Large Model Experience Report 3.0 was released. This study captured data from October 25, 2023 to November 6, 2023, and conducted user experience evaluations on domestic mainstream large models through human-computer interaction questions and other forms. The report shows that iFlytek Spark, SenseTime and Zhipu AI-ChatGLM rank among the top three. Hide d

Weisi Medical (688580), the leader in rehabilitation robots, Yimeng Trader 2023-09-17 Today, let’s learn about the leader in medical service robots – Weisi Medical (688580). Let’s first take a look at the company’s industry background: 1. Thanks to the support of national policies such as medical insurance and three-child policy, as well as the increase in residents’ rehabilitation needs and the upgrading of the rehabilitation industry, the overall rehabilitation medical device market has grown significantly and is a leading player in the field of medical devices. Golden Track: Data disclosed by the National Health Commission show that from 2015 to 2020, the number of equipment worth more than 10,000 yuan in China’s rehabilitation hospitals continued to increase. In 2020, there were 747,000 pieces of equipment worth more than 10,000 yuan in China’s rehabilitation hospitals, which was approximately 2015. Three times, the value of its equipment has also continued to rise, from 140 million yuan in 2015 to 490 million yuan in 2020. With the expansion of the demand side, the number of rehabilitation hospitals in our country has also increased. According to data from the "China Health Statistics Yearbook", in the ten years from 2011 to 2020, the number of rehabilitation medical hospitals in China increased from 301 to 739, among which the number of non-public hospitals increased rapidly from 155 in 2011 to 573 in 2020. . 2. Rehabilitation robots integrate many disciplines such as mechanics, computer science, control science, and rehabilitation medicine. They are high-end rehabilitation medical technologies developed in recent years. They can help disabled patients restore their motor functions, reshape the central nervous system, and can replace or Mechanical repetitive operations of assisted rehabilitation therapists: providing possibilities for remote rehabilitation medicine and centralized rehabilitation medicine. With the continuous advancement and development of science and technology, artificial intelligence technology, rehabilitation robot technology, magnetic stimulation and other technologies have become more integrated with the field of rehabilitation medicine, and new rehabilitation treatment technologies have been gradually developed and applied. According to Frost & Sullivan analysis data, the market size of China's rehabilitation robots was US$210 million in 2018 and is expected to grow at a compound annual growth rate of 57.5% to US$2.04 billion in 2023. The market prospects are broad. Let’s take a look at the highlights of the company’s fundamentals: 1. Weisi’s medical device products mainly focus on electrical stimulation, magnetic stimulation, electrophysiology and rehabilitation robot products. The technology in these four major fields has developed rapidly, and the market is in a rapid development stage. : The magnetic stimulation rehabilitation medical equipment and rehabilitation robot market is an emerging market and is expected to have large room for growth in the future. From the perspective of segmented fields, according to Frost & Sullivan analysis data, the market size of the company's four focus areas is expected to grow from 720 million yuan in 2014 to 6.69 billion yuan in 2023, of which the annual compound growth rate from 2014 to 2018 The rate is 23.0%. 2. Weisi Medical has continued to invest in rehabilitation robot technology platforms and has accumulated relevant technologies, laying a solid foundation for the company's future expansion into the market of a series of sports rehabilitation robots with exoskeleton rehabilitation robots as the core: In the field of rehabilitation robots, the company has now formed a comprehensive coverage A series of sports rehabilitation robot products for full-cycle rehabilitation training and evaluation of lower limbs and upper limbs, including X-walk series and X-locom product series. Several models of the products have obtained relevant medical device registration certificates, and more models will continue to be promoted. Registration and listing. Risk warning: Intensified competition in the industry has led to price wars for mid- to low-end rehabilitation products; the epidemic has repeatedly affected business progress such as bidding and installation; the promotion of high-end rehabilitation robots and other products is slower than expected; the research and development and registration progress of medical aesthetic equipment is lower than expected. The source of the above content is from Western Securities: Weiss Medical (688580) continues to increase its focus on restoring mainstream categories, rapidly growing and entering the laser radio frequency track. d

[GitHub Treasures: Digital Twins as a Service Open Source! An open source platform for digital twins] OGitHub Treasures: Digital Twins as a Service Open Source! A digital twin open source platform Digital Twin (DigitalTwin) technology is based on physical models, sensor data, historical operating data, etc., and is constructed in virtual space by integrating multi-disciplinary, multi-physical quantities, multi-scale, and multi-probability simulation processes. Mapping of the entire life cycle process of physical equipment. This technology aims to understand, analyze and optimize physical equipment to improve production efficiency, reduce operating costs, extend equipment life and prevent failures. Digital twin technology integrates artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML) and other technologies, combining data, algorithms and decision-making analysis to build a virtual mapping of physical objects. By monitoring changes in physical objects in virtual models, diagnosis is based on complex multi-dimensional data processing and anomaly analysis, predicting potential risks, reasonably and effectively planning equipment maintenance and optimizing the production process. namo-amitabhaya! Bridgewater Dalio warns: U.S. debt is approaching a turning point for deterioration. On the 21st, Bridgewater founder Dalio said that as government debt grows faster than income, the financial situation of the United States is approaching an accelerating "inflection point." The hole grows deeper as the U.S. government borrows more and more money to pay its debt without spending any less. "The way it works can only continue to accelerate... We are in a phase of this acceleration, which creates supply and demand issues." Earlier, Fitch, one of the three major U.S. rating agencies, had downgraded the U.S. credit rating, and another authority Ratings agency Moody's also lowered its outlook on U.S. debt ratings this month. Dalio asked: "As a country, do we have a good income statement and balance sheet - do we have more assets than liabilities? The worse it gets, the more long-term problems we're going to have. You can see it in the numbers. "It's just a matter of numbers. We're getting close to that inflection point." Last year, the government added $1.7 trillion to the deficit to keep spending on pace. . [Comment]: The recent rebound in U.S. bonds is a normal market spiral rhythm. It is not that the U.S. debt crisis has been eliminated. On the contrary, the future crisis will be even greater. Dario's warning cannot be ignored. Unless the U.S. debt crisis triggers something special, this crisis cycle will not pass, it will not be countercyclical, and it will not be cross-cyclical. [ ] Hu Xijin posted this afternoon: "What exactly is happening in OpenAI? Simply put, there is a conflict between real interests and idealism. Sam Altman, who was fired by the board of directors, supports effective accelerationism and puts the promotion of artificial intelligence development first. ; The company’s chief scientist Ilya Sutskever pays more attention to preventing the risks of AI and advocates the super-alignment of artificial intelligence. This is originally the thrust and braking force for human development of AI, and both are indispensable. Now Altman has obtained investors and almost all The support of employees has the absolute upper hand, and Saskville has already switched sides." He mentioned in the article: "AI has just begun, and it is hard to imagine what is in its depth space today. China must speed up AI Research and development, in order to improve our vision and intention of understanding the deep space of AI. It is not only a matter of AI application driving economic development, but also maintaining the fundamentals of national security and the major interests in shaping the right to participate in the future of mankind. Now we are looking at how OpenAI There is a "court fight" between two young entrepreneurs, and the future development direction of AI seems to be determined by their struggle. This is not okay. So what does it mean? We can only accelerate our AI pace at that speed. Generate understanding and gain the right to speak."

The last number of signatures from OpenAI employees on Monday was 747/770, a ratio of 97%, which is indeed a remarkable achievement. ——BenLandau-Taylor: This action is truly unprecedented. It's impossible to get 97% of any group to take action based on just a link to a Google Doc and a "sign if you agree." This hints at the complex operations behind the scenes: a team is contacting each employee, long debates with those who disagree, coordinators using spreadsheets to manage, and so on. ——— OpenAI’s future remained uncertain on Tuesday. Despite significant efforts by employees and investors to oust the board, those efforts have so far failed to convince directors to resign and reappoint co-founder Sam Altman. As of the end of Monday, 747 of OpenAI's 770 employees had signed a letter threatening to resign if the board refuses to resign and reverses its decision to fire Altman last Friday, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter. And join Microsoft. Meanwhile, venture investors backing the startup focused on generative artificial intelligence are also considering legal options to force the board to reverse its decision, according to multiple people familiar with the matter. (Bloomberg, Washington) To reduce dependence on Asia’s semiconductor supply chain, the Biden administration has launched a multi-billion-dollar investment plan, hoping to seize the dominant position in advanced semiconductor packaging technology. Bloomberg reports that the Biden administration has launched a US$3 billion (S$4 billion) national advanced packaging manufacturing plan more than a year after the implementation of the Chip and Science Act, and recently assigned a person in charge of the project. people. US Deputy Secretary of Commerce Locascio said the plan aims to establish multiple large-scale packaging facilities by 2030 to reduce reliance on Asian supply chains that may pose "unacceptable" risks to US security. Further reading China’s Ministry of Commerce: The United States should lift its semiconductor export controls to China as soon as possible. The competition between China and the United States in advanced semiconductor packaging. Semiconductor packaging is a process in which tested wafers are processed into independent chips according to product models and functional requirements. It is commonly referred to in the industry as "Backend" manufacturing. This business used to be mainly outsourced to Asia. Intel data shows that the United States accounts for only 3% of global packaging capabilities. With the application of new technologies, the complexity of semiconductor packaging is rapidly increasing, making chip combination, stacking and performance improvement possible. The industry regards this as a turning point in the industry. Especially in the field of high-power semiconductors required for artificial intelligence (AI) applications, packaging is crucial. According to reports, China already has the largest number of "back-end" facilities in the world, including Jiangsu Changdian, the world's third-largest assembly and testing company. Data from the U.S. Semiconductor Industry Association shows that China has 38% of the global assembly, testing and packaging market share, ranking first in the world. Hide d

[Open your eyes to see the world丨Xi Jinping attends the BRICS leaders’ special video summit on the Palestinian-Israeli issue 2023.11.22] [Selected]·Li Qiang will attend the G20 leaders’ video summit·Yun-20 takes off to South Korea to pick up heroes home · Air China resumes direct flights between China and the United States · Foreign media: North Korea notified that it plans to launch another satellite and the Japanese Prime Minister responded · The Shenzhen Academy of Medical Sciences, which has been in preparation for one year, was officially established, with Yan Ning as the founding president [Key News] · On the evening of November 21, President Xi Jinping Xi Jinping attended the BRICS leaders’ special video summit on the Palestinian-Israeli issue in Beijing and delivered an important speech. Xi Jinping said that the conflict in Gaza has lasted for more than a month, causing a large number of civilian casualties and humanitarian disasters, and showing a trend of expanding spillover. China is deeply concerned. The top priority is that all parties to the conflict must immediately cease fire and fighting, stop all violence and attacks against civilians, release detained civilians, and avoid more serious devastation. The second is to ensure the safe and smooth flow of humanitarian relief channels, provide more humanitarian assistance to the Gaza people, and stop forced relocation, water, electricity and oil cuts and other collective punishments against the Gaza people. Third, the international community must take practical measures to prevent the conflict from expanding and affecting the stability of the entire Middle East region. China supports the resolution passed on October 27 at the emergency special session of the United Nations General Assembly on the Palestinian-Israeli conflict. As the rotating president of the United Nations Security Council, China presided over the adoption of Security Council Resolution 2712. All parties should implement the resolution's requirements. ·Li Qiang will attend the G20 Leaders’ Video Summit. Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Mao Ning announced: At the invitation of the Government of the Republic of India, Premier Li Qiang of the State Council will attend the G20 Leaders’ Video Summit on November 22. [International]·Russian State Duma Chairman leads a delegation to visit China Russian media reported on November 21 that Russian State Duma Chairman Volodin led a delegation to visit China that day. According to Xinhua News Agency on the 20th, at the invitation of Zhao Leji, Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, Chairman of the Russian State Duma Volodin will pay an official visit to China from November 21 to 23. ·Air China resumes direct flights between China and the United States On the afternoon of the 21st, Air China took the lead in resuming the direct flight CA817 from Beijing to Washington. The flight took off from Beijing Capital International Airport at 12:30 pm on November 21, Beijing time, and will arrive at Washington Dulles International Airport at 14:10 pm on November 21, Washington local time. There are two flights per week, on Tuesdays and Saturdays. ·The announcement of the 2024 U.S. presidential election debate schedule may make history. According to CNN, on the 20th local time, the U.S. Commission on Presidential Debates announced that the first presidential debate in 2024 will be held in mid-September 2024, adding that "This is the earliest presidential debate ever." ·The former CEO and former president of OpenAI will join the Microsoft AI team. Microsoft announced that Altman, the "father of ChatGPT", will join Microsoft to lead a new artificial intelligence research team, and Microsoft will provide the resources they need. On the 20th local time, more than 700 employees of OpenAI signed a joint letter calling on the company’s board of directors to resign. The letter states that unless the board resigns and reinstates Altman and Brockman, they will join Microsoft. According to reports, OpenAI has a total number of employees of approximately 770. ·Foreign media: North Korea notified that it planned to launch another satellite. Japan’s Prime Minister responded. According to Kyodo News’ report on November 21, North Korea announced that it would launch an artificial satellite between 0:00 a.m. on the 22nd and 0:00 a.m. on December 1. The Japan Coast Guard announced the news after receiving the notification. Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said Japan is prepared to deal with possible "unexpected situations" when North Korea launches a satellite rocket. · 19 newly contaminated water bodies were detected around the Japan Self-Defense Force base that was suspected of discharging harmful substances. After multiple water bodies around a Japanese Self-Defense Force base in Hamamatsu City, Shizuoka Prefecture, per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances were detected exceeding the standard, local authorities Further investigation of groundwater at 44 locations was carried out. Investigation results released on the 20th showed that 19 of the groundwaters contained such harmful substances, posing a threat to residents' health. [Social]·The People's Bank of China and the National Bank of Cambodia signed a memorandum of understanding on cooperation. On the 21st, Pan Gongsheng, Governor of the People's Bank of China and Director of the State Administration of Foreign Exchange, met with Xie Silei, Governor of the National Bank of Cambodia. The two sides discussed financial cooperation between the two countries and other issues. They exchanged views and signed the "Memorandum of Cooperation on Establishing RMB Clearing Arrangements in Cambodia" and the "Memorandum of Understanding on Cooperation in Financial Innovation and Payment Systems between the People's Bank of China and the National Bank of Cambodia". ·Air Force Y-20 went to South Korea to bring heroes home. On the 21st, a Y-20 of the Air Force took off from an airport in central China to carry out the mission of picking up the remains of the tenth batch of volunteer martyrs back to South Korea. On the morning of the 22nd, China and South Korea will hold a ceremony to enshrine the remains of the tenth batch of volunteer martyrs. On the 23rd, this Y-20 will return to China carrying the remains of the martyrs, and two J-20s will accompany and escort them in our country’s airspace. ·China’s comprehensive ranking of innovation capabilities rose to 10th. The "National Innovation Index Report 2022-2023" released by the China Academy of Science and Technology Development Strategies on November 21 shows that the global innovation landscape maintains a three-legged stance of Asia, the United States and Europe, and the science and technology innovation center has moved eastward. The trend is even more significant, with China's comprehensive ranking of innovation capabilities rising to 10th, further moving towards the forefront of innovative countries. ·Oil prices ushered in the first "four consecutive declines" this year. According to a notice from the National Development and Reform Commission, starting from 24:00 on November 21, gasoline prices will be reduced by 340 yuan per ton and diesel prices will be reduced by 330 yuan per ton. After the above-mentioned adjustments were implemented, oil prices experienced their first "four consecutive declines" this year. ·Hepatitis B clinical cure clinic project launched nationwide. There are 410,000 new liver cancer patients in my country every year. More than 90% of liver cancers are caused by hepatitis B virus infection. Overcoming the clinical cure of hepatitis B will greatly reduce the occurrence of liver cancer. At present, some hospitals in my country have opened hepatitis B clinical cure clinics. Through antiviral treatment, some patients can achieve clinical cure, thereby reducing the risk of cirrhosis and liver cancer. It is planned to build more than 100 hepatitis B clinical cure clinics across the country by 2025. ·The Shenzhen Academy of Medical Sciences, which has been under preparation for one year, was officially established with Yan Ning as the founding president. The Shenzhen Academy of Medical Sciences, with Yan Ning as the founding president, was announced on the morning of November 21 at the Guangming Yungu International Conference Center in Shenzhen. Academicians of the Chinese Academy of Sciences Han Qide, Wang Zhizhen, Chen Zhu, Shenzhen Municipal Party Committee Deputy Secretary and Mayor Qin Weizhong and Yan Ning jointly unveiled the Shenzhen Academy of Medical Sciences. · Douyu: Company CEO Chen Shaojie was arrested by Chengdu police around November 16. Douyu announced that the company’s CEO, Mr. Chen Shaojie, was arrested by Chengdu police around November 16. The company has not received any formal notification of the investigation into Mr. Chen or the reasons for Mr. Chen’s apparent arrest. Mr. Chen's continued detention and any subsequent related legal proceedings and enforcement actions against relevant parties could have a material adverse effect on the Company's reputation, business and results of operations. [Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan] Li Jiachao calls on voters to invite family and friends to vote and contribute to good governance in the region. The voting day for the seventh District Council election of the Hong Kong SAR will be held on December 10. The Hong Kong SAR government is strengthening publicity to the public and civil servants. Chief Executive Lee Ka-chiu issued a statement on the 21st saying that he would meet with the media before attending the executive meeting on the morning of the 21st. In addition to calling on civil servants to set an example and vote on the polling day, he also once again encouraged all voters in Hong Kong to invite their family and friends to cast an important vote and contribute to good governance in the region. . ·It is more convenient for Hong Kong people to travel north to Guangzhou and Foshan. WeChat Hong Kong Wallet can connect to Yangcheng Tong WeChat Hong Kong Wallet. WeChatPayHK recently joined hands with Yangcheng Tong to improve the travel experience of Hong Kong people traveling north, and supports Hong Kong citizens to activate the "Guangzhou Public Transport Ride Code" in the Yangcheng Tong WeChat mini program and APP. ”, choose to bind WeChat Hong Kong Wallet to pay conveniently in Hong Kong dollars, eliminating the need to wait in line to buy tickets and find renewals. It is reported that WeChat Hong Kong Wallet has become the first cross-border e-wallet to support password-free payment for Guangzhou Metro contracts. ·DPP "Lai Xiaopei" completed registration for election. According to the announcement of the island's election agency, candidates for Taiwan's leader and deputy leader in 2024 can apply for registration from November 20 to 24. Candidates of the DPP Lai Qingde and his deputy Xiao Meiqin completed the registration on the 21st. Currently, the Chinese Kuomintang and the Taiwan People's Party are still negotiating whether to integrate. The candidates for the chief and deputy positions and when they will be registered have not yet been determined. Terry Gou, the founder of Hon Hai Group, has also signed a petition to qualify for the election, but his current direction has not yet been made clear. ·Taiwanese media: A major car accident occurred in Changhua. "A kindergarten school bus was shoveled up by a car." Eleven children were injured and sent to hospital. According to reports from many Taiwanese media such as "China Times News Network" and TVBS News Network, on the afternoon of the 21st, an accident occurred in Zhutang Township, Changhua County, Taiwan. In a major car accident, a rural kindergarten school bus carrying 15 people collided with a black BMW car at the Ziqiang intersection. "The kindergarten school bus was scooped up by the car." Under the violent impact, 11 young children in the car were slightly or seriously injured respectively. They have been rushed to hospitals in Changhua and Yunlin for emergency treatment. The details of the incident will be further clarified by the police. Hide d

Life is education, and family is school. Education expert Professor Zhu Yongxin once said: "Almost all excellent children have the imprint of their parents; in all problem children, the reasons for their families can also be found." Family education is the foundation of the entire education chain. If a child's growth goes awry or there are problems with his upbringing, the parents are naturally to blame. Today, we take a closer look at 9 common misunderstandings in today’s family education to see if you have fallen into any of them. There is only tame education but no personality education. China Youth Daily conducted a survey on 2,000 teenagers and found that 48.4% of the children suffered from "supporting role syndrome." Most of the interviewees admitted that the education they received since childhood was to "be a good child", and they have become more and more obedient as their parents wanted. But as they grow up, they gradually lose their edges and individuality, lack self-confidence, and lose the ability to question and imagine. German psychologist Heicha once followed and observed 100 children who dared to question authority and 100 well-behaved and obedient children. Ultimately, it was found that 84% of the former were strong-willed and had the ability to independently analyze, judge things and make decisions when they grew up; while most of the latter became submissive and fearful of taking responsibility. Zhang Tongdao, director of the documentary "Post Zero", said: "There are no two identical leaves in this world. Respecting the individuality of each child is the starting point of education." A child whose personality has been smoothed out is destined to become more mediocre as he lives. Because edges and corners are often where a person’s brilliance lies. There is only talent education but no personality education. In the popular drama "The Hidden Corner", Zhu Chaoyang is a recognized academic master. He ranks first in the grade every year, but he cannot get along with his classmates because of his dull personality. The head teacher came to his mother to discuss the matter, but his mother said: "Students should focus on studying. Making friends is something you do when you enter society. Just study well and everything else is not important." In daily life, The topics she communicated with her son were limited to homework and scores. It was precisely because of the mother's neglect of her son's character development that Chaoyang embarked on the path of darkness step by step, and eventually became a cold, dark, and lying little devil. Li Meijin, an expert in educational psychology, has emphasized more than once: Children’s character development is more important than intellectual education. The ultimate goal of education is not that everyone becomes a talent, but that everyone becomes an adult. As Professor Yi Zhongtian said: "My slogan is, I hope my children will grow up. What kind of person? A real person. Is there a standard? Yes, eight words: first truth, second kindness, third health, fourth happiness." Only There is no quality education in exam-oriented education. After this year’s college entrance examination results were released, one comment left a deep impression on me: “Today’s super academics are no longer stereotyped nerds, but are sunny, confident, cheerful, courageous, dreamy, and dare to All-round talents who challenge and reject mediocrity and give full play to the color of youth..." Indeed, today's top academics not only have excellent academic performance, but also all have talents. But if you observe carefully, you will find that the parents of these top academics often have similar educational philosophies: rather than test-taking ability, they care more about whether their children have self-learning ability, hobbies, and a strong heart. Therefore, the parents of Wu Yishu, a talented poet and poet, will cultivate the habit of reading in their daughter from an early age. They will read "Strange Stories from a Chinese Studio" and then "A Dream of Red Mansions" with their daughter; the parents of Meng Linghao, a top student in Shandong 711, will not force him to He attends tutoring classes and fully supports his son’s hobby of playing the cello. As Tang Jiangpeng, vice president of the Chinese Education Society, said: "Without scores, students cannot pass today's college entrance examination; but with only scores, I am afraid they will not be able to win future major exams." In the second half of life, what widens the gap between children is not IQ is not a score, but the cultivation of interests, the shaping of habits, the development of mentality... These comprehensive qualities are the core competitiveness of children in the future. There is only elite education but no spiritual education. Former Peking University psychiatrist Xu Kaiwen told a case: There is a child whose parents are bankers and live a wealthy life. He is also in high school in an international school and studies very hard. How hard have you worked? Since I was in junior high school, I have been studying later and later every day, at twelve o'clock, one o'clock, two o'clock... By the second semester of my sophomore year in high school, I had to stay up until three or four o'clock every night. Under the pressure, the child began to harm himself and even had suicidal thoughts. Dr. Xu suggested sending the child to the hospital for treatment, but only two days later, the parents discharged the child. When I asked, my parents said it was time for the final exam. The child also said that he must keep the first place, otherwise there will be nothing. Unexpectedly, two weeks later, the child's mother called Dr. Xu and said that the child had used the chemistry knowledge she had learned to end his own life. A child is not a learning machine, and the meaning of parents to their children is not just to urge them to become elites. Rather than teaching children to work hard to win, what children need more is someone telling them how to embrace failure. After all, on the road of life, there are times of clear skies and times of wind and rain. Real strength does not mean that you have never experienced the ravages of wind and rain, but that you can withstand it no matter how strong the wind is or how heavy the rain is. Turn the wounds you have suffered into your own unique medals. There is only short-sighted education and no competitive education. At the beginning of this year, "ChatGPT" came out. After talking to experts and conducting research, the media website Insider compiled a list of the types of jobs with the highest risk of being replaced by artificial intelligence technology. Although the span of these occupations is large, they have several obvious common characteristics: they either do not require much creativity and do not need to overthink when operating, or the work content is relatively solid and highly repetitive. This also reminds us that with the development and improvement of artificial intelligence, parents must also adjust their education strategies in a timely manner. If you only focus on the current utility, blindly force your children to answer questions, take exams, or improve their academic performance, and ignore the prediction of future development, your children will completely lose their competitiveness in ten years. Parents love their children and have far-reaching plans. What we should really focus on is not children’s recitation and problem-solving abilities, but those abilities that are scarce in artificial intelligence. For example, higher emotional intelligence, a strong heart, literary and artistic accomplishments, emotional and relationship processing abilities, etc. Education is not for temporary leadership, but a far-sighted investment. By continuing to learn and empower children, they can find opportunities to embrace the future amid tremendous changes. There is only success education but no adult education. Nan Huaijin, a master of Chinese studies, once said a shocking saying: "Don't think that getting a university diploma or a doctorate is enough to be great. This is not considered success. You must know that the purpose of education is to be a successful person." We have always emphasized the importance of success to our children. But in fact, if a child does not know how to behave, no matter how capable he is, he will be rejected by others. There is such a story: a child studying in Germany had excellent grades in school, but was repeatedly rejected when looking for a job after graduation. After one interview, he couldn't bear it anymore and asked the interviewer face to face why he was not hired. The interviewer said frankly: "We highly recognize your work ability, but we checked your credit record and found that you have experienced fare evasion three times. Therefore, we unanimously believe that you do not follow the rules and are not worthy of trust." From a long life perspective, character is the most decisive quality. No matter how outstanding your achievements are, you will not be able to be entrusted with important tasks if you have bad conduct; no matter how outstanding your abilities are, you will not be able to go far if you don't know how to behave. If you don’t want to work hard all your life and raise a waste that cannot adapt to society, you must tell your children as early as possible: Talent is very important in this life, but altruistic thinking and a down-to-earth life are more important. There is only utilitarian education but no emotional education. Qian Liqun, a professor at Peking University, once said: In Chinese universities, including the best Peking University and Tsinghua University, there are a group of students in their 20s who are already "sophisticated" students. They are highly intelligent, worldly, sophisticated, good at performing, know how to cooperate, and are better at using the system to achieve their own goals. He called this group of people "refined egoists." Such children are often the product of utilitarian education. The writer Jiu Ye knew a teacher couple who worked hard to train their son to become an elite. After the son took root in Germany, the couple spent all their savings to help their son buy a house abroad. But when his father was diagnosed with cancer, his son only came back for two days in a hurry, during which time he was still dealing with official duties. Until his father became seriously ill and passed away, his son never came home to see him again. Suddenly one day, the son heard that the house in his hometown was going to be demolished, so he took his wife and daughter back to China and asked his mother for compensation. The old mother, who was completely heartbroken, regretted it endlessly. She had only taught her children to strive for first place, but failed to teach them to love, and ultimately ended up living a miserable life. As the writer Bi Shumin said: "Parents in the world, if you love your children, you must let them start to love you and the people around you from the moment they can. This is by no means selfishness of adults, but the foresight of thinking for the whole life of your children." Teaching children to express love and give love is more important than letting them strive for first place and go to a prestigious school. With only fraction education and no life education, do you know how to easily raise a child to waste? That is to let the child have a superior status in the family, not letting him do anything, and doing everything for him like a nanny. Educator Suhomlinsky once warned parents: "Don't protect your children from working, and don't be afraid that your children's hands will wear calluses. Let your children know that bread is hard-won. This kind of labor is very important to your children." It is said to be true joy." Life is education, and family is school. On weekdays, we can let children clean up their toys by themselves, so that they can learn to arrange space reasonably and be responsible for their belongings; or we can let children go into the kitchen more, so that they can understand the ratio of ingredients and condiments, and train their hands, eyes, and It can also improve the coordination ability of the brain; it can also let children wash clothes and clean the room by themselves, so as to appreciate the hard work and dedication of their parents... It is better to let children understand the meaning of responsibility and independence in the process of sweating. the value of. There is only moral education without rules education. This summer, a tragedy occurred in Shantou, Guangdong: 12-year-old boy Xiao Du went to the beach to play with two friends. One of his companions accidentally fell into the water. Xiao Du, who was eager to save people, stretched out his arms desperately. He took action, trying to grab his companion. However, because his own strength was too weak, he also fell into the sea and was rescued by his companions who fell into the water. Xiao Du disappeared into the vast sea. Similar stories happen every year: In Tongnan District, Chongqing City, 8 children went to the river to play in the water. One child lost his footing and fell into the river. The other 7 children went to rescue them one by one, but they were all drowned by the turbulent river water. Swallowed; in Xiamen, Fujian, several teenagers went to the beach to play together. One of them fell into deep water, and the other two tried to save him. In the end, a rescuer drowned together with the person who fell into the water... There are no ifs in life, but tragedy requires Reflect. For a long time, our education has always been habitual to instill in children the concept of self-sacrifice and selfless sacrifice, and blindly requires children to be kind and brave. But few people tell their children about the rules of life: when you are weak and encounter an emergency, you don’t have to be so "kind". Do your best to ensure your own safety first, and then call for help from the adults around you or call the police; when facing bad people, , you don't have to be completely "honest", you can choose to lie to ensure your personal safety... It is certainly important to cultivate children's sense of morality, but the rules about life safety must also be instilled in time. I hope you can collect the above nine reflections on Chinese family education and reflect on yourself at any time. Don't let wrong educational concepts delay your child's future. Hide d

Micro reducers involving finger joints; ② Caitong Machinery She Weichao pointed out that the current market expectation for harmonic reducers is that they are only partially used for humanoid robot rotating joints. If the finger joint ultra-small reducer is successfully applied, then a single robot reducer The usage may further increase significantly from 12-14 to about 30; ③ According to the online quotation of Yinshi Robot, the price of a single dexterous hand is about 50,000 yuan. If the sales volume of humanoid robots reaches one million units in the future, the corresponding market size of dexterous hands will be Reaching 100 billion yuan; ④ She Weichao is optimistic that companies that master core components such as coreless motors, precision gearboxes, encoders, drives, sensors, springs, etc. are more likely to occupy the leading position in the industry; ⑤ Risk warning: The mass production of humanoid robots is not progressing as expected. 6. Nuopoxin (002215) Highlights: ① The company has entered the new blue ocean track of substrate blueberries, and the first production of blueberry base in the 2023 production season has been successful, achieving export sales of about 6,600 tons, and contributing profits of about 130 million; ② Wang Wei of Northeast Securities is expected to put into production next year. The area has increased to more than 20,000 acres and 30,000 acres respectively, with corresponding production and sales exceeding 20,000 tons and 40,000 tons respectively, and the mature market period is earlier, with an exclusive market supply gap period from November to February of the following year, thus Enjoy high price dividends. Calculated based on this year’s profit per ton of 20,000/ton, the corresponding profits are 400 million/800 million respectively; ③ Affected by El Niño this year, South American blueberry production has been reduced in the new season, and the significant reduction in imports is expected to push up domestic blueberry prices next year. Wang Wei raised the price The company's profit forecast for 2023-25 is 377/716/877 million yuan, and it has been upgraded to a buy rating; ④ Risk warning: blueberry price fluctuations, natural disaster risks. FinanceClosed

The latest update is here. Sam is negotiating with the board of directors and feels that the possibility of return is relatively high. Key points: -Sam Altman is currently discussing a possible return with the OpenAI board of directors. He especially communicated with Adam D'Angelo (CEO of POE). -One of the options is to establish a transitional board of directors with Sam as director. - OpenAI’s new CEO Emmett Shear revealed to relevant sources that if the board of directors cannot provide sufficient evidence, he will choose to leave his post. The following is a report from Bloomberg: Sam Altman has opened negotiations with the OpenAI board to explore his possible return - the negotiations focus on whether Altman can return as CEO - current CEO Emmett Shear asked the board to provide evidence of Altman's misconduct. According to people familiar with the matter, Sam Altman, part of OpenAI Board members and the company's interim CEO have begun talks to consider bringing the ousted CEO back to the artificial intelligence startup he co-founded. The negotiations were between Altman, CEO Emmett Shear and at least one board member, Adam D'Angelo. People familiar with the matter said they chose to remain anonymous because the discussions were private and could end in nothing. The talks also involve some of OpenAI's investors, many of whom are actively pushing for Altman's return. A person familiar with the matter said that if Altman does return, he will serve as the company's CEO. One possibility currently being discussed is that Altman would serve on a transitional board. At the same time, according to multiple people familiar with the matter, former Salesforce Inc. co-CEO Bret Taylor may also serve as a director on the new board of directors. The board's communication with Altman was an important development because until Monday, directors had largely refused to engage with the executive they fired on Friday, according to several people familiar with the matter. According to Bloomberg, OpenAI shareholders who want Altman to return to his position include Thrive Capital, Khosla Ventures and Tiger Global Management. Sequoia Capital, a well-known venture capital firm, is acting in concert with these shareholders, another person familiar with the matter said. On Monday, Anna Makanju, the company's vice president of global affairs, sent a memo to employees saying the company had been having "intensive discussions" with the board, Altman and Shear to reach consensus. Previously, most employees had threatened to resign en masse if Altman was not reappointed, among other demands. More details: OpenAI leadership tells employees to 'move on' amid chaos Addressing the company's leadership turmoil before Thanksgiving is an urgent priority, a person familiar with the matter said, hoping employees won't have to worry about themselves during the holiday. job prospects. The decision to fire Altman came under scrutiny from the board, which claimed the CEO was "not always honest" in his communications. Since then, board members and employees have said the CEO's removal was not related to any "inappropriate conduct" or "security issues," leaving an information void. As the CEO of Microsoft Corp., OpenAI’s largest investor, Satya Nadella publicly stated that he had not received any explanation on this matter. The view of the Bloomberg think tank is that Sam Altman may return as CEO of OpenAI, which will greatly enhance Microsoft's strategic position, especially if Microsoft can have a seat on the new board of directors. This may also be an outcome that Microsoft would prefer to see, considering the higher legal risks it may face if it employs the majority of OpenAI employees. Bloomberg think tank believes that the possibility of Microsoft acquiring OpenAI is very small because there are still regulatory challenges. —Analysts Anurag Rana and Andrew Girard Click here to view the research report. According to people familiar with the situation, even current CEO Shear knew nothing about this decision. He told people close to OpenAI that he did not plan to stay on if the board could not clearly communicate to him in writing the specific reasons for firing Altman. As of Friday, the company's board of directors included Altman, President Greg Brockman, chief scientist Ilya Sutskever, Quora Inc. CEO D'Angelo, tech entrepreneur Tasha McCauley and Helen Toner, director of strategy at Georgetown University's Center for Security and Emerging Technologies, according to people familiar with the matter. After Altman left, Brockman left the company in protest. In negotiations with the board, Altman was represented by Airbnb Inc. CEO Brian Chesky, while Shear represented D'Angelo and the board, according to people familiar with the situation. Taylor, who served on Twitter's board of directors before being acquired by Elon Musk, is said to be taking a more neutral role in the mediation. OpenAI declined to comment on these negotiations. OWeb linkCollapsed

OpenAI's "Palace Change" in the past two days has triggered a big discussion on "how artificial intelligence should develop". Should the development of artificial intelligence be restricted and only allowed to become an auxiliary tool for humans? Or should it be allowed to develop? Let it become a human-level existence, or even surpass human beings (it can do everything instead of human beings)? 

The self-driving car accident that occurred in the United States in October can give us some hints. On October 2, a human-driven car hit a pedestrian in San Francisco, USA. It was not a big deal, and the pedestrian who was hit was not seriously injured. However, after the pedestrian was hit, he fell under a self-driving car; the self-driving car started to park to the right according to the intelligent principle of "pull over after a collision to minimize safety risks"; this caused the pedestrian below to , was dragged 6 meters by the self-driving car, crushed and hit, and his injuries became serious. 

Logically speaking, there is nothing wrong with pulling over after a collision. However, the autonomous driving system did not take into account various special situations (such as this time, there was a person under the wheel), which led to disaster. Of course, you can say that the autonomous driving system is not mature enough yet, and it will be perfect after taking into account various special circumstances. 

However, what I want to remind you is: the core of this matter is not that the autonomous driving is not perfect, but that the autonomous driving system can completely reject human intervention and make its own judgments. If autonomous driving is controlled by some bad capital, the people riding on autonomous driving and the city streets where autonomous driving is rampant will become prey for others; if autonomous driving derives autonomous consciousness, it can even oppose AI. Engineers modified it. 

So, my personal point of view is: the development direction of artificial intelligence must be to "let it become a high-level assistant to human beings", and it must be left in the artificial intelligence backend port that humans can intervene at any time. Highest authority. 

To use a sentence from the famous science fiction book "The Three-Body Problem": We must give civilization to technology, rather than giving technology to civilization. Hide d

From Bloomberg: There are not many details about the interpretation of the future battle of OpenAI, but it talks about the background of the whole thing in general, and specifically mentions China’s investment and work results in AI that are eye-catching. ——Interpretation of the battle for the future of OpenAI - Sam Altman's sudden dismissal triggered chaos in the startup company - Almost all employees are currently threatening to leave the company OpenAI, as the developer of ChatGPT, fired its co-founder and co-founder last Friday. CEO Sam Altman caused a huge controversy. This shocking news has unsettled investors, partners and employees, and also made this start-up company at the forefront of the world's artificial intelligence field face severe challenges. Summary of key information: Why is OpenAI so critical? The San Francisco-based company launched ChatGPT a year ago, and the AI chatbot now has 100 million weekly users. The great success of ChatGPT not only triggered a large-scale investment trend in generative AI, but also pushed artificial intelligence into the public eye. OpenAI’s technology has also become the benchmark for many competing AI companies around the world. In the days before Altman's departure, OpenAI's valuation reached about $86 billion in an equity transfer that was about to be completed. Now the fate of this equity transfer is in jeopardy. OpenAI's close relationship with Microsoft Corp., which owns about 49% of OpenAI and is its main provider of computing power, further enhances the startup's standing in the industry. Affected by the turmoil in OpenAI's leadership, Microsoft's stock price has also fluctuated. What’s happening with OpenAI recently? On Friday, OpenAI's board issued a cryptic statement, saying Altman was fired because he "was not always candid in his communications with the board." Another co-founder, Greg Brockman, was demoted from the board and quit in protest. The pair tried to negotiate a return to OpenAI on Sunday, with one condition being that existing board members be replaced. Meanwhile, OpenAI's investors and top executives are pushing for Altman's reappointment. However, OpenAI's board of directors eventually appointed Twitch co-founder and former CEO Emmett Shear as the second interim CEO. The previous interim CEO-Chief Technology Officer Mira Murati-supported the return of Altman and Brockman to the company. Later, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella announced that Altman and Brockman would lead a new AI research group within the $2.8 trillion software company. After this, almost all OpenAI employees threatened to leave and join Microsoft unless Altman was reappointed and the entire board of directors resigned. What do the two opposing sides pursue? Altman has been a leading figure at OpenAI, transforming the company from a nonprofit into a globally recognized AI research brand. But he and board members disagreed over steps to rapidly develop generative AI, how to commercialize the product and how to reduce potential harm to the public. So far, the board of directors has given no further public explanation for Altman's departure. For Microsoft, OpenAI is the core of its AI strategy. Nadella showed that whether Altman and his team return to Microsoft or OpenAI, he will be fine with it. The key is to maintain the expertise and research power they had last week. In addition, companies such as Nvidia Corp. and Salesforce Inc. have expressed willingness to hire OpenAI software engineers. After Nvidia's high-standard accelerator chips, AI talent is the industry's scarcest resource. Why do some people think OpenAI’s technology may be dangerous? This is in line with widespread concerns about the threats that AI may pose. There are concerns that rapid development of AI without adequate human supervision may produce uncontrolled intelligence. While this theoretical scenario may be some time away, efforts are still underway to understand the full impact that intelligent computers could have, including augmenting or replacing jobs, accurately predicting the future, and simulating human reasoning and conversation. How does the turmoil at OpenAI reflect the broader discussion about AI? While we haven't yet gotten a full explanation for the board's firing of Altman, the dispute over the speed of commercialization appears to be the key. This divide is reflected in other areas as well. For example, Google has always advocated a cautious and slow-moving strategy, which made it seem slightly behind OpenAI after it launched ChatGPT and quickly became popular. Although Google has invested more than ten years of research and investment in the field of AI. With labels like “accelerationist” and “safetyist” emerging, lines have been drawn around levels of optimism about AI’s potential benefits and risks. Some accelerationists argue that the United States must act as quickly as possible in order not to be overtaken by China. Google CEO Sundar Pichai also said that China’s investment and work results in AI are impressive. Google’s Pichai thinks China will be at the forefront of AI (1) O web link Why do people want Altman to return to OpenAI? Altman played a key role in raising OpenAI's profile and securing a multibillion-dollar deal with Microsoft that provided the company with the technology resources it needed. His experience at the startup accelerator YCombinator and his interactions with the Silicon Valley venture capital circle make him well-suited to lead the company in seeking additional investment and support. The $86 billion equity transfer, led by Thrive Capital, has not been completely canceled, but now appears to depend on Altman's return and OpenAI returning to its status quo before last week's changes. What is the future direction of artificial intelligence? This emerging technology is undergoing regulatory scrutiny and assessment globally, with the UK recently organizing an international conference to discuss appropriate strategies for its adoption. Private companies and government agencies are negotiating how to mitigate potential harm without stifling innovation. In China, Beijing has also taken the lead in formulating a series of clear regulations on the use of AI, taking into account the benefits and competitive advantages brought by leadership in the technological field. In terms of the development and application of AI, the current focus of most people is to obtain as much computing power as possible to train large-scale basic models. The next focus will be on model optimization and specialization. Before last week's chaos, OpenAI was hard at work developing AI "agents" capable of handling more complex tasks, the next critical step in the development of artificial intelligence. The stock price hits a new high, is Microsoft a "blessing in disguise", and will it eliminate the troubles of AI in one fell swoop? Although the OpenAI court battle has not yet ended, looking back at Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's actions over the past two days, he is indeed known as the master of market value management. Last Friday, the OpenAI board of directors suddenly fired CEO Sam Altman without warning, and President Brockman announced his resignation in protest. After the crisis broke out unexpectedly, Microsoft was actually confused. Nadella himself only received the news a few minutes before the dismissal announcement was issued. After Microsoft immediately issued a bland statement indicating that it would continue to cooperate with OpneAI, Microsoft's market value evaporated by nearly 2% last Friday, almost losing one JD.com. Throughout the weekend, investors around the world were focusing on how OpenAI’s court battle would end, and Nadella’s actions could be said to turn the tide—she recruited Sam Altman and Greg Brockman before the start of the U.S. stock market’s night trading, without letting them go out to set up a new business, nor did they Let them be poached by competitors like Google. Microsoft finally closed up 2% on Monday, completely recovering the losses caused by the palace dispute and hitting a record high. The stock price continued to rise after the market closed. Looking back at the entire incident, Microsoft is definitely a blessing in disguise, and Nadella has demonstrated his extraordinary ability to protect shareholder value. Now 95% of OpenAI employees have signed a joint letter threatening to join Microsoft, and Nadella has almost acquired OpenAI at a very small cost. In the words of analyst Ben Thompson, "There is no risk of antitrust litigation." But what is more important for Microsoft right now is to completely eradicate future troubles. The follow-up direction of Gong Dou is uncertain. Altman may still return to Microsoft and is determined to "eliminate future troubles." On Monday, local time, Nadella said in a media interview that OpenAI's key artificial intelligence research is still continuing, and the partnership with Microsoft is also continuing. OpenAI employees can choose to stay in their current positions or switch to Microsoft. He is "open to both options" and stressed that Microsoft will prepare "the conditions for continued independent innovation" for its upcoming new colleagues. However, his statements in the interview also hinted that Altman's final whereabouts may still be unclear. If the board member who initiated the coup resigns and OpenAI's management structure is reorganized, Altman still seems to be expected to return. Microsoft's abacus is very obvious: Either all OpenAI employees will be merged into Microsoft and become Microsoft's inhouseAI department, or the governance structure will be reorganized to prevent similar things from happening in the future. But no matter which outcome, Microsoft is the winner - considering that OpenAI still needs Microsoft's financial support and computing backbone to develop its technology, it is also a good thing for Microsoft to let Altman return to OpenAI under a different organizational structure. OpenAI's major investors, including Microsoft, Tiger Global, Thrive Capital, and Sequoia, tried to overturn the decision of the OpenAI board of directors over the weekend and let the expelled Altman return to the helm, but the negotiations ultimately failed. "I think it's very clear that there have to be some changes around governance," Nadella stressed in Monday's interview, adding that Microsoft "will have a friendly conversation with OpenAI's board about this." In addition, Nadella also said that Microsoft respects OpenAI’s non-profit roots and shares its beliefs about AI safety: “We want to make sure that from day one, we are not only dealing with the benefits of technology, but also the risks that technology brings. Unintended consequences, rather than waiting for things to happen before dealing with them." The palace fight incident also exposed Microsoft's weaknesses. Although the situation was effectively controlled, it must be emphasized that the occurrence of this palace fight farce has highlighted the seriousness of the Microsoft-OpenAI relationship. instability. As the world's second largest company by market value, Microsoft's investment of more than $13 billion in OpenAI did not buy enough influence. Microsoft has no board seat and no control over OpenAI. Although it continues to launch profitable products and services, OpenAI is still a non-profit organization in terms of organizational structure. Three independent directors who have nothing to do with the company's interests control more than half of the seats. NewStreetResearch analysts wrote in a report on Sunday: "Because OpenAI's board of directors controls both non-profit and for-profit entities, it controls its cooperation with Microsoft and therefore controls Microsoft's future." Since January this year Since the additional investment in OpenAI, Microsoft's market value has increased by nearly one trillion US dollars during this period, far ahead among technology giants. This technology giant, which missed the mobile transformation, is not lagging behind in the competition of emerging technologies for the first time in more than two decades. According to Wall Street analysts' expectations, although revenue has approached US$300 billion, AI will still create significant new growth space, and Microsoft's revenue is expected to grow at an average annual rate of 14% in the next three years. Microsoft needs an OpenAI with more stable management, or it can cultivate its own inhouseAI department by absorbing OpenAI talents. Nadella must let Microsoft's big customers know that Microsoft's important code and competitive advantages will not be disrupted by Silicon Valley soap operas. The dramatic reversal and reversal of the OpenAI palace fight has reached a jaw-dropping level. Yesterday, the OpenAI board of directors withstood the tremendous pressure from investors and employees and hired someone from outside the company to take over the CEO position. Negotiations for the return of former CEO Sam Altman and former president Greg Brockman, who were fired by the board of directors, have completely broken down. At the same time, Microsoft, OpenAI’s largest funder, announced that Altman and Brockman will join Microsoft to lead the AI department. But the matter was not over yet. OpenAI employees who learned that their old leader would not return began to write a joint letter threatening that if Sam Altman and Greg Brockman could not return to OpenAI, they would also resign and join Microsoft. As of press time, according to the latest statistics from X netizens, 734 of OpenAI's more than 770 employees have signed a joint letter, and the entire OpenAI can basically be disbanded on the spot. The most outrageous thing is that the chief scientist Ilya Sutskever, who was previously regarded as the "coup mastermind", also signed the joint letter and tweeted to express his regret for participating in the coup, which means that he has completely shifted to the Altman camp. Reflecting on the recent OpenAI battle, OpenAI chief scientist Ilya kicked Ultraman out of the game. What Musk said is very accurate. Ilya must have seen something to be so radical. And this is most likely about the security of artificial intelligence. Today, the rapid progress of human science and technology has far exceeded the original imagination of mankind. So far, humans have conquered the lowest standard of artificial intelligence - ANI - in many aspects, and it is everywhere. The artificial intelligence revolution is a road from weak artificial intelligence (ANI), to artificial general intelligence (AGI), and then to super artificial intelligence (ASI). Where will mankind go on this road? Will humans be killed by their own inventions? Not to mention the risk of powerful artificial intelligence being mastered by human extremists and used to eliminate dissidents, perhaps humans feel that this aspect is controllable. What if artificial intelligence becomes too powerful for humans to control and becomes enemies of humans? For artificial intelligence to be friendly artificial intelligence, it must be neither hostile to humans nor indifferent to humans. We need to design the core code of artificial intelligence so that it has a deep understanding of human values. The development of artificial intelligence needs to be similar to the development of cloning technology. Is it time to set rules? Hide d

Zhong Zhengsheng: Can the "re-industrialization" of the United States break through under the Biden era? Author: Zhong Zhengsheng, Fan Chengkai (Zhong Zhengsheng is a director of the China Chief Economist Forum and chief economist of Ping An Securities) Core Points Biden’s “re-industrialization” is beginning to show results. Since 2021, the Biden administration has sounded the clarion call for "Reindustrialization 3.0" and launched the largest public investment plan since Roosevelt's New Deal, focusing on the "American Rescue Plan" (ARP) and the "Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act" ( IIJA), the Chip and Science Act (CHIPS) and the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA). Investment plans related to the "re-industrialization" theme total approximately US$1.2 trillion, which are planned to be invested in the next 5-10 years, with the peak expenditure likely to be in 2024-2027. How to understand Biden’s vision of “reindustrialization”? First, Biden's "re-industrialization" inherits the goals of the Obama era and has become a consensus between the two parties now; second, the impact of the new crown has strengthened the Biden administration's focus on infrastructure and industrial chain security; finally, in the context of the game between great powers, There is greater urgency for the United States to revive its manufacturing industry. So far, the initial results of Biden's "re-industrialization" are as follows: 1) manufacturing employment has recovered rapidly and exceeded the pre-COVID-19 level; 2) demand for goods has driven a recovery in the proportion of manufacturing added value in GDP, and the economic structure has been optimized; 3) Non-residential construction investment has increased significantly, mainly driven by the infrastructure field and the computer, electronics and electrical industries; 4) Capital expenditures (CAPEX) of U.S. listed companies have increased significantly; 5) FDI inflows into the U.S. manufacturing industry have accelerated, etc. New opportunities for America’s “reindustrialization.” The U.S. has made limited progress in revitalizing its manufacturing industry over the past decade due to a variety of reasons - declining consumer demand for goods relative to services, lack of coherence in industrial policy, labor cost disadvantages, and the negative impact of the appreciation of the U.S. dollar. In comparison, we believe that under the Biden era, the probability of successful "re-industrialization" in the United States is higher: 1) The current U.S. infrastructure and manufacturing investment cycle coincides with an upswing, which may strengthen the effect of reindustrialization policies. 2) The development of high-end manufacturing may help break the bottleneck of commodity demand. From 2021 to 2022, the proportion of U.S. consumption of goods, especially durable goods, will increase significantly. In the future, the demand for high-end manufacturing such as new energy vehicles and semiconductors in the United States and around the world will grow significantly. 3) The Biden administration’s “place-based” industrial policy is groundbreaking or more scientific. In addition, the Biden administration has shown greater boldness in implementing large-scale fiscal policies and vigorous industrial policies. 4) The quality of the American labor force is more advantageous in high-end manufacturing competition. This is partly due to the accumulation of relevant talents since the Obama era. 5) The comprehensive cost of the U.S. manufacturing industry may be more advantageous after taking into account economic security considerations (especially energy security, industrial chain risks, etc.). Challenges inherent in America’s “reindustrialization.” First, in the context of automation and artificial intelligence, it may be difficult to develop high-end manufacturing to save the loss of manufacturing jobs in the United States. Second, the United States’ “reindustrialization” policy may still be subject to the U.S. political system. If the Democratic Party loses the upcoming 2024 election, Biden's industrial policies may not be implemented. Third, manufacturing competition from non-U.S. regions is still intensifying. The comprehensive strength of China's manufacturing industry continues to rise, developed economies such as the European Union are also promoting "re-industrialization", and other emerging economies besides China may also join the competition. Fourth, a strong dollar may continue to weaken U.S. manufacturing exports. Detailed link:OWebpage linkCollapsed
