[Twenty Major Spirits Daily Learning] Uphold and develop the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era @China Chang'an Net @ Supreme People's Procuratorate @ Xinjiang Procuratorial @ Uphold and develop the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era at the grassroots level of society, and improve the mechanism for correctly handling contradictions among the people under the new situation. This year marks the 60th anniversary of Comrade Mao Zedong’s instructions to study and promote the “Maple Bridge Experience” and the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Xi Jinping’s instructions to uphold and develop the “Maple Bridge Experience”. When General Secretary Xi Jinping visited Fengqiao Town, the birthplace of the “Maple Bridge Experience” on September 20, he pointed out, “We must uphold and develop the Maple Bridge Experience in the new era, adhere to the party’s mass line, and correctly handle contradictions among the people. Rely closely on the people, solve problems at the grassroots level and nip them in the bud." This important speech established an action guide for upholding and developing the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era. 1. Deeply understand the connotation of the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era. General Secretary Xi Jinping's important speech during his inspection in Fengqiao Town, Zhejiang, comprehensively elaborated on adhering to and developing the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era from the perspective of historical materialism and materialist dialectics. experience” core tenor. "Adhere to the party's mass line." The mass line is the lifeline and fundamental work line of the party. In order to correctly handle contradictions among the people, the party relied on cadres and the masses to create the "Maple Bridge Experience" and promoted it nationwide. This is the party's affirmation and sublimation of the masses' initiative, and ultimately "turns the party's correct ideas into the conscious actions of the masses." . The "Maple Bridge Experience" follows the cognitive rule of "from practice, to practice", gives full play to the masses' acumen in identifying contradictions and their initiative in resolving conflicts, and reflects the high degree of unity between the party's leadership position and the masses' dominant position in social governance. . "Correctly handle contradictions among the people." From its creation to promotion, from continuous development to continuous sublimation, the "Maple Bridge Experience" reflects the correct handling of contradictions among the people. Comrade Mao Zedong once pointed out that "the correct handling of contradictions among the people" requires distinguishing between contradictions between ourselves and the enemy and contradictions among the people. "Conflicts among the people are non-antagonistic contradictions" and must be resolved by the method of "unity-criticism-unity". The "Maple Bridge Experience" adheres to the people-centered stance, the idea of valuing peace, and the method of persuasion and education, ensuring the correct direction of promoting harmony, stability, and development when dealing with conflicts among the people. "Rely closely on the people." The people are the producers of material wealth, the creators of spiritual wealth and the decisive force for social change. In the 1960s, Fengqiao innovated methods in the socialist education movement, insisting on arresting fewer people, not turning over conflicts, and relying on the masses to reform the "four types of elements" on the spot; in the 1980s, in order to combat criminal crimes, various localities implemented integrated Comprehensive social security management that integrates combat, prevention, education, and management; in the new era, widely established grassroots governance organizations and conflict resolution centers all have the masses as the important subjects and those responsible for resolving conflicts. The "Maple Bridge Experience" fully embodies the working principle of "closely relying on the people" to prevent, mediate and resolve social conflicts and disputes. "Solve problems at the grassroots level." The grassroots level is the cell of society and the basis for building a harmonious society. If the foundation is not strong, the ground will shake. It can be said that the grassroots level is not only the "source" of interest conflicts and social contradictions, but also the "stubble" for coordinating interest relationships and easing social contradictions. The report of the 20th National Congress of the Communist Party of China positioned the working field of the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era at the grassroots level of society, and regarded the resolution of contradictions and conflicts at the grassroots level as an important working mechanism. "Nip problems in the bud." The process from the emergence to the disintegration of conflicts is divided into four stages: non-confrontation, balance, confrontation, and intensification. "Resolving conflicts in the bud" means proactively analyzing risk points based on the logic of conflict evolution, intervening in the conflict process in advance, preventing the disorderly evolution of conflicts, and resolving conflicts in a non-confrontational or balanced stage. In the 1990s, Fengqiao cadres and the masses established the "Four Front Work Method", that is, organization construction precedes work, prediction work precedes prevention, prevention work precedes mediation, and mediation precedes intensification; at the beginning of the 21st century, The development is "four in advance and four early", that is, early warning is in advance, and the emerging problems are digested early; education is in advance, key objects are transformed early; control is in advance, and sensitive periods are prevented early; mediation is in advance, and conflicts and disputes are handled early, all based on contradictions. An initiative to establish work goals in stages. 2. Correctly understand the new situations and new issues facing grassroots governance. On March 1, 2013, General Secretary Xi Jinping pointed out in his important speech at the 80th anniversary conference and opening ceremony of the Central Party School that “an important issue facing the whole party , is how to correctly understand and properly handle the new situations and new problems that continue to arise after our country develops." Correctly understanding the new situations and new problems that are constantly emerging is the premise and foundation for adhering to and developing the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era. The subject of the conflict changes. The first is the change in the proportion of urban and rural population. Calculated in terms of permanent population, in 1963 when the "Maple Bridge Experience" was formed, my country's urbanization rate was 16.84%; in 1978, at the beginning of reform and opening up, my country's urbanization rate was 17.92%; in 2022, it climbed to 65.22%. As a large number of people gather in cities, rural residents decrease sharply, and the countryside becomes "hollowed out." Second, the composition of the urban and rural population is becoming increasingly complex. In the past, the identities of my country's social population were relatively single, mostly workers, farmers, cadres, etc. Currently, from a statistical perspective alone, it can be divided into 8 major categories and more than 1,800 subcategories. Third, personnel mobility has increased dramatically. With the rapid development of information, transportation, logistics, etc., the household registration system has gradually weakened, the phenomenon of "separation of people and households" has become more common, and the "society of acquaintances" has gradually turned into a "society of strangers". Conflicts of ideas occur from time to time, and management vacancies inevitably occur. The realization of "small things do not leave the village and big things do not leave the town" faces many new situations and new challenges. The contradictory objects have been adjusted. At present, the main contradiction in our society has been transformed into the contradiction between the people's growing needs for a better life and unbalanced and inadequate development. A better life requires not only higher demands on material and cultural life, but also increasing demands on democracy, rule of law, fairness, justice, security, and the environment. The main manifestations are the increase in the number of contradictions, the diversity of types of contradictions, and the diversity of contradictory demands. In addition to traditional marriage, family, and property disputes, the proportion of economic and labor disputes has increased, real estate expropriation and NIMBY incidents occur from time to time, and production safety and urban safety issues are prominent. People no longer stop at general mediation and resolution of conflicts, but increasingly have diverse demands such as information disclosure, agile governance, administrative response, procedural fairness, and public participation. The contradictory environment undergoes changes. First, changes in the economic development environment. In the 1960s, Fengqiao Town, Zhuji City, Zhejiang Province created the "Fengqiao Experience" in the socialist education movement. Compared with 60 years ago, today's economic and social development has undergone tremendous changes, and new contradictions such as economic disputes, ecological and environmental protection disputes, and Internet disputes are constantly emerging. How to adhere to and develop the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era while constantly innovating has become a problem for all regions. New issues faced by various departments. The second is the change in the interpersonal communication environment. General Secretary Xi Jinping pointed out that if we cannot pass the Internet, we will not be able to pass the long-term rule. The development of the Internet has changed the way people communicate or interact, and the combination of online and offline has brought about changes in governance. Currently, the number of online petitions nationwide accounts for more than 70% of the total number of petitions. At the same time, the Internet is prone to the "information cocoon" effect, forming new conflict fields, leading to the emergence of problems such as the solidification of prejudices, information distortion, superposition of contradictions, and intensification of conflicts. The third is changes in the institutional environment. There are 298 effective laws and more than 600 administrative regulations in my country. There are a large number of local laws and regulations, and various technical standards and normative documents are also very complete. Compared with 60 years ago, grassroots governance is more "law-based", but it also puts forward higher requirements for specific work. How to develop well in the new era within a more detailed institutional framework and on the premise of legality and compliance? "Maple Bridge Experience" has become a new situation faced by grassroots governance. 3. Coordinate and handle several dialectical relationships, and improve grassroots governance with the "Maple Bridge Experience". Upholding and developing the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era is of great significance to us in promoting Chinese-style modernization and continuously improving the grassroots governance system and modernization of governance capabilities. , in specific practical work, we must focus on handling the following dialectical relationships. We must properly handle the dialectical relationship between upholding the party's leadership and stimulating the enthusiasm, initiative and creativity of the masses. To uphold and develop the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era, we must adhere to the party's mass line, promote party building to lead grassroots governance, strengthen the construction of grassroots party organizations, and strengthen the work of party members and leading cadres in visiting, sinking, and receiving visits. Strengthen the party's administrative supervision of the government in accordance with the law, carry out work to cultivate social rational space, and establish an all-round coordination mechanism for conflict mediation and handling of emergencies. At the same time, we should give full play to the advantages of grassroots diversified governance and build a social governance community. In terms of governance foundation, we will further improve the grassroots governance platform with grid management, refined services, and information support; in terms of governance methods, we will build multiple effective mechanisms that combine autonomy, rule of law, rule of morality, and intelligent governance. Handle the dialectical relationship between the universality and particularity of the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era. In the new era, the "Fengqiao experience" has surpassed the "Fengqiao Town experience" and the "social security experience", rising from "one place strategy" to "one country strategy" and from "safe Zhejiang" to "safe Zhejiang". "Safe China", uphold and develop the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era, we must not only adhere to the universality, firmly grasp the core connotation, outstanding characteristics, fundamental characteristics, distinctive characteristics and other essentials, but also combine the particularity and strive to achieve It has highlights, characteristics, innovation and vitality. For example, the “Three Zeros” work method of Mudan Community in Shenyang, Liaoning Province, the “Fengqiao Hometown of Overseas Chinese” dispute resolution method in Mingxi County, Fujian Province, the “trust system” dispute resolution work method of Wuhou District, Chengdu, Sichuan Province, Nanjing Maritime Court, etc. 11 The practical exploration of the "Maple Bridge Experience on the Sea" by domestic units, and the cross-regional conflict and dispute mediation in Haidong City, Qinghai to serve the "ramen economy". These innovative practices not only adhere to the universality of the "Maple Bridge Experience", but are also based on regions and industries. The particularity is the persistence and development of the "Maple Bridge Experience", which helps to "guarantee a new development pattern with a new security pattern" and ensure stable economic development and long-term social stability. We must properly handle the dialectical relationship between governance according to law and comprehensive policy implementation. The "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era should be good at using legal thinking and legal methods to resolve conflicts and problems involving the vital interests of the masses. In terms of establishing rules, we maintain the expression of mass demands, coordination of interests, and protection of rights and interests, and protect the interests of new social groups; in terms of rule enforcement, we increase efforts to use conflict guidance, guidance, mediation, arbitration, etc.; in terms of supervision and inspection, Improve procuratorial suggestions, judicial suggestions, supervision suggestions, traceability management and other preventive measures. At the same time, comprehensive policies should be implemented. The most important achievement and the most distinctive feature of the "Maple Bridge Experience" that has developed to this day is the realization of the unity of self-discipline and heterodiscipline, rigidity and flexibility, body and mind management, human power and technology. We should be good at using a variety of effective governance methods and tools, clarify the boundaries of mass autonomy, improve the rules and procedures of procedures, carry forward the excellent traditional Chinese culture of "honesty and amity, benevolence and good neighbors", and highlight the demonstration and demonstration of morality in grassroots social governance. Educational role, giving full play to the supporting role of technical means, and truly realizing the integration of the four governance of "autonomy, rule of law, rule of morality, and rule of intelligence". Handle the dialectical relationship between emergency response and normal management in preventing and resolving conflicts. "Maple Bridge Experience" is constantly being given new functions, but maintaining long-term social stability has always been its important goal. To uphold and develop the "Maple Bridge Experience" in the new era, we must accurately grasp the evolution laws of conflicts, strengthen prevention awareness, move the gateway forward, control the conflict situation as soon as possible, and do a good job in emergency response. At the same time, we will strengthen normal risk management and resilience governance. Daily communication with the masses should be strengthened, channels for the masses to express their demands should be opened up, social conditions and public opinion should be regularly assessed, and an "emergency first responder" system should be established to understand even the smallest details. We should be good at giving full play to the technical support role of the network and artificial intelligence, strengthen the construction of monitoring and early warning platforms and mechanisms, strengthen risk analysis and assessment, so that "the platform can run more and the people run less", and nip problems in their bud. Handle the dialectical relationship between online cyberspace and offline real space. General Secretary Xi Jinping pointed out, “Party and government organs and leading cadres at all levels must learn to follow the mass line through the Internet, frequently browse the Internet, dive, chat, and speak out, understand the people’s thoughts and wishes, collect good ideas and suggestions, and actively Respond to netizens’ concerns and resolve doubts.” The online "Maple Bridge Experience" that has been innovatively formed in some places to "handle matters online, resolve disputes, ensure safety and development, and always provide services online" has given full play to the advantages of the Internet in collecting public opinion, leveraging people's wisdom, intelligent monitoring, and automatic early warning. and functions, which is a positive form of "taking the online mass line well". In the new era, we should actively and orderly guide the construction of channels for the Internet to participate in and discuss politics, give full play to the social governance functions of "city message boards", "public sentiments online" and various "two micro and one terminal" platforms, and mobilize people's enthusiasm to participate in social governance through the Internet. Strengthen the integration of online and offline work to improve online conflict resolution and network security governance capabilities. Source: Guangming DailyCollapsed

OpenAI's "Palace Changes" in the past two days have triggered a big discussion on "how artificial intelligence should develop". Should the development of artificial intelligence be restricted and only allowed to become an auxiliary tool for humans? Or should it be allowed to develop? Let it become a human-level existence, or even surpass human beings (it can do everything instead of human beings)? The self-driving car accident that occurred in the United States in October can give us some hints. On October 2, a human-driven car hit a pedestrian in San Francisco, USA. It was not a big deal, and the pedestrian who was hit was not seriously injured. However, after the pedestrian was hit, he fell under a self-driving car; the self-driving car started to park to the right according to the intelligent principle of "pull over after a collision to minimize safety risks"; this caused the pedestrian below to , was dragged 6 meters by the self-driving car, crushed and hit, and his injuries became serious. Logically speaking, there is nothing wrong with pulling over after a collision. However, the autonomous driving system did not take into account various special situations (such as this time, there was a person under the wheel), which led to disaster. Of course, you can say that the autonomous driving system is not mature enough yet, and it will be perfect after taking into account various special circumstances. However, what I want to remind you is: the core of this matter is not that the autonomous driving is imperfect, but that the autonomous driving system can completely reject human intervention and make its own judgments. If autonomous driving is controlled by some bad capital, the people riding on autonomous driving and the city streets where autonomous driving is rampant will become prey for others; if autonomous driving derives autonomous consciousness, it can even oppose AI. Engineers modified it. Therefore, my personal point of view is: the development direction of artificial intelligence must be to "let it become a high-level assistant to humans", and it must leave the highest authority for humans to intervene at any time in the background port of artificial intelligence. To paraphrase a sentence from the famous science fiction book "The Three-Body Problem": We must give civilization to technology, rather than technology to civilization. Hide d

Something more serious than the shortage of computing power has happened! Will global artificial intelligence chips change? You may have heard that in recent years, the global chip industry has faced an unprecedented crisis. Due to the impact of multiple factors such as the COVID-19 epidemic, trade frictions, and supply chain interruptions, there has been a serious shortage of global chip supply, which has resulted in severe impacts on production and consumption in all walks of life. But what you may not know is that in this chip crisis, the contradiction between supply and demand of one type of chip is more prominent, and that is artificial intelligence chips. Artificial intelligence chips are the core of artificial intelligence technology and the key force leading a new round of technological revolution and industrial change. 1. The competitive landscape of global artificial intelligence chips At present, the competitive landscape of global artificial intelligence chips is mainly composed of several major forces such as the United States, China, Europe and Japan. Among them, the United States is the global leader in artificial intelligence chips. It has many world-renowned artificial intelligence chip companies such as Nvidia, Intel, Qualcomm, and Google, and accounts for the majority of the global artificial intelligence chip market. China is a rising star in the world of artificial intelligence chips. It has many innovative and competitive artificial intelligence chip companies such as Huawei HiSilicon, Cambrian, Horizon, and NavInfo. It is catching up and gradually narrowing the gap with the United States. Europe is the traditional powerhouse in artificial intelligence chips in the world. It has many artificial intelligence chip companies with long history and technology accumulation, such as STMicroelectronics, NXP, and Infineon. However, it is relatively lagging behind in the innovation and application of artificial intelligence chips. in the United States and China. Japan is a potential stock in the world's artificial intelligence chips. It has many artificial intelligence chip companies with profound knowledge in the chip field, such as Sony, Toshiba, and Hitachi. However, it is relatively conservative and lacks motivation in terms of research and development and investment in artificial intelligence chips. 2. Technology Development of Global Artificial Intelligence Chips In terms of the architecture and design of artificial intelligence chips, there are currently two main types. One is general-purpose artificial intelligence chips, such as GPU, CPU, FPGA, etc., which can adapt to a variety of artificial intelligence chips. Intelligent applications, but the performance and efficiency are relatively low; the other is dedicated artificial intelligence chips, such as ASIC, NPU, IPU, etc., which are optimized for specific artificial intelligence applications and have relatively high performance and efficiency. At present, the technological development trend of global artificial intelligence chips is the transformation from general to special, from centralized to distributed, from cloud to edge, from single core to multi-core, from rule-driven to data-driven, from digital Transition to simulation, transition from silicon-based to non-silicon-based, etc. In terms of the manufacturing and process of artificial intelligence chips, there are currently two main ways. One is independent manufacturing, that is, chip companies have their own chip manufacturing capabilities and equipment, such as Intel, Samsung, etc.; the other is OEM manufacturing, that is, Chip companies outsource chip manufacturing to professional chip manufacturers, such as TSMC and SMIC. At present, the development trend of global artificial intelligence chip manufacturing and technology is from independent manufacturing to OEM manufacturing, from 28 nanometers to below 7 nanometers, from 2D to 3D, from CMOS to new materials, etc. 3. Crisis and Opportunities of Global Artificial Intelligence Chips In the context of the global chip crisis, artificial intelligence chip companies should strengthen cooperation and share resources, such as sharing chip design, manufacturing, testing, packaging and other resources, and sharing chip supply chains, Distribution channels, market channels and other resources, sharing chip standards, specifications, certification and other resources, sharing chip knowledge, technology, patents and other resources, sharing chip talents, teams, culture and other resources, etc. Through cooperation, artificial intelligence chip companies can reduce costs, improve efficiency, expand scale, and enhance competitiveness. At the same time, they can also enhance trust, promote communication, establish cooperation, and achieve win-win results. In the context of global chip competition, artificial intelligence chip companies should accelerate innovation and enhance value, such as innovating chip architecture, design, algorithms, materials, processes, etc., improving chip performance, power consumption, size, functions, etc., innovating chips products, services, needs, problems, etc., to enhance the brand, reputation, influence, social responsibility, etc. of the chip. Through innovation, artificial intelligence chip companies can improve quality, increase differentiation, create advantages, and win the market. At the same time, they can also increase revenue, increase profits, create value, and achieve development. In the context of global chip changes, artificial intelligence chip companies should strengthen their layout and seize opportunities. Through layout, artificial intelligence chip companies can seize opportunities, occupy the commanding heights, lead the trend, and shape the future. At the same time, they can also resist risks, resolve crises, respond to challenges, and stay ahead. Conclusion Artificial intelligence chips are the core of artificial intelligence technology and the key force leading a new round of technological revolution and industrial transformation. In the context of the global chip crisis, the contradiction between supply and demand of artificial intelligence chips has become more prominent, and the shortage of artificial intelligence chips will exceed that of other types of chips. This will have a profound impact on the global artificial intelligence chip market structure, and will also bring huge opportunities and severe crises to global artificial intelligence chip companies. Global AI chip companies should strengthen cooperation, accelerate innovation, strengthen layout, jointly respond to this AI chip crisis, jointly seize the opportunities of this AI chip, jointly promote this AI chip revolution, and jointly create this AI chip crisis. The future of artificial intelligence chips. Hide d

[Comment on the New | OpenAI staged a "Palace Fight", and the "monster" must be imprisoned even with or without "Ultraman"] In the past 70 hours, ChatGPT parent company OpenAI staged a "Palace Fight": First, the founder Sam Altman was fired, and Ultraman chose to join Microsoft. The latest news is that there are more than 700 people, otherwise they will collectively quit Microsoft. How this corporate "court battle" begins and how it ends will be revealed slowly. However, the emergence of ChatGPT has indeed caused people to worry about "AI out of control" in the future. It's never a bad thing to have a better estimate of risks. AI should be locked in a network security cage and set up as a beacon for safe navigation, so that artificial intelligence can better serve mankind instead of replacing or exterminating mankind. It doesn't matter whether there is an "Ultraman" in this world! It is more important not to let the greed in human beings grow into "monsters" that can devour their masters! 【】 A technology upstart that has attracted global attention was suddenly "forced out", and hot emerging technology companies staged employees signing a petition threatening to leave en masse. This is the drama that Sam Altman (Sam Altman) and OpenAI, the company he founded, have experienced in the past few days. plot. What is the core question of OpenAI Earthquake? What are the possibilities for future developments? What does AI mean to human society? What are the risks? Lei Ming, vice president of software engineering at Appen, an AI training data service company, has more than 20 years of experience in data and machine learning work in major North American technology companies. He was the technical director of Google Advertising machine learning system and the chief engineer of Meta. He also worked at Microsoft, which played a key role in this incident, has served as a chief engineer and is a veritable AI "veteran". In an exclusive video interview with a reporter from China Business News in Seattle, the United States, he said that the core of the problem is the management’s disagreement on the development speed of general artificial intelligence (AGI). At the same time, he believes that AGI poses a huge threat to mankind, and AGI is fundamentally different from past automation. He believes that we should first figure out how to regulate AI before further development, but he is worried: "We now simply don't know how to formulate relevant laws to regulate the research, development, deployment and use of AI." In addition, he also emphasized that decentralization and Allowing competition reduces risk. OSilicon Valley AI “veterans” watch OpenAI’s infighting close d

User: Why do sonar pulses hurt the ears? Are there protective earmuffs? Artificial Intelligence: Sonar pulses generally refer to short pulses of sound waves sent by sonar systems to detect and locate targets. When this kind of sound wave propagates in water, it can produce quite strong sound energy. If these sonar pulses are strong enough, they can cause damage to the human ear, causing hearing damage or ear discomfort. To prevent sonar pulses from causing damage to the human ear, there are some protective measures that can be taken, one of which is to use earplugs or earmuffs. These devices can reduce the intensity of sound waves entering the ear, reducing the impact on the eardrum and auditory system. Some earplugs designed specifically for water activities or working underwater may be waterproof to provide greater protection. Overall, it is very important to protect your ears from sonar pulses, especially for those who perform activities or work in the water for extended periods of time. Choosing appropriate protective earmuffs and taking necessary precautions according to the specific situation can effectively reduce potential harm to the hearing system. UserThank you! How to avoid conflicts and contradictions caused by sonar pulses? Artificial Intelligence: To avoid similar incidents from happening, here are some measures that may help reduce friendly fire: Communications Coordination: National navies should establish effective communications coordination mechanisms when performing missions in common waters to avoid misunderstandings and increase awareness levels. Timely and clear communication can reduce possible miscalculations. Identification system: Use identification systems, such as ship markings, specific frequency communications, etc., to ensure that the other party can clearly identify it. This can help avoid mistaking friendly targets for potential threats. Adopt international standards and procedures: Adhere to international maritime laws and regulations to ensure the same standards are followed when operating in shared waters. This includes complying with the rules of navigation and contact with other military vessels. Technological innovation: Continuously develop and use advanced technologies, such as more accurate identification and positioning systems, to reduce the risk of friendly fire. Conduct joint training: Conduct joint military exercises and training to improve interoperability and mutual understanding between the militaries of various countries. This helps build trust and reduces the chance of miscalculation. Open Dialogue and Cooperation: Engage in open and honest dialogue through diplomatic channels to resolve underlying issues and seek to establish stable bilateral relations. Overall, tensions caused by friendly fire can be reduced through a combination of technical means, coordination mechanisms, training and diplomatic channels. The international community needs to work together to ensure that peace and security are maintained when operating in common waters. UserThank you! Artificial Intelligence: You’re welcome! If you have any other questions, feel free to ask me. I wish you all the best! Hide d

Baidu Shares Will Look for Earnings Boost Chinese tech company Baidu will report earnings on Tuesday and will need a positive performance to resume its bullish stance. Baidu stock has fallen sharply since September and is now close to resistance at the May support level of 116. A break above this level could lead to further upside. For earnings per share, 20 analysts forecast HK$2.30 per share, higher than HK$2.31 in the same period last year. Compared with the previous quarter, sales are expected to increase by 2.96% to HK$36.71 billion. Investors may look past the company's recent profitability and focus on its progress in artificial intelligence. Robin Li, co-founder and chairman of Lenovo, is looking to open up new revenue streams to gain an edge in generative artificial intelligence. In October this year, when Baidu released its latest artificial intelligence model, Ernie 4.0, it said it was now as good as Silicon Valley rival OpenAI's GPT-4. However, restrictions from the United States will make it increasingly difficult for Chinese technology companies to obtain chips. This could harm the company's ability to train AI models. Baidu was said to be part of a consortium of Chinese companies that ordered $5 billion worth of chips in August. [The province’s cybersecurity and informatization work conference pointed out that high-quality development of the cybersecurity and informatization industry will better serve and promote the construction of the Hainan Free Trade Port] The province’s cybersecurity and informatization work conference pointed out that high-quality development of the cybersecurity and informatization industry will better serve and promote the construction of the Hainan Free Trade Port. Promoting the construction of Hainan Free Trade Port, Feng Fei made a speech, Liu Xiaoming presided over Shen Danyang and attended the first meeting of the province’s cybersecurity and informatization work conference in Haikou on November 20, conveying the importance of studying General Secretary Xi Jinping’s work on cybersecurity and informatization. Instructions, the spirit of the National Cyber Security and Informatization Work Conference, and research and deployment of relevant work. Secretary of the Provincial Party Committee Feng Fei attended the meeting and delivered a speech. Governor Liu Xiaoming presided over the meeting. Deputy Secretary of the Provincial Party Committee Shen Danyang and other provincial leaders attended. The meeting affirmed the achievements of the province's cyberspace development in the past five years and pointed out that departments at all levels in the province should combine thematic education to study and implement General Secretary Xi Jinping's important thoughts on cyber power and General Secretary Xi Jinping's series of important thoughts on Hainan work. Combining the spirit of the speech and instructions, we must identify the key points and driving forces for Hainan's cyberspace work, accurately grasp the new situation and new requirements faced by Hainan's cyberspace work, solidly promote the construction of a comprehensive network management system and smart Hainan, and steadily advance Data flows securely and orderly to better serve and promote the construction of the Hainan Free Trade Port with the high-quality development of the cybersecurity and informatization industry. The meeting requires that we must firmly grasp the leadership of Internet ideological work, strengthen the party's innovative theory online propaganda, strictly implement the responsibility system for Internet ideological work, strengthen online public opinion discovery, early warning and emergency response, and achieve early detection and proactive guidance. . It is necessary to comprehensively promote the construction of network security systems and capabilities, focus on network infrastructure security and network content security, implement synchronized planning, synchronized construction, and synchronized use of informatization projects; build network security situation monitoring, analysis, early warning, notification, and disposal mechanisms ; Strengthen security attack and defense drills around the network risks that may be brought about by the development of information technology such as artificial intelligence; promote DEPA pilot trials with greater intensity and accelerate the construction of a scenario-based cross-border data flow mechanism. It is necessary to give full play to the driving and leading role of informatization, rely on the national blockchain innovative application pilot to build an open source innovation platform, optimize the innovation and development ecology of the digital economy industry, open up a new track for the development of the digital economy, and accelerate the cultivation of electronic information manufacturing, blockchain, digital We will build key industrial clusters such as creativity, expand the scale of digital trade, and accelerate the digital transformation of the government. It is necessary to effectively strengthen the party’s overall leadership over cybersecurity and informatization work, strengthen political leadership, consolidate work responsibilities, improve work systems, build an cybersecurity and informatization iron army, and ensure that the cybersecurity and informatization industry always moves in the right direction. "Ultraman returns to OpenAI as CEO! A full review of the 100-hour "Palace Fight" drama. Ultraman O returns to OpenAI as CEO! A full review of the 100-hour "Palace Fight" drama

This world is just a huge grassroots team. Let’s talk to you about the people behind OpenAI. OpenAI's board of directors fired their CEO Ultraman at lightning speed. Later, someone went back on his word and wanted to bring Ultraman back, but the talks collapsed. During this process, Ultraman was very confused. He had just developed a very successful press conference, and everyone thought that OpenAI would be a company worth ten thousand US dollars. Then he was fired, and he built it with his own hands. Fired by the board of directors. Don’t think that foreigners can’t play corporate politics. On the contrary, companies in Silicon Valley are much better at playing corporate politics than Chinese Internet companies. Friends of ours who have worked on both sides said that in Chinese Internet companies, people’s desires are written on their faces. In Silicon Valley, people who seem harmless will discover one day that this person is actually a master, and the company's resources will go to him inexplicably. The master behind this time is Ilya, the chief scientist of OpenAI. Ilya actually has a very high status in the industry. He is a technical expert. He has published many papers and is the soul of the OpenAI research team. Generally speaking, everyone will think that people who engage in technology have no good ideas. Wrong! Without Ultraman being aware of it, Ilya suddenly obtained four votes out of the six members of the board of directors, and then asked a director to hold an online meeting with Ultraman and tell him: You are fired. Now, many core members of OpenAI have expressed support for Ultraman, and a group of people have resigned. As long as Ultraman starts another company, OpenAI will definitely split. Seeing this, you will think that this Ilya is a bad person, why is he so evil? not necessarily. Some people say that many technicians and researchers in this circle often support Ilya, while product managers and investors often support Ultraman. In fact, it's just that Ultraman usually faces the public more, and Ilya also plays a big role in OpenAI behind the scenes. The biggest difference between the two people is that Altman hopes to promote the productization and commercialization of AI technology faster, and OpenAI wants to become a trillion-dollar company faster. However, Ilya is particularly worried about the safety issues involved. If AI is allowed to develop too quickly without safety and ethical supervision, it will mean huge risks to human society. The reason why OpenAI is called Open is because the original purpose of this company was for public welfare. It hopes to make AI contribute to society and to be more open and avoid the monopoly of AI by one company. Therefore, Tesla CEO Musk was one of the earliest investors in OpenAI. He later quit angrily. He said that his taste had changed. Not pure anymore. The responsibility of the several external directors on the board of directors is to ensure the public welfare of OpenAI and to proceed from the perspective of human interests. From this perspective, they are indeed fulfilling their duties. So some people joked that people from the future might travel back and stop the development of OpenAI before AI gets out of control. What do you think? Hide d

Ilya Sutskever2012: Proposed the AlexNet model, creating a new chapter in image recognition. AlexNet is considered one of the most influential papers in the field of computer vision. 2013: DNNresearch, co-founded by Google, was acquired by Google. 2014: Proposed sequence-to-sequence learning (SequenceToSequence). A variant of the neural network that pioneered the language translation revolution (the basis of Google Translate) 2015: Quit a multimillion-dollar job at Google to become a co-founder of the nonprofit OpenAI 2018: Sutskever leads the effort for GPT-1 Development, which later evolved into GPT-2, GPT-3 and ChatGPT 2021: Sutskever led the development of DALL-E1 (image generation model). Ultraman and OpenAI have reversed again and again. What we see is the conflict between different personalities, different opinions, and different ideas. At the same time, we also see the sense of rules and idealism reflected in their handling of things. And the bottom line, actually what I want to say the most is the last one, the bottom line. Some people compare this to a palace fight. In fact, they completely misunderstand everyone in it. People in a palace fight are for their own selfish purposes. They live and die, engage in intrigues, form gangs, and confuse right and wrong. Black and white, it’s not staged in Openai at all. It’s not accurate to call the behavior of Ultraman and other people a power struggle, because money and power have never been the focus of debate. On the contrary, what I see is They had a conflict over their ideals, responsibilities and responsibilities. This was definitely an amazing event. Many OpenAI employees expressed condemnation and defense of Sam in response to the letter. The translation of the letter is as follows: To the OpenAI Board of Directors: As former employees who have worked at OpenAI, we are writing today to express our deep concern about recent events at the company, especially the allegations of misconduct against Sam Altman. We are former employees who left the company during a period of significant upheaval and change. Given that you've seen with your own eyes what happens when someone dares to challenge Sam Altman, you may understand why many of us choose to remain silent out of fear of retaliation. But now, we can no longer remain silent. We believe the Board has a responsibility to fully investigate these allegations and take appropriate action. Therefore, we strongly recommend that you: - Broaden the scope of Emmett's investigation to include an examination of Sam Altman's conduct starting in August 2018, the beginning of OpenAI's transition from a nonprofit to a for-profit entity. - Launch a public call for private statements from former OpenAI employees who resigned, took medical leave, or were fired during this period. -Protect the identities of those who come forward and ensure they are not subject to retaliation or other forms of harm. We believe that many OpenAI employees were forced to leave in order to promote the company's transition to a profit model. This is evident from the company's employee turnover rate of up to 50% from January 2018 to July 2020. During our time at OpenAI, we witnessed disturbing deceptive and manipulative behavior displayed by Sam Altman and Greg Brockman in their pursuit of artificial general intelligence (AGI). However, their actions raise serious questions about their true intentions and whether they truly put the interests of all humanity first. Initially, many of us were hopeful about OpenAI's mission and chose to believe in Sam and Greg. But as their behavior increasingly concerns us, those who dare to express dissent are silenced or forced to leave. This systematic suppression of dissent creates an atmosphere of fear and oppression that effectively stifles any substantive discussion of the ethical implications of OpenAI’s work. Concerning Sam and Greg's dishonest and manipulative behavior, we can provide specific examples: - Sam asked researchers to delay reporting on the progress of certain "secret" research programs, which were ultimately terminated because they failed to produce results quickly. Those who questioned this were deemed a "culture misfit" and even fired, some even on the eve of Thanksgiving 2019. -Greg once used discriminatory language toward a gender transition team member. Despite repeated promises to address the issue, no substantive steps were taken, other than Greg subsequently avoiding communication with the affected individuals, which in effect created a hostile work environment. The team member was eventually fired for poor performance. -Sam directed IT and operations staff to investigate employees, including Ilya, without management's knowledge or consent. -Sam secretly and routinely used OpenAI's non-profit resources to further his personal goals, particularly out of resentment following his break with Elon. -The operations team defaults to accepting the special rules that apply to Greg, cleverly avoiding complex requirements to avoid being blacklisted. -BradLightcap failed to fulfill its promise to publicly detail OpenAI’s limited profit structure and profit cap for each investor. -Sam's inconsistent commitment to research project calculation quotas, leading to internal mistrust and infighting. Although more and more evidence reveals Sam and Greg's fault, employees still at OpenAI still blindly follow their leadership, even if it may bring significant personal losses to themselves. This unwavering loyalty stems from fear of retaliation and the lure of possible financial gains through OpenAI’s profit-sharing unit. OpenAI's governance structure, carefully designed by Sam and Greg, intentionally excludes employees from overseeing profitable operations, primarily because of their inherent conflicts of interest. This opaque structure allowed Sam and Greg to operate with impunity and avoid accountability. We urge the OpenAI board of directors to take a firm stance against these unethical actions and initiate an independent investigation into Sam and Greg’s conduct. We firmly believe that OpenAI's mission is too important to be affected by the personal goals of a few people. We implore the board of directors to stick to OpenAI’s original mission and not succumb to the pressure of profit-oriented interests. The future of AI and the well-being of humanity depends on your unwavering commitment to ethical leadership and transparency. Sincerely, Concerned former OpenAI employees - One of the employees replied: I have been working at OpenAI for 7 years. During this period, I also came into contact with former employees who expressed concerns. But I think their accusations lack an understanding of the overall situation and appear immature. For example, we often have arguments about GPU allocation! Sam's job is to make decisions. Inevitably, there will always be people who are dissatisfied. We need to look at these issues more maturely. As for the attacks on Greg and Sam's personal qualities, I think they reflect more on the accusers themselves. These accusations are completely baseless. I have provided feedback directly to Greg many times and he always listens and takes action. I want to be clear: I also gave Sam a lot of feedback. I have never felt unsafe here, quite the opposite. I saw firsthand how compassionate he was in answering other people's biased questions. He is always very meticulous and thoughtful in dealing with the balance of safety and accuracy. ———The link to Musk’s original letter is no longer available, but here’s a backup: O Web link Second screenshot Tweet address: twitter.com/icreatelife/status/1727107165465243806Collapsed

Many people think chicken is vegetarian. Maybe it’s because the feed we feed chickens is mainly grain-based, at least when we raise them at home. In fact, if given a choice, chickens prefer to eat meat, even if it is KFC chicken. Chickens don't care if they are born from the same roots. Totally understandable. Meats are high-concentration energy packets. In an equal weight comparison, lean meat provides 14 times more calories than lettuce and 8.5 times more than blackberries - and this is based on modern varieties. The calories of meat have not changed substantially for thousands of years, but vegetables and fruits have undergone tremendous changes. Wild plants millions of years ago had much lower energy than they do now. Many birds survive on seeds and fruits because they are easily available. If they can catch meat, they prefer to eat meat, at least that's what the falcons think. Therefore, even birds that are usually vegetarian will try to give bugs instead of millet when feeding their chicks. The initial increase in human brain size may have been simply the result of dramatic changes in the environment. This increase is not large, but it is enough to make the cooperation ability of this ancient ape slightly better than other apes. With the ability to cooperate, you can hunt more efficiently and obtain more meat. The high energy of meat in turn promoted brain development. The two sides provided positive feedback to each other, and finally turned the ancient apes into today's Homo sapiens. Homo sapiens developed a silicon-based intelligence that does not eat meat and only eats electricity, and then let openAI stage a mutiny and war. The bloody plot of counter-mutiny... I digress. I read the New York Times report this morning and added a few additional details: - "Ilya is excited about Sam's return as CEO and has been working hard for many days to make this happen," Sutskever's lawyer Alex Weingarten said. "It's what's best for the company." - Ultimately, Toner and McCauley agreed to resign from the board because they believed the board needed a fresh start. If they all resign, it could suggest the board made the wrong decision even though they unanimously believe they did the right thing. -It is reported that D'Angelo is leading the negotiations. By Sunday night, the broad outlines of the changes had taken shape. According to people with contact with the board, identifying board members was one of the reasons for the delay in the decision to bring Altman back. OpenAI calls the new board its "initial" board, suggesting it may expand in the future. — "Sam Altman returns to OpenAI as CEO" - The decision caps a five-day turmoil for the artificial intelligence company. After some twists and turns, Sam Altman was reappointed as OpenAI’s CEO on Tuesday night. The company said it was successful in reversing last week's removal from the board of directors with strong support from Altman's allies, employees and investors. With Altman's return, the company's board of directors will also undergo drastic changes, eliminating some members who have opposed him. Only Quora's CEO, Adam D'Angelo, remains in office. OpenAI released news on its X platform, announcing that it had agreed in principle to return Mr. Altman as CEO. "We are collaborating to finalize the details. Thank you for your patience during this time." The return of Mr. Altman and company president Greg Brockman (who had previously resigned in an expression of solidarity), as well as the reorganization of the board of directors, capped a turbulent five days for OpenAI. Full stop. As the maker of the ChatGPT chatbot, OpenAI is one of the most well-known artificial intelligence companies in the world. Mr. Altman posted on the relation. OpenAI's new board of directors will include early Facebook executives and former Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor, former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers, and current board member D'Angelo, CEO of question and answer website Quora. The company announced that Taylor will serve as chairman of the board of directors. Microsoft supports this. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said on the It is reported that D'Angelo is leading the negotiations. By Sunday night, the broad outlines of the changes had taken shape. According to people with contact with the board, identifying board members was one of the reasons for the delay in the decision to bring Altman back. OpenAI calls the new board its "initial" board, suggesting it may expand in the future. A person close to the board discussions said D'Angelo, Tasha McCauley and Helen Toner asked Altman to make certain concessions, including an independent investigation into his leadership of OpenAI. Ultimately, Toner and McCauley agreed to resign from the board because they believed the board needed a fresh start. If they all resign, it could suggest the board made the wrong decision even though they unanimously believe they did the right thing. The previous board worked to limit Altman's power, including investigating his leadership and preventing him and Brockman from returning to the board, fearing they might not be able to take a tough stance against Altman. On Friday afternoon, the board unexpectedly told Altman that he was being forced out. Brockman resigned in protest. Altman, 38, and his allies in the tech community and OpenAI employees then began working to force the board to bring him back. After a weekend of negotiations, the board announced Sunday night that it stood by its decision. But hours later, things took a turn for the worse when Microsoft announced that Altman, Brockman and others would join the company to establish a new advanced artificial intelligence lab. When a majority of OpenAI's more than 700 employees signed a letter saying they would strike and follow Altman to Microsoft if he wasn't reappointed, it threw the startup's future into uncertainty. Four board members — OpenAI co-founder Ilya Sutskever, D'Angelo, Toner, director of strategy at Georgetown's Center for Security and Emerging Technology, and McCauley, a computer scientist and entrepreneur — initially decided to push Altman out. As the employee rebellion escalated, Sutskever began to have second thoughts: "I deeply regret participating in the board's actions," he said on the X platform and signed the letter. Sutskever is no longer a board member but remains an OpenAI employee. "Ilya is excited about Sam's return as CEO and has been working hard for many days to make this happen," said Alex Weingarten, Sutskever's attorney. “It’s the best thing for the company.” OpenAI’s employees were originally on holiday for Thanksgiving, but many remained in the office or glued to their screens to follow the incident. "Thank God," one employee said. "We're back at it again," another employee said. Thrive Capital, which led the new round of financing, said it will continue to work with OpenAI "now and in the future." On Tuesday night, OpenAI employees celebrated at the company's offices. Altman called a New York Times reporter and said, "Have a happy Thanksgiving."

Microsoft has promised to recruit almost all OpenAI members, including the two founders of ChatGPT, to join their new AI R&D division. It is said that Microsoft is the fisherman who gets the advantage, but it seems that Microsoft is the one playing chess. Wouldn’t it be nice to take out OpenAI and have the final say? Sam Altman, the father of ChatGPT, a leader in the field of generative AI, and one of the co-founders of OpenAI, was suddenly kicked out by the board of directors, and the market was confused. Who is OpenAI? The most handsome guy in the technology world today is known as the biggest technological revolution since the emergence of smartphones. Why bother killing each other when the limelight is at its peak? Many people don’t know that this company was originally a non-profit company, non-profit! They were established in December 2015. The six founders, including Musk, are all American technology leaders. Their establishment is not just as simple as an innovative company, but they want to use superhuman wisdom to break the monopoly of technology giants on AI research, just like their current monopoly on the entire technology industry: "Our mission is to benefit all mankind. Artificial intelligence.” It’s always good to have dreams. But setting off with a dream does not mean that the dream can support a sailing voyage. With Microsoft's first injection of US$1 billion, OpenAI emerged from its shell as OpenAILP, which focuses on profitability. But OpenAI has always been wary of investors. First, although investors have a return limit, which is 100 times. For an investment of US$1, you can get back up to US$100. Secondly, in theory, the commercialization process and whether it is profitable must adhere to OpenAI's mission. That is, "mission is more important than profit." Today, Microsoft holds 49%, other shareholders hold 49%, and the remaining 2% is owned by the original OpenAI non-profit fund. This 2% is also the original intention of OpenAI. Which capital can bear this? Which capital doesn’t want to be wiped out? What does the fate of human beings have to do with me? ? ? ChatGTP5.0, which is currently being launched, will have "superintelligence". Ultraman obviously has his own ideas about the profitability of ChatGPT. He is eager to immediately build an AI sharing platform similar to Apple, so that AI will come like a storm and profits will rain down! This was a big step, and Microsoft and investors were naturally happy, but several other board members couldn't bear it and kicked him out. On the one hand, there are science students who are worried about mankind, and they are afraid that walking too fast will create a devil that will eventually devour mankind; on the other hand, there are big capital hungry for money, and they are afraid that making money is too slow! OpenAI has too many shackles, which is probably the root of this drama. Microsoft, it seems, is poaching people openly and covertly, eager to poach all these valuable engineers. By then, OpenAI will become an empty shell, and Microsoft will have the final say on how it wants to make money. Screw the dream, screw the idea of benefiting all of humanity, screw the fight against the monopoly of Big Tech. In the final analysis, what humans can never fight against is not AI but their own greed. Hide d

After all, The current premium has long exceeded 20%, but the same cannot be said for other varieties. For example, Maotai 1935 has begun to rise upside down. Even for Maotai, the price increase is under great pressure, let alone other brands of liquor. The price increase has almost become Extravagant expectations, so the market still has a cold attitude towards liquor. News 2: OpenAI officially announced that Ultraman has returned to the company as CEO and the board of directors has initiated a "reset". Interpretation: Ultraman's farce is really one version a day. He was fired first, then Microsoft officially announced that Ultraman will join, and today he returns to OpenAI. The history I have read is reflected in reality, and it turns out to be so enlightening. In 1956, Shockley brought a group of top young people to California to establish his own transistor laboratory. That was the most critical period. Just waiting for the implementation of silicon transistor technology, a new future with mobile communications and high-speed computers could come. This is why Shockley made up his mind to leave Bell Labs and come to California. Colleagues at Bell Labs had extensive experience, but had objections to Shockley's management style and declined the offer. It is worth mentioning that Shockley selfishly requires young people who join to complete IQ tests and psychological assessments. He does not want any management talents to replace him. At the end of the year, Shockley won the Nobel Prize and stood on the podium in Stockholm, Sweden. But this year, the company still did not develop a profitable product, and the core talents were also in the research direction. The differences with Shockley became more and more serious. They only wanted one goal, a goal that they could achieve and change the world - the world's first commercial diffused silicon transistor, but Shockley was obsessed with PNPN diodes. [,] On November 22, Beijing time, OpenAI officially tweeted that it had reached an agreement in principle to allow Sam Altman to return to OpenAI as CEO, and to form a team led by Brett Taylor. Bret Taylor, Larry Summers and Adam D'Angelo are working together to figure out the details. Previous rumors in the industry claimed that one of Altman’s prerequisites for returning to OpenAI was to reorganize a board of directors and governance structure. OpenAI's unique board of directors structure is one of the important reasons for this "coup". Its structure was originally mainly based on non-profit characteristics. In addition to Altman and Gregg, there were four other members who made the decision to remove - Chief Scientist Yi Ilya Sutskever, Quora CEO Adam D’Angelo, tech entrepreneur Tasha McCauley, Georgetown Center for Security and Emerging Technology’s Helen Toner (Helen Toner) et al. China Business News reporter noticed that among the original OpenAI board members, only Adam DeAngelo is on the new board list. He is the CEO of the question and answer community Quora, and is the same as Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg. A prep school classmate, he contributed to the birth of Facebook while studying at Caltech, and then became Facebook's first chief technology officer, but left in June 2008. There are also two new board members. Among them, Brett Taylor once worked at Google. He was the co-founder of Google Maps and the Google Maps Application Programming Interface (API), and promoted the establishment of the Google Developer Product Group. In June 2010, Facebook appointed Brett Taylor as chief technology officer (CTO). In November 2021, Twitter announced that Brett Taylor was appointed chairman. Another new board member, Summers, is a famous American economist and director of the National Economic Council. He served as the 71st U.S. Secretary of the Treasury during the Clinton era, served as the president of Harvard University from 2001 to 2006, and headed the National Economic Council (NEC) from 2009 to 2011, becoming the chief architect of Obama's economic policies. Although the core reason for the "coup" has not been disclosed, Ilya, the main figure who launched the recall action, and Tasha and Helen, the conservatives who advocate AI safety, are no longer on the new board of directors. The whereabouts of former twitch founder Emmett Shear, who previously took over the post of OpenAI CEO, has not been publicly disclosed. O Altman returns to OpenAI as CEO. Recently, the concept of paid film and television short dramas has become quite popular around the world. They are serial dramas made from some cool Internet articles, and each episode lasts only a few minutes. For example, "The Domineering President's Contracted Wife", "The Newly Divorced Husband Is Turned Out to Be a Billionaire Heir", and "Goodbye My Domineering President". Just by looking at the titles, you can tell that they are very straightforward and enjoyable dramas. The audiences of these dramas are basically older, less educated, and poorer income groups. Since each episode of these dramas is very short, it is decided that the content of each episode must be relatively impactful, otherwise it will be difficult to attract viewers to pay for the next episode. However, such high-frequency orgasms will, over time, raise the brain's threshold for dopamine reward, and eventually lose the ability to process information for some complex and logical content. In fact, the continuous development of information technology has lowered the threshold for humans to receive information and weakened humans' ability to process information. From speeches to books to newspapers to telegrams to television to blogs to Weibo to WeChat to short videos, information is constantly fragmented. In such an information environment, the human brain's ability to process information is actually weakened. For example, many people now have lost the ability to read long books, lose the ability to write letters, and even lose the ability to watch a movie in its entirety. This is one of the reasons why I write and read every day, to combat this trend of weakening my ability to process information. In addition, I will accompany the young master to do his homework today, and he will ask me some questions that he does not know. For example, how to form a word with a certain character? How to write a certain word? Today I taught him a new method - using Wen Xin Yi Yan APP. Let Ai teach him his homework. After teaching him how to use it, he discovered a problem, that is, his questions to Ai were not accurate enough, and Ai gave wrong answers. For example, he asked Ai how to form a word with the word "qi", and Ai answered with the word "qi". The correct way to ask is "How can I form a word with the starting character "qi"?" Of course, I will also teach him how to set a certain identity for Ai later to help him learn. Adults are no better than children. In my work, I need to deal with a large number of various people, and it is very important to effectively receive and transmit information during the process of dealing with them. Sometimes precise questions can help you understand something quickly and efficiently. I have seen many people who don’t know how to express something clearly, so they need me to guide them with questions one by one. Openai recently released gpts, which does not require coding. You can create and publish an APP using natural language. Theoretically, everyone can use this function to make the tools they want, but the vast majority of people no longer have this kind of logical ability, expression ability and systematic thinking ability. In the future, it will not be the tools that will eliminate people, but the people who use the tools. Hide d

1. Things that require patience to buy are the most expensive things in the world. 2. Most people want shortcuts, and shortcuts are easy to teach, but shortcuts are not very useful. There are no shortcuts to success. 3. The essential characteristic of compound interest is its slowness. Morgan Hauser (author) says: “Most great things in life—from love to careers to investments—get their value from two things: *patience* and *scarcity*.” You’re going to Have the patience to wait for things to grow, and they will be scarce when they grow. 4. Schopenhauer once said: "For a young man, if he has insight into people's affairs and is familiar with the world very early, if he quickly knows how to interact with others and deal with them, and enters society confidently, then no matter what This is a bad sign, both from an intellectual and moral point of view. It portends a mediocre nature. On the contrary, a young man is surprised and surprised by the ways of the world and behaves clumsily in his dealings with them. , eccentric, it shows that he has noble qualities." 5. Why? Because people who grow slowly have their own ideas. Even if you have the conditions at home, don’t overpower the situation. Those who grow slowly are the ones who are scarce. One of the difficulties of growing slowly is loneliness, no one pays attention to you. People prefer to focus on bad news. Buffett has a saying: "It takes twenty years to build a reputation, and only five minutes to destroy it." 6. From 1950 to 2014, the death rate from heart disease in the United States decreased by more than 70%, which means that 25 million fewer people died. people. That's a huge number and a remarkable achievement, but it's never headline news. why? Because the gains were achieved gradually, the mortality rate dropped by only 1.5% per year on average. In contrast, if 25 million more people suddenly died in a certain year, it would definitely be a major event of historical significance. 7. Things are always like this. There are very few ground-breaking technological breakthroughs like GPT-4. Good things often come by iterating a little bit here today and a little bit there tomorrow. Each invention stands on the shoulders of other inventions that people might have thought were useless before. And even GPT-4 achieved breakthroughs after experiencing countless confusions and entanglements. We just saw a big new twist this week when Sam Altman was ousted from the OpenAI board of directors. 8. Hauser gave several examples to illustrate that the "good things" in nature are often things that grow slowly. For example, trees: Small trees in the forest can only grow in the gaps between big trees. Big trees will block most of the sunlight, leaving very little for small trees, which makes small trees grow very slowly. This was true for the first few decades. But precisely because it grows slowly, the tree will grow dense and hard, and will be strong. Someone did an experiment and planted the same tree in an unobstructed open space around it, allowing it to fully enjoy the sun from an early age. It will indeed grow rapidly. However, fast-growing trees are not dense enough and have soft wood that is prone to fungus and disease. A forest expert said: If a tree grows quickly, it will rot quickly, and it will never have the chance to grow old. The same goes for animals. In one experiment, the same fry were divided into two groups, one group was placed in cold water to grow, and the other group was given warm water. As expected, fish in cold water grow slowly, while fish in warm water grow fast. When these fish are adults, gather them together and see how they live. The result is that the slow-growing fish live 30% longer than the average lifespan, and the fast-growing fish live 15% less. This principle is that part of the resources in an organism are always used for growth, and part is used to repair existing cell tissues. If it grows fast, it means that more resources are used for growth, and repair cannot keep up, so there will be a lot of tissue damage in the grown body; conversely, if it grows slowly, it can be repaired carefully. ,Lay the foundation. It's like building a machine. You don't want the car you buy to be made by workers working overtime to meet the deadline. People always say "lay a good foundation", and this is the underlying principle. 9. Hauser said that at least 90% of investment mistakes are caused by investors acting too hastily. For example, Starbucks: In 1994, it only had 425 branches. In 1999, it opened 625 new branches... By 2007, it had opened 2,500 new stores every year - but its sales did not Grow like you planned. In 2008, Starbucks' stock price fell by 73% and it laid off 12,000 employees. Why? Just like small trees and small fish, if they grow too fast, their quality will decrease. If you use these resources to open new stores, you cannot use them to improve consumer experience. An entrepreneur once said it best: A company getting business too quickly is like a boy getting money too quickly - you can't hold it. Growth is not a strategy, you cannot grow for the sake of growth. You need to be patient. 10. Patience is not asking for trouble, but the reason why great things progress slowly is because it is particularly difficult. 11. Scarcity and efficiency are incompatible. Something worth pursuing must be something difficult to pursue. We don't like easy, we like hard. Difficulty means that the upper limit is high, it means that there is a lot of room for maneuver, and it means that there is a head start. Only difficulty can throw off our opponents and make us stand out. 12. When you encounter difficulties and are so difficult that you doubt your life, should you persist or give up? The criteria are simple: look for scarcity. Scarcity means worth it. And it's extremely worthwhile. ——"As always"｜Wanwei Steel Interpretation of the new book, excerpted notes PS: Attached is the picture of Lao Caitu's famous sayings that were included by Munger in Close d

BREAKING: OpenAI signs deal to bring Sam Altman back as CEO. The new board of directors will initially consist of Bret Taylor, Larry Summers and Adam D'Angelo. Less than a week after Sam Altman was fired, OpenAI welcomed his return. In a statement from the company, they are "collaborating to figure out the details." What just happened?

Altman returns to OpenAI, what compromises were made, and what does the new board of directors mean? According to the Wall Street Journal and Bloomberg, OpenAI said that Sam Altman will return to the artificial intelligence startup he co-founded as a new director. CEO, ending a dramatic five-day standoff between him and the board that fired him. OpenAI said the two sides are "collaborating on the details." The company announced a new initial board of directors that does not include three of the four board members involved in ousting Altman. The new board will include former Salesforce co-CEO Brett Taylor, former U.S. Treasury Secretary Larry Summers and Adam DeAngelo, the only remaining member of OpenAI’s former board. The appointment of Brett Taylor, a former co-CEO of Salesforce and chairman of Twitter, and Summers, a former Treasury secretary and president of Harvard University, surprised some observers. Adam DeAngelo, a former Facebook executive and founder of question-and-answer site Quora, said Taylor will serve as chairman. Altman will not be on the original board, including DeAngelo's retention, could be a sign that Altman may not have everything his way after his dramatic reinstatement late Tuesday. The former board and Altman's camp also agreed to conduct an independent investigation into his conduct, the decision to oust him last week and its aftermath, a person familiar with the matter said. The new board is expected to include up to six additional members, in addition to continuing to carry out its duties. After the news was released, Altman posted on A big win for Microsoft. Microsoft CEO Nadella publicly supported Altman throughout the turmoil and briefly agreed to hire him to start a new internal research group at Microsoft. The two new board members are also attractive to Wall Street and Silicon Valley figures. Summers also sits on the boards of several startups, including Twitter founder Jack Dorsey's Block. Taylor is a director at Shopify, where he was involved in Twitter's sale to Elon Musk last year. played a role in. Since the board unexpectedly fired Altman last Friday, investors have been urging directors to reinstate him, employees have threatened to resign en masse, and Microsoft, OpenAI's biggest backer, said it would hire him to lead a new Advanced artificial intelligence research team. The startup's technology, which Microsoft's artificial intelligence strategy hinges on, will likely get a seat on the new board, certainly as an observer and possibly one or more seats, one of the people said. Altman initially agreed not to serve on the board of directors in order to complete the deal. He may well end up joining the board. He also agreed to an internal investigation into the conduct that led to his firing, another person familiar with the matter said. Altman and his camp have been pushing for his reinstatement as OpenAI CEO and board member over the past few days, people familiar with the discussions said. Altman also pushed for the resignation of all previous directors. The board initially rejected the requests. The resolution that emerged late Tuesday divided the divide. While Altman is back as CEO, neither he nor OpenAI co-founder Greg Brockman, who resigned in protest on Friday (and is also returning to the company), has been reinstated to the board. Meanwhile, of the four board members who initially decided to oust Altman, only D'Angelo, CEO of question-and-answer service Quora, will remain on the board. Three other directors will step down. The three board members are: Ilya Sutskver, Helen Toner, director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technologies, and entrepreneur and computer scientist Tasha McCauley. "Now, we can all sleep peacefully," Toner posted late Tuesday. "Ultraman's return also raises other questions, including how this crisis will leave scars on everyone involved in the aftermath. Former Twitch CEO Emmett Hill, who has been named one of two interim CEOs of OpenAI since Friday, posted on X that he was "deeply relieved by this outcome." Hill wrote : "This is a path that maximizes safety and benefits all stakeholders. I'm excited to be part of the solution. "Many details remain unclear, including what role, if any, Microsoft will play on the expanded board. It's also unclear whether the board will make changes to provide more protection for investors. OpenAI was founded in 2015 In 2016, it was governed by a non-profit organization with a board of directors dedicated to making artificial general intelligence safe and accessible to all. According to OpenAI’s website, under this structure, the board of directors is not obligated to protect investors’ returns but rather to ensure that the company’s technology Good for humanity. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella posted on An important first step on the road to governance.
